Briefing

File 0 – Mission Description

The cramped medical office of an Ohio-class nuclear-powered submarine.

Sitting on the bed, naked from head to toe, is Snake.

The door opens. Campbell enters. He's followed by Naomi, dressed in a lab coat.

Flashback: Shot of soldiers forcing Snake onto a helicopter in Alaska.

Naomi begins disinfecting Snake's arm. His body is covered with scars.

Having finished prepping Snake's arm, Naomi produces a large syringe and injects Snake with it. FoxDie now courses through his veins.

Campbell presents Snake with a set of photos.

They consist of long-distance aerial shots and satellite imagery of Shadow Moses Island.

Snake takes the photos and looks down at them.

CAMPBELL


It's been a long time, Snake.

SNAKE


I should have known you were behind this, Colonel.

CAMPBELL


That's no way to greet an old war buddy, Snake.

SNAKE


What do you want from me?

CAMPBELL


I just invited you here so we could have a talk.

SNAKE


Invited!? That's what you call sending armed soldiers after me?

CAMPBELL


Sorry if they were a little rough with you. But we've got a serious situation here. Only you can get us out of it.

SNAKE


I'm retired from FOX-HOUND. You're not my commander anymore and I don't have to take orders from you or anyone else.

CAMPBELL


You will take these orders. I know it.

SNAKE


...

NAOMI


Excuse me...

SNAKE


Who's this?

CAMPBELL


Dr. Naomi Hunter. She's chief of FOX-HOUND's medical staff and an expert in gene therapy
1 .

SNAKE


Are you military?

NAOMI


No, civilian. I've been sent here from ATGC. Pleasure to meet you, Snake.

NAOMI


Don't worry, this injection won't hurt a bit.

SNAKE


What's the shot for?

NAOMI


What's wrong? You don't like shots?

SNAKE


...?

CAMPBELL


Snake, listen up.

CAMPBELL


It all went down five hours ago. Heavily armed soldiers occupied Shadow Moses Island, a remote island off the coast of Alaska.

SNAKE


What soldiers?

CAMPBELL


Next-Generation Special Forces led by members of Unit FOX-HOUND.

SNAKE


...

CAMPBELL


They've presented Washington with a single demand and they say that if it isn't met, they'll launch a nuclear weapon.

SNAKE


A nuclear weapon?

Campbell shows Snake photos of the hostages.
Briefing

File 1 – Operation Outline

*Player selects "Insertion method"

CAMPBELL


I'm afraid so. You see, the island is the site of a secret nuclear weapons disposal facility.

SNAKE


FOX-HOUND hijacking a nuclear weapon!?

CAMPBELL


Now you understand how serious the situation is.

CAMPBELL


You'll have two mission objectives. First, you're to rescue the DARPA
2 Chief, Donald Anderson, and the president of ArmsTech, Kenneth Baker. They're both being held as hostages.

SNAKE


Those are some heavy duty hostages.

CAMPBELL


Secondly, you're to investigate whether or not the terrorists have the ability to launch a nuclear strike and stop them if they do.

CAMPBELL


Any questions, Snake?

SNAKE


Questions? I haven't even said whether I'd accept this mission.

CAMPBELL


Well, you can make up your mind after you hear more about the situation.

SNAKE


Tell me about the nuclear weapon disposal facility.

CAMPBELL


The disposal facility includes a hardened underground base. Even with our most advanced intelligence gathering equipment, we can't tell what's happening inside.

SNAKE


So someone needs to penetrate, gather intelligence, and report back. Sounds like a spy movie...

SNAKE


What's the insertion method?

CAMPBELL


Well, an air insertion is impossible.

SNAKE


Not with this storm going on.

CAMPBELL


We'll approach the disposal facility by sub.

SNAKE


Approach?

CAMPBELL


Yes, within a few miles of it. The facility is equipped with sonar detection capabilities. They'd be able to hear our engine or propeller noise.

CAMPBELL


That could lead to our discovery.

SNAKE


And then?

CAMPBELL


We'll launch a one-man SDV (swimmer delivery vehicle).

SNAKE


Launch?

Hanging next to Snake is the latest version of the Sneaking Suit.

He puts it on.

* Player selects "Time limit"
Shot of a digital clock on the submarine counting down.


Briefing


File 2 – Operation Members

*Player selects "Person in charge of the operation"

Shot of the president video conferencing with aides at the White House.

CAMPBELL


Same as a torpedo. Only this has no propulsion device of its own.

CAMPBELL


After the SDV gets as close as it can, dispose of it. From there on you'll have to swim.

SNAKE


You want me to swim in sub-zero Alaskan water?

CAMPBELL


Don't worry. That suit represents the latest advances in poly-thermal technology.

CAMPBELL


The nuclear weapons disposal facility covers the whole island. I'll instruct you by Codec after you reach your target.

SNAKE


Anyone going with me?

CAMPBELL


As usual, this is a one-man infiltration mission.

SNAKE


Weapons and equipment OSP (on-site procurement)?

CAMPBELL


Yes. This is a top-secret black op. Don't expect any official support.

SNAKE


What's the time limit?

CAMPBELL


24 hours.

CAMPBELL


They say they'll launch after 24 hours.

SNAKE


Do they say what the target will be?

CAMPBELL


So far they haven't mentioned the target.

SNAKE


When did the countdown start?

CAMPBELL


5 hours ago.

SNAKE


Colonel, who are you speaking for?

CAMPBELL


Naturally I'm representing the U.S. Government.

SNAKE


So who's in supervisory control of this operation?

CAMPBELL


... The President of the United States.

SNAKE


Which means that the President must be meeting with his top aides in the basement of the White House about now, huh?

CAMPBELL


No, at this point they're still video conferencing with each other.

SNAKE


If that's a real nuclear warhead, shouldn't they issue a COG
3 ?

CAMPBELL


Not yet. The Secretary of Defense has operational control and is fully aware of the situation.

*Player selects "Support crew"

Photo and profile of Nastasha.

*Player selects "Roy Campbell"

*Player selects "Meryl"

Photo and profile of Meryl.

CAMPBELL


After you infiltrate, if you determine they possess nuclear launch capabilities, a COG will be issued.

SNAKE


Well if they haven't relocated to the nuclear shelter under Mount Washington, I suppose there isn't that much reason to worry yet.

SNAKE


Is the National Security Agency
4 in on this?

CAMPBELL


Yes, and so is the DIA
5 , the Defense Intelligence Agency.

SNAKE


The DIA? I'm starting to get a bad feeling about this.

CAMPBELL


They'll be sending us some support.

SNAKE


We don't need desk jockies. We need a nuclear weapons specialist.

CAMPBELL


Of course. A nuclear weapons specialist has already been assigned to us.

SNAKE


We need backup from a specialist. I'm just an amateur when it comes to nuclear weapons.

CAMPBELL


I know. That's why I've requested the assistance of a military analyst named Nastasha Romanenko. She'll be providing you backup by Codec.

SNAKE


A female analyst?

CAMPBELL


She's built up an impressive record as an advisor for the Nuclear Emergency Search Team. Contact her if you have any questions. She's also an expert on hi-tech weapons.

SNAKE


Where's she working from?

CAMPBELL


At her home in Los Angeles.

SNAKE


California... Seems like a million miles away...

SNAKE


Colonel, you're retired. Why are you involved in this?

CAMPBELL


Because there aren't many people who know FOX-HOUND as well as I do.

SNAKE


Is that really the only reason?

CAMPBELL


I've been soldiering for a long time. I don't know anything else. I guess even though I'm getting a little old, I still love to be in the field.

SNAKE


Colonel, you're a lousy liar. Tell me the real reason.

CAMPBELL


Okay, Snake. Sorry. I'll be frank. A person very dear to me is being held hostage.

SNAKE


Who is it?

CAMPBELL


My niece, Meryl.

SNAKE


What was your niece doing here?

CAMPBELL


Several soldiers were reported missing the day of the revolt, and my niece was one of those called in as an emergency replacement.

SNAKE


She looks like you.
*Player selects "Dr. Naomi"

CAMPBELL


She's my little brother's girl. He died in the Gulf War, and since then I've been watching after her.

SNAKE


A personal motive, Colonel... that's not very soldierly.

CAMPBELL


I'm retired. I'm just an old man now... and I'm your friend.

SNAKE


Since when are we friends?

CAMPBELL


I've thought of us as friends since the fall of Zanzibar.

SNAKE


With my personality, I don't have too many friends.

CAMPBELL


That's what I trust about you. It's what makes you human. Please, Snake! Save my niece, Meryl!

SNAKE


All right. But I have two conditions.

CAMPBELL


Name them.

SNAKE


One, no more secrets between us. I want complete disclosure at all times. And two, I'll only accept orders directly from you, Colonel. No cutoffs involved, okay?

CAMPBELL


Agreed. That's why I was called. But one thing...

SNAKE


What?

CAMPBELL


I'm not a Colonel anymore, just a retired old warhorse.

SNAKE


I understand... Colonel.

SNAKE


That doctor. Is she part of this operation too?

CAMPBELL


She was in charge of FOX-HOUND's gene therapy. She knows more about those men than anyone else.

SNAKE


You mean you've seen them naked?

NAOMI


Make no mistake. I'm not a nurse. I am a scientist.

SNAKE


By the way, what was that injection for?

NAOMI


It's a combination of nanomachines and an anti-freezing peptide so that your blood and other bodily fluids don't freeze, even at subarctic temperatures...

SNAKE


Nanomachines?

NAOMI


Not just one kind either. There are different types which will replenish the supply of adrenaline, nutrition, and sugar in your bloodstream.

SNAKE


Now I don't have to worry about food.

NAOMI


I also put some nootropics in there.

SNAKE


Say what?

NAOMI


Nootropics. A class of drugs which will help improve your mental functioning.

SNAKE


It'll make me smarter, huh? Anything else?

NAOMI


Yes, benzedrine. Its a type of stimulant. It'll keep you alert and responsive for twelve straight hours.


Briefing


File 3 – Detailed Information

*Player selects "Hostages"

Photos and profiles of the DARPA Chief and the ArmsTech president. ArmsTech logo.

Naomi pulls up nanomachine data on her desktop.
*Player selects "Nuclear weapons"

Shot of the nuclear missile.

SNAKE


That was quite a cocktail. Anything else in there?

NAOMI


Those nanomachines will also keep your Codec's batteries charged up.

SNAKE


I guess I can call you when I'm ready to go on a diet.

NAOMI


You're welcome.

SNAKE


The chief of DARPA and the president of an arms manufacturing company...

SNAKE


What business did they have at a nuclear weapons disposal facility?

CAMPBELL


... The truth is that secret exercises were being conducted at the time the terrorist group attacked.

SNAKE


Must be extremely important exercises if those two were directly involved. Were they testing some kind of new advanced weapon?

CAMPBELL


I'm not privy to that information.

SNAKE


Do we know exactly where they're being held?

NAOMI


The DARPA Chief has also been injected with a mini-transmitter. As you get closer, you should be able to pick up his location on your radar.

SNAKE


Do they really have the ability to launch a nuclear missile?

CAMPBELL


They say they do. They even gave us the serial number of the warhead they plan to use.

SNAKE


Was the number confirmed?

CAMPBELL


I'm afraid so. At the very least, they've got their hands on a real nuclear warhead.

SNAKE


Isn't there some kind of safety device to prevent this type of terrorism?

CAMPBELL


Yes, every missile and warhead in our arsenal is equipped with a PAL which uses a discrete detonation code.

SNAKE


PAL?

CAMPBELL


Permissive Action Link. The safety control system built into all nuclear weapons systems.

CAMPBELL


But even so, we can't rest easy.

SNAKE


Why not?

CAMPBELL


Because the DARPA Chief knows the detonation code.

SNAKE


But even if they have a nuclear warhead, it must have been removed from its missile. All the missiles on these disposal sites are supposed to be dismantled. It's not that easy to get your hands on an ICBM.

*Player selects "The terrorists' armament"

*Player selects "The terrorists' demand"

Shot of a legendary soldier in action.

It's an impressive display, but the soldier's face is in shadow.

Shot of a Human Genome Project research environment and data.

Naomi uses a monitor to go over the rest.

CAMPBELL


That used to be true, but since the end of the Cold War, you can get anything if you have enough money and the right connections.

SNAKE


How well armed are these terrorists? I know there was an exercise going on at the time they revolted.

CAMPBELL


They're heavily armed, I'm afraid.

SNAKE


What about their battle experience?

CAMPBELL


The six members of FOX-HOUND in charge are all hardened veterans. They're tough enough to eat nails and ask for seconds.

SNAKE


I wouldn't expect anything less from FOX-HOUND.

CAMPBELL


The others are Next-Generation Special Forces. They're not your average grunts, either.

SNAKE


So, what exactly are they demanding?

CAMPBELL


A person's remains.

SNAKE


Remains?

CAMPBELL


That's right. To be more accurate, cell specimens, which contain the individual's genomic information.

SNAKE


Cell specimens? Why would they want that?

CAMPBELL


The terrorists need them. You see, these Next-Generation Special Forces have been strengthened through gene therapy.

SNAKE


Strengthened?

CAMPBELL


You've heard of the Human Genome Project. They've been mapping the human genome and they're nearly finished.

CAMPBELL


Following up on this research, the military has been working towards identifying those genes which are responsible for making effective soldiers.

SNAKE


There are genes that do that?

CAMPBELL


Yes. And using gene therapy, they're able to transplant those genes into regular soldiers.

SNAKE


Gene therapy?

NAOMI


I'll explain this part.

NAOMI


With gene therapy, we can remove those genes which we know may lead to sickness or disease, and at the same time, splice in genes with beneficial effects, such as resistance to cancer for example.

CAMPBELL


In other words, we can overcome all sorts of genetic diseases, and at the same time, add genetic characteristics as desired.

SNAKE


Okay. And so, if you knew what genes were responsible for making the perfect soldier, you could implant them in the same way, right?

*Player selects "Genetic strengthening"

Shot of the facility where Big Boss's body is in storage.

Scientists pore over his genetic data.

*Player selects "Next-generation special force unit"

NAOMI


Yes... we could.

CAMPBELL


But, it all depends on being able to isolate and identify those "soldier genes."

NAOMI


And, in order to do that, it's helpful if you can study the genomic information of one of the greatest soldiers ever.

SNAKE


One of the greatest soldiers ever?

NAOMI


The man they called the greatest warrior of the 20th century...

SNAKE


You don't mean Big Boss!?

NAOMI


That's right. We've been working feverishly to identify the genes responsible for his incredible combat skill. So far, we've discovered about 60 of the so-called "soldier genes."

SNAKE


So, his body was recovered after all.

CAMPBELL


Yes, and his cells have remained frozen in a cryo-chamber. His genomic information is a priceless treasure to mankind.

SNAKE


Priceless to the military perhaps.

NAOMI


His body was burned severely, but it was possible to restore his DNA profile from just a single strand of his hair.

SNAKE


You people are amazing. And then, you're gonna transplant those genes into soldiers?

NAOMI


Yes, we'll use a process that I discovered called gene targeting. The strongest soldiers don't become what they are by acquiring their skills through training or experience. We now know that hereditary factors are far more crucial for creating superior soldiers.

CAMPBELL


Snake, we can't give them his body. It's potentially more dangerous than all the nuclear warheads on that island put together.

NAOMI


I hear the terrorists are calling themselves "The Sons of Big Boss."

SNAKE


"The Sons of Big Boss..."

SNAKE


Tell me about these Next-Generation Special Forces.

CAMPBELL


They started out as an anti-terrorist special-ops unit made up of former members of biochem units, technical escort units, and the Nuclear Emergency Search Team. Their purpose was to respond to threats involving next-generation weapons of mass destruction, including NBC weapons
6 .

NAOMI


Until "they" were added, that is.

SNAKE


Who's "they"?

CAMPBELL


These guys didn't start out as regular army.
Shot of soldiers undergoing VR training in a simulator.

Shots of Outer Heaven insignia and flashback.

Shot of soldiers undergoing gene therapy.
*Player selects "The reason for unanimous approval"

SNAKE


Looks like a pretty international group. Mercenaries?

CAMPBELL


Yeah, and it gets worse. Most of them were from a merc agency that I think you're familiar with.

CAMPBELL


They were part of Big Boss's private guard. And after Big Boss went down, the military just bought out all their contracts.

SNAKE


Outer Heaven...

CAMPBELL


After that, they were merged with our own VR Unit, "Force 21," and retrained. If you ask me, these so-called "Next-Generation Special Forces" should be called "simulated soldiers." They have no real battle experience.

SNAKE


Video game players, huh?

NAOMI


Don't forget they've all been strengthened with gene therapy. They carry genes which make them excellent soldiers. Don't get careless just because they don't have much experience.

SNAKE


I thought using genetically modified soldiers was prohibited by international law.

NAOMI


Yes, but those are just declarations, not actual treaties.

CAMPBELL


The interesting thing is that nearly every member of the unit conspired in this attack.

SNAKE


How could an entire unit be subverted to rebellion?

NAOMI


They're calling it a revolution.

CAMPBELL


Since they all went through the same gene therapy, they probably felt closer than brothers. They see the unit as their only family.

SNAKE


The Sons of Big Boss... But if they were regular army they must have been interviewed periodically by army counselors...

CAMPBELL


According to their files, they all got straight A's on their psychological tests. They all seemed like fine, upstanding, patriotic soldiers.

SNAKE


But they all took part in the uprising?

CAMPBELL


No. Several people didn't show up on the day of the exercise. That's why there was a resupply of troops.

SNAKE


Was there any sign recently that something might be wrong?

CAMPBELL


There was a report a month ago that they were acting strangely.

NAOMI


Apparently, they consulted classified information about the soldier genes and performed their own gene therapy experiments.

SNAKE


They can do that even without you?

*Player selects "Unit FOX-HOUND"

Shot of FOX-HOUND insignia and data on the unit.

Photos and profiles of FOX-HOUND members.
*Player selects "Liquid Snake"

Flashback: A scene from the Gulf War.

NAOMI


Well, our gene therapy process is almost completely automated. And besides that, they're all geniuses with IQs over 180.

CAMPBELL


Even the existence of this genome army is a national secret of the highest order. We had been hoping to investigate this thing quietly and deal with it behind closed doors.

CAMPBELL


High Tech Special Forces Unit FOX-HOUND. Your former unit... and one that I was a commander of. An elite group combining firepower and expertise. They're every bit as good as when I was commanding them.

SNAKE


So they're still around...

CAMPBELL


There are six members of FOX-HOUND involved in this terrorist activity.

CAMPBELL


Psycho Mantis, with his powerful psychic abilities. Sniper Wolf, the beautiful and deadly sharpshooter. Decoy Octopus, master of disguise. Vulcan Raven, giant and shaman. And Revolver Ocelot, specialist in interrogation and a formidable gunfighter.

SNAKE


Looks like a lovely bunch of folks.

CAMPBELL


And finally, in charge of them... FOX-HOUND's squad leader, Liquid Snake.

SNAKE


Liquid Snake?

CAMPBELL


Yes. And you're the only person who can stand against him.

SNAKE


Liquid Snake?

CAMPBELL


Liquid Snake. The man with the same code name as you.

SNAKE


Tell me what you know.

CAMPBELL


He fought in the Gulf War as a teenager, the youngest person in the SAS
7 . His job was to track down and destroy mobile SCUD missile launching platforms...

CAMPBELL


You were there too, I believe. Didn't you infiltrate western Iraq with a platoon of Green Berets?

SNAKE


I was just a kid myself back then.

CAMPBELL


The details are classified, but it seems that originally he penetrated the Middle East as a sleeper for the SIS.

SNAKE


He was a spy for the British Secret Intelligence Service
8 ?

CAMPBELL


But he never once showed his face in Century House.

CAMPBELL


He was taken prisoner in Iraq and after that there was no trace of him for several years.

CAMPBELL


After you retired, he was rescued and became a member of FOX-HOUND.

SNAKE


I thought that by the time I left they were no longer using code names.

CAMPBELL


I don't know his real name. That information is so highly classified that even I can't look at it. Here's a photo of him.
Campbell presents a photo of Liquid. His face is identical to Snake's.

*Player selects "Exit"
Infiltration 1

Infiltration Intro Cutscene

Caption: Alaska – Bering Sea

Ohio-class nuclear-powered submarine U.S.S.
Discovery navigates the deeps.
The sub's control room. Campbell faces his Codec terminal, gauges and instruments bathing him in an unnatural glow.

He's flanked by Naomi.

The contours of Shadow Moses Island appear on radar.

Various images and other data are projected onto the briefing monitor's screen.

External shot of
Discovery . From one of its hatches, the sub launches an SDV carrying Snake. Shot of Snake's underwater point of view (POV). Data populates the radar screen.
The SDV enters an underwater cave beneath Shadow Moses.

Campbell continues to speak to Snake via Codec.

The SDV's hatch pops open, and Snake emerges in his scuba gear.

SNAKE


*speechless* ...

CAMPBELL


Pretty shocking, huh? His skin tone is different, but otherwise you two are exact duplicates.

SNAKE


I have a twin?

CAMPBELL


I don't know the details, but it seems so. That's why we really need you for this mission.

NAOMI


You're the only one who can beat him. Now that I've met you, I know. You've got something that he doesn't. I can see it in your eyes.

SNAKE


Why don't I find that thought more comforting?

SNAKE


I need to borrow your scissors.

NAOMI


What are you going to do?

SNAKE


Don't worry. Just gonna clean myself up a little.

NAOMI


Huh?

SNAKE


I don't want to be mistaken for the leader of the terrorists.

CAMPBELL


The nuclear weapons disposal facility on Shadow Moses Island in Alaska's Fox Archipelago was attacked and captured by Next-Generation Special Forces being led by members of FOX-HOUND.

CAMPBELL


They're demanding that the government turn over the remains of Big Boss and they say that if their demands are not met within 24 hours, they'll launch a nuclear weapon.

CAMPBELL


You'll have two mission objectives. First, you're to rescue DARPA chief, Donald Anderson, and the President of ArmsTech, Kenneth Baker.

CAMPBELL


Both are being held as hostages. Secondly, you're to investigate whether or not the terrorists have the ability to make a nuclear strike... and stop them if they do.

SNAKE


What's the insertion method?
Snake watches the SDV sink.


Infiltration 2


Infiltration Cutscene

The sea flows into a dimly lit cave underneath the island. Snake's POV, framed by his scuba goggles.

Within the cave is a concrete dock housing rows of containers. At the back of the dock is an elevator for transporting materiel to the surface.

Snake, equipped with a small air tank, swims toward the dock.

Still quite a far away from it, he sticks his head above the water.

Snake spots two Genome Soldiers in cold-weather gear on patrol. He slips back underwater.

Cast credits roll during this sequence.

Snake, now much closer to the dock, pops his head back out above water.

He looks around.

Right in front of him, a mischief of mice runs past and a soldier passes by.

Unaware of Snake observing him from below, the soldier walks on.

From not too far away comes a man's voice.

CAMPBELL


We'll approach the disposal facility by sub.

SNAKE


And then?

CAMPBELL


We'll launch a one-man SDV (swimmer delivery vehicle).

CAMPBELL


After the SDV gets as close as it can, dispose of it. From there on you'll have to swim.

CAMPBELL


High Tech Special Forces Unit FOX-HOUND. Your former unit... and one that I was a commander of.

SNAKE


So they're still around...

CAMPBELL


There are six members of FOX-HOUND involved in this terrorist activity.

CAMPBELL


Psycho Mantis, with his powerful psychic abilities. Sniper Wolf, the beautiful and deadly sharpshooter. Decoy Octopus, master of disguise. Vulcan Raven, giant and shaman. And Revolver Ocelot, specialist in interrogation and a formidable gunfighter.

SNAKE


Looks like a lovely bunch of folks.

CAMPBELL


And finally, in charge of them... FOX-HOUND's squad leader, Liquid Snake.

SNAKE


Liquid Snake?

CAMPBELL


The man with the same code name as you.

CAMPBELL


The nuclear weapons disposal facility covers the whole island. I'll instruct you by Codec after you reach your target.

SNAKE


Anyone going with me?

CAMPBELL


As usual, this is a one-man infiltration mission.

SNAKE


Weapons and equipment OSP (on-site procurement)?

CAMPBELL


Yes. This is a top-secret black op. Don't expect any official support.

LIQUID


Stay alert! He'll be through here... I know it.

LIQUID


I'm going to swat down a couple of bothersome flies.
Sound of a motor, that of the elevator, starting up.

Still treading water, Snake takes out his binoculars and zooms in on the elevator at the far end of the dock. They reveal Liquid Snake, in the flesh. He's naked from the waist up, partially covered by a leather longcoat. He projects power, standing with his arms crossed as the elevator rises. Snake pans up, getting a good look at Liquid's face. It is indeed identical to his own.

Liquid's cast credit.

Snake submerges once more.

There is a light splash, and a ripple travels across the water.

From the elevator, Liquid's eyes are drawn to the spot where Snake disappeared.

The ripple is still visible, though Snake is not.

At the west side of the dock, Snake takes another peek above water. In front of him there is a tank of some sort, and beside it a stack of metal barrels. Snake looks around, making sure he'll be completely out of sight.

He climbs onto the edge of the dock, this being the one spot that sits above the rest of the water. He still has on his underwater vest and goggles, but he's already taken out his mouthpiece.

Snake remains in the water from the knees down, his fins visible beneath the surface.

Snake moves from the shallows to the edge. He sits down on it, removes his fins, and puts them away.

Snake then contacts Campbell via Codec.
Infiltration 3

Infiltration Codec Call

SNAKE


This is Snake. Colonel, can you hear me?

CAMPBELL


Loud and clear. What's the situation, Snake?

SNAKE


Looks like the elevator in the back is the only way up.

CAMPBELL


Just as I expected. You'll have to take the elevator to the surface.

CAMPBELL


But make sure nobody sees you.

CAMPBELL


If you need to, contact me by Codec. The frequency is 140.85.

CAMPBELL


When you want to use the Codec, push the Codec Button.

CAMPBELL


When we need to contact you, the Codec will beep.

CAMPBELL


When you hear that noise, press the Codec Button.

CAMPBELL


The Codec's receiver directly stimulates the small bones of your ear. No one but you will be able to hear it.

SNAKE


Got it. Okay. I'm ready to go.
Infiltration 4

Snake's Face Revealed Cutscene

Snake slips past the guards and steps onto the elevator.

He starts to shed the rest of his scuba gear, dropping his goggles, tank, and fins at his feet. The player gets their first look at Snake's grim face. Until now, his goggles and dry cap have kept his head covered. His face looks exactly like Liquid's.

As the elevator climbs, it offers a view of the entire container dock.


Infiltration 5


Heliport Cutscene

The elevator comes to a stop in another container depot. This one is located in the southwest corner of a heliport, situated by a precipice.

With the blizzard, it's close to whiteout conditions.

Snake gets off the elevator, takes a few steps toward the precipice, and looks down at the frozen waters. About 60 meters (197 feet) to the north, he can see the imposing walls of the nuclear weapons disposal facility. In front of it is a square-shaped helipad, and on that is a Hind D about to take off.

On the left side of the heliport, a forklift ferries loads back and forth.

Snake gets off the elevator and calls Campbell.
Infiltration 6

Heliport Codec Call

*If player arrived quickly

*If player took a while

SNAKE


It's Snake. I'm in front of the disposal facility.

CAMPBELL


Excellent, Snake. Age hasn't slowed you down one bit.

CAMPBELL


That took a long time. I guess you're feeling a little rusty.

SNAKE


Don't worry. It's been a while, but it's all coming back to me.

NAOMI


How's that Sneaking Suit working out?

SNAKE


I'm nice and dry, but it's a little hard to move.

NAOMI


Bear with it. It's designed to prevent hypothermia. This is Alaska, you know.

SNAKE


Take it easy, I'm grateful. If it weren't for your suit and your shot, I would've turned into a popsicle out there.

NAOMI


An anti-freezing peptide, Snake. All of the Genome Soldiers in this exercise are using it.

SNAKE


I see. I'm relieved to hear that. Already tested, huh? By the way, how's the diversionary operation going?

CAMPBELL


Two F-16s just took off from Galena and are headed your way. The terrorist's radar should have already picked them up.
Infiltration 7

Helicopter Takeoff Cutscene

From the helipad comes a deafening roar. Snake shifts his attention from the Codec to the direction of the sound. The Hind gently lifts into the air. More soldiers in cold-weather gear see it off.

Snake takes out his binoculars and peers into its cockpit.

At the controls is a man who would appear to be Liquid. Snake studies the aircraft. Questions begin to form in his mind.

Campbell's voice comes in over the Codec.

The Hind flies off.


Infiltration 8


Enter Mei Ling Codec Call
Visual of Mei Ling appears on the monitor.

The radar appears on-screen. It shows the position of the player as well as the positions of enemies.

SNAKE


A Hind D?

SNAKE


*with disbelief* Colonel, what's a Russian gunship doing here?

CAMPBELL


I have no idea... but it looks like our little diversion got their attention. Now's your best chance to slip in unnoticed!

CAMPBELL


There are only 18 hours left until their deadline. You've got to hurry!

MEI LING


Wow... He must be crazy to fly a Hind in this kind of weather.

SNAKE


Who's that?

CAMPBELL


Oh sorry, I haven't introduced you two yet. This is Mei Ling. She was assigned to us as our visual and data processing specialist. She designed your Codec as well as your Soliton Radar System. Contact her if you have any questions about either of them.

MEI LING


Nice to meet you, Snake. It's an honor to speak to a living legend like yourself.

SNAKE


...

MEI LING


What's wrong?

SNAKE


Nothing... I just didn't expect a world-class designer of military technology to be so... cute.

MEI LING


You're just flattering me... (She's actually pleased.)

SNAKE


No, I'm serious. Well I know I won't be bored for the next 18 hours.

MEI LING


C'mon... I can't believe I'm being hit on by the famous Solid Snake... But I'm surprised... You're very frank for a trained killer.

SNAKE


Looks like we both have a lot to learn about each other.

MEI LING


Yeah. I'm looking forward to learning about the man behind the legend... But first, let me explain about your Soliton Radar System.

MEI LING


The bright dot in the middle is you, Snake. The red dots are your enemies and the blue cone shape represents their field of vision.

NAOMI


Be careful, Snake. The Genome Soldiers have highly developed senses of hearing and vision due to their gene therapy. Make sure you don't let them see you.

CAMPBELL


First, I want you to infiltrate the disposal site and look for the DARPA Chief.

NAOMI


The DARPA Chief was injected with the same GPS transmitting nanomachines as you.

MEI LING


He should appear on your radar as a green dot.

CAMPBELL


Get whatever information you can from him about the terrorists. If he's alive that is...

MEI LING


Snake, your radar isn't affected by the weather, but if you're discovered by an enemy you won't be able to use it.

CAMPBELL


Yes. It gets jammed easily I'm afraid.

MEI LING


Yes. It's all made from currently existing technology. You won't be able to use it in an area with strong harmonic resonance. So be careful.

CAMPBELL


We'll be monitoring your movements by radar... so contact us by Codec anytime you want.

SNAKE


Got it. I'll call if I'm feeling lonely.

NAOMI


Seriously, Snake. We're here to back you up, so call if you need some information or advice.

MEI LING


I'm also in charge of your mission data. Contact me if you want me to record your current status.

MEI LING


My frequency is 140.96. It's a dedicated frequency for saving data. Don't forget it.

CAMPBELL


Remember, except for your binoculars, you're naked. You need to arm yourself with whatever weapons you can find.

SNAKE


I remember. First I'm strip searched by Dr. Naomi here... and then all my weapons are taken away. Imagine yourself put in that position.

NAOMI


Well, if you make it back in one piece, maybe I'll let you do a strip search on me.

SNAKE


I'll hold you to that, Doctor. By the way, sorry to disappoint you, but I did manage to smuggle out my smokes.

NAOMI


How did you do that?

SNAKE


In my stomach. Thanks to the shot you gave me that suppressed my stomach acids.

MEI LING


Cigarettes? How are those going to help you?

SNAKE


You never know.
Infiltration 9

Binoculars Recon Cutscene

Snake takes his binoculars back out and studies the base.

He zooms in on the main door.

Snake zooms in on a first-floor duct next to the main door. He also identifies one soldier in front of a truck.

He pans over, checking to see what he's dealing with.

Snake looks for the second-floor duct, but he can't get an angle on it.

There's another soldier on the second-floor walkway.

Snake puts away his binoculars.
Infiltration 10

Truck Dropoff Cutscene

Snake is underneath a cardboard box in the back of the truck parked at the heliport.

A soldier peers through the window and mutters to himself:

*If the box's destination is the heliport

*If the box's destination is the canyon

*If the box's destination is nuclear warhead storage

*If the box's destination is the snowfield north of the towers

The truck's engine fires up, and it takes off.

CAMPBELL


If you want to get in, there's the front door.

CAMPBELL


It's the fastest way, but there's too much risk of being spotted by the enemy.

SNAKE


I can't just knock on the door and ask them to let me in.

SNAKE


... One sentry on the left... and one on the right...

SNAKE


They're armed with "five five sixers" and pineapples...

CAMPBELL


What about the air duct near the door?

CAMPBELL


There should also be a duct on the second floor.

SNAKE


I can't see it from here.

CAMPBELL


I'll let you decide the best COA (course of action). I'm counting on you, Snake.

SOLDIER A


Is this all there is to load?

SOLDIER A


To the Heliport, huh...

SOLDIER A


To the canyon, huh...

SOLDIER A


To nuclear warhead storage, huh...

SOLDIER A


The snowfield north of the towers, huh...
Meeting the DARPA Chief 1

Weapon Location Hint Cutscene

The Tank Hangar first floor duct. It's a narrow ventilation shaft just big enough for someone to squeeze through.

Snake crawls down it.

Light bleeds in through the wire mesh at the end.

Snake peeks through the mesh. Two soldiers are talking.

They're standing at attention with their FAMASes still in their hands.

Snake is right at their feet. He holds his breath.

*Additional dialogue if they know there's an intruder
Meeting the DARPA Chief 2

Chief's Location Hint Cutscene

The Tank Hangar second floor duct. Snake worms his way through the tight ventilation shaft in the ceiling.

He looks down through the wire mesh to see two soldiers standing around talking.

Snake's face appears above them.

Snake chews this information over.

*Additional dialogue if they know there's an intruder

SOLDIER A


Were all the SOCOM pistols unloaded?

SOLDIER B


Yeah. But there was a problem.

SOLDIER A


What is it?

SOLDIER B


The security on the door was broken.

SOLDIER A


So the door is still open? Second floor where?

SOLDIER B


The east side room.

SOLDIER A


We'd better fix it before the Boss finds out...

SOLDIER B


But that's nothing. I heard they spotted an intruder outside.

SOLDIER A


Really!? Maybe we'll finally get to see some action...

SOLDIER B


Yeah, but we'd better do something about that door.

SOLDIER A


Let's put in an order to have it repaired.

SOLDIER A


I moved the DARPA Chief to the cell in the first floor basement.

SOLDIER B


What about the vent shaft cleaning?

SOLDIER A


They just opened the vent covers. They're about to start spraying for rats.

SNAKE


First floor basement ventilation shaft...

SOLDIER A


Shut those covers as soon as they're done spraying.

SOLDIER A


Also, keep your eye on that woman (Meryl) in the cell. Don't get careless now.

SNAKE


Woman in the cell?

SOLDIER B


Did something happen?

SOLDIER A


There's an intruder.

SOLDIER B


Really?

SOLDIER A


*fearfully* He's already done three people.

SOLDIER B


*seriously* He's killed three people?

SOLDIER A


Yeah. They say he's using stealth too.
Snake tilts his head. He has no idea who this could be.


Meeting the DARPA Chief 3


The Guard (Johnny Sasaki) Cutscene – Overhead View

Snake makes his way through the ventilation duct in the ceiling of the Tank Hangar first-floor basement (B1).

As he passes over the toilet, he looks down to see a guard (Johnny Sasaki) talking to himself.


Meeting the DARPA Chief 4


Prisoner Discovered Cutscene – Overhead View

Snake continues to make his way through the ventilation duct in the ceiling of the Tank Hangar B1.

He peeps into Meryl's cell. She's doing the kind of hardcore sit-ups a Marine might do. She doesn't say a word; she's completely focused on the exercise.
Meeting the DARPA Chief 5

DARPA Chief Cutscene

Snake continues down the duct. He's discovered the cell of the DARPA Chief, Donald Anderson.

It's squalid and poorly lit. Anderson is by himself, sitting on the bed. He's a Black man in his forties, with a muscular build. His white shirt and tie suggest he's a suit, though the shirt isn't so white anymore—it's stained with blood and sweat.

Snake opens the grate and drops down.

Anderson gets up off the bed.

Snake holds up his hands to show he isn't carrying a weapon.

Even if the player has acquired a weapon by this point, Snake still raises his hands.

Anderson looks Snake over, wondering who sent him.

He relaxes his guard a little and sits back down on the bed.

SNAKE


Stealth? There's an intruder besides me? (It's the Ninja.)

SOLDIER A


Anyway, I want you to increase the security detail on the Chief.

JOHNNY


... Caught a damned cold.

JOHNNY


Boy oh boy. That woman is built all right.

SNAKE


Is that a woman...? Not him.

DONALD


Who... who, who's that??

SNAKE


I'm here to save you. You're the DARPA Chief, Donald Anderson, right?

DONALD


You're here to save me, huh? What's your outfit?

SNAKE


I'm the pawn they sent here to save your worthless butt.

DONALD


Really?

DONALD


It's true... You don't look like one of them. In that case, hurry up and get me out of here.

SNAKE


Slow down. Don't worry. First, I want some information... about the terrorists.

DONALD


The terrorists?

SNAKE


Do they really have the ability to launch a nuke?

Anderson holds his head in his hands.

Anderson turns to the side, looking away from Snake.

Meryl's still doing her crunches on the bed. Hearing the commotion next-door, she stops and gets up.

Snake and the Chief continue.

Anderson walks up to Snake, looks around nervously, then lowers his voice.
Visuals of Metal Gear resting in its hangar.

The conversation between the men continues off-screen.

Anderson leans in, bringing his face close to Snake's.

(Octopus slips up, accidentally labeling the terrorist revolt a "revolution.")

A little flustered by his mistake, "Anderson" turns his back to Snake before continuing.

Anderson turns back around.

DONALD


What are you talking about?

SNAKE


The terrorists are threatening the White House. They say if they don't accede to their demands, they'll launch a nuclear weapon.

DONALD


Sweet Jesus...

SNAKE


Is it possible!?

DONALD


... It's possible. They... could launch a nuke.

MERYL


Wha...?

SNAKE


How do they plan to launch? I thought this place was just for... keeping the dismantled warheads. They shouldn't have access to a missile...

DONALD


What I'm about to tell you is classified information. Okay?

DONALD


We were conducting exercises with a new type of... experimental weapon. A weapon that will change the world.

SNAKE


What?

DONALD


A weapon with the ability to launch a nuclear attack... from any place on the face of the earth... a nuclear equipped walking battle tank.

SNAKE


Metal Gear!?... It can't be!

DONALD


... You knew!? Metal Gear is one of the most secret black projects! How did you know that?

SNAKE


We've had a couple of run-ins in the past. So that's the reason you were here at this disposal site?

DONALD


Why else would I come to a God forsaken place like this.

SNAKE


I had heard the Metal Gear project was scrapped.

DONALD


On the contrary, it's grown into a huge joint project between ArmsTech and ourselves. We were going to use this exercise as raw data... and then proceed to mass production.

DONALD


*with bitterness* If it hadn't been for the revolution...

SNAKE


Revolution...?

DONALD


Rex has fallen into the hands of terrorists...

SNAKE


Rex?

DONALD


Metal Gear Rex. The code name for the new Metal Gear prototype.
Johnny Sasaki stands guard outside the cell.

His attention is drawn to the Chief's voice.

Anderson continues.

Johnny has come to investigate.

Snake quickly presses himself against the wall.

Johnny scopes out the cell through the window. Anderson waves him off as if to say "No problems here."

Johnny nods and walks away.

Anderson moves to the door, making sure he's gone.

Snake breathes a sigh of relief.

Anderson turns his head to Snake, his back to the door now.

Snake moves away from the side of the door toward the middle of the cell again.

The Chief walks and talks, pointing to his head.

Anderson saunters to the bed.

Meryl presses her ear to the wall to better eavesdrop on the conversation.

Snake winces at this worst possible news.

Anderson uncrosses his arms and looks up at Snake.

Anderson gets up off the bed and launches into his spiel crafted to manipulate Snake.

DONALD


They're probably already finished arming the warhead they plan to use with Rex.

DONALD


These guys are pros. They're all experienced in handling and equipping weapons.

JOHNNY


Hey! Shut up in there willya!

SNAKE


But I thought that all nuclear warheads were equipped with safety measures. Some kind of detonation code that you have to input...

DONALD


... Oh, you mean PAL. Yes, of course, there is a PAL. It's set up so that you need to input two different passwords in order to launch the device.

SNAKE


There are two passwords?

DONALD


Yes. Baker knows one, and I know one.

SNAKE


Baker? The president of ArmsTech?

DONALD


That's right. Each of us needs to input our password or there can be no launch. But...

DONALD


They found out my password.

SNAKE


You talked?

DONALD


Psycho Mantis can read people's minds. You can't resist.

SNAKE


Psycho Mantis?

DONALD


One of the members of FOX-HOUND. He has psychic powers.

SNAKE


... This is bad...

DONALD


It's just a matter of time before they get Baker's too...

SNAKE


If they find out Baker's password...

DONALD


Yes. They'll be able to launch a nuke anytime.

DONALD


But... there is a way to stop the launch.

SNAKE


What?

DONALD


The card keys.

Hearing about the key, Meryl pulls back from the wall. She remembers the key she got from the ArmsTech president.

Back to the Chief's cell.

Meryl paces about her cell, wondering what to do. She can hear the conversation continuing next door.

Anderson rises and hands Snake the card.

Snake takes the card.

The Chief approaches Snake.

SNAKE


Card keys?

DONALD


They were designed by ArmsTech, the system developers, as an emergency override. Even without the passwords, you can just insert the card keys and engage the safety lock...

SNAKE


And if I do that?

DONALD


Yes. You can stop the launch.

MERYL


That card key...?

SNAKE


So, where are the keys?

DONALD


Baker should have them.

DONALD


Listen. You need three card keys. There are three different slots to put them in. You need to insert a card into each one of them.

SNAKE


OK, three card keys. Do you know where they might be keeping Baker?

DONALD


Somewhere in the second floor basement.

SNAKE


Second floor basement?

DONALD


I heard the guard say they moved him to an area... that has a lot of electronic jamming.

SNAKE


Any other clues?

DONALD


Yes... They cemented over the entrances, but didn't have enough time to paint them. Why don't you look for the areas where the walls are a different color?

DONALD


Here, take this. It's my ID card. It'll open any level one security door.

DONALD


It's called a PAN card. It works together with your body's own electrical field.

SNAKE


Personal Area Network, huh?

DONALD


It transmits data using the salts in your body as the transmission medium. As you approach the door's security devices, they'll read the data stored in the card...

SNAKE


And the doors will open automatically. Gotcha.

SNAKE


OK. I'm gonna get you out of here.

DONALD


Wait a minute.

SNAKE


What is it?

DONALD


You... haven't heard any other way to disarm the PAL, have you? From your bosses or anyone.

SNAKE


No.

DONALD


Are you sure you haven't heard anything?

SNAKE


I just said no.

Suddenly, Anderson is gripped by some terrible pain.

He grabs at his chest, writhing in agony.

Anderson clings to Snake's shoulders.

Meryl realizes something is wrong.

She bangs on the door, shouting to the guard.

The Chief's cell. Anderson's face rubs against Snake's body as he falls to his knees, then gradually slides down to the floor.

Snake is powerless to help him.

Snake checks the Chief's neck for a pulse. Nothing.

He contacts Naomi on the Codec.
Meeting the DARPA Chief 6

Post-DARPA Chief Death Codec Call

DONALD


So, does the White House plan to give in to the terrorist's demands?

SNAKE


That's their problem. It has nothing to do with my orders.

DONALD


But... what about the Pentagon?

SNAKE


Pentagon?

DONALD


... Nnnnnnngggghhh!

SNAKE


What is it!?

DONALD


W-w...why?

DONALD


Uuuuuugggghhhh!!

MERYL


What's that!?

MERYL


Hey! What happened?

SNAKE


Hmmm...

SNAKE


Dead...

SNAKE


Naomi, the Chief! What happened!?

NAOMI


*shaking a little* I... I don't know. It looked like a heart attack, but... (She doesn't remember including the Chief as a target.)

CAMPBELL


A heart attack? No...

SNAKE


*with distrust* ... Colonel, are you hiding something from me?

CAMPBELL


Absolutely not. Snake, you've got to understand. This op is security level Red. You need the highest security clearance to get access to the complete file.

SNAKE


You want me to believe that you're in charge of this op, but you don't have complete access to the file!?

CAMPBELL


I told you. The Secretary of Defense is in operational control. I'm just here as your support...

SNAKE


...

CAMPBELL


*hiding his awkwardness and guilt* Snake, we don't have time to debate. Get out of there and find President Baker!
Meeting Meryl 1

Meryl Contact Cutscene

Snake ever so carefully sticks his head out of the Chief's cell.

There's an open space in front of it. Directly ahead is the guard station. To the left is Meryl's cell. The exit door is to the right, but it's closed.

Snake looks to his left. Johnny Sasaki lies unconscious—and fully naked at that—on the floor. Someone has stripped him of his uniform and gear.

Snake quickly gets another surprise—the barrel of a FAMAS pointed at his head.

The body of the Chief, really Decoy Octopus, lying in his cell.

Snake slowly pivots to face Meryl.

This gives her her first good look at his face. She's taken aback.

Snake sinks down, trying to get the drop on her.

But this doesn't go unnoticed, and Meryl keeps her gun pointed right at Snake.

Meryl thrusts the FAMAS at Snake. The barrel shakes ever so slightly.

Meryl is wearing an light infantry enemy uniform. She and Snake lock eyes!

She has on a balaclava, so her eyes are the only part of her face that's visible.

Meryl lets down her guard for only a second, but this is time enough for Snake to draw his gun and point it at her face. (If the player doesn't yet have a gun, Snake grabs the barrel of the FAMAS instead.)

The two stare each other down.

Meryl's finger vibrates against the trigger.

For the first time, Meryl inadvertently speaks in a feminine manner (i.e., in her natural, unaffected voice).

Her breathing gets heavy.

Her and Snake's eyes stay glued as she makes her way to the door on the right.

Little by little she backs up.

SOLDIER (MERYL)


Don't move! (It's a woman's voice.)

SNAKE


*speechless* ...

SOLDIER (MERYL)


So you killed the Chief. You bastard...!

SOLDIER (MERYL)


Liquid!? No... you're not.

SOLDIER (MERYL)


Don't move!!!

SNAKE


Is this the first time you ever pointed a gun at a person?

SNAKE


Your hands are shaking.

SOLDIER (MERYL)


!!!

SNAKE


Can you shoot me, rookie?

SOLDIER (MERYL)


Careful, I'm no rookie!!

SNAKE


Liar! That nervous glance... that scared look in your eyes. They're rookie's eyes if I ever saw them. You've never shot a person, am I right?

SOLDIER (MERYL)


You talk too much.

SNAKE


You haven't even taken the safety off, rookie.

SOLDIER (MERYL)


I told you I'm no rookie!!!

SNAKE


You're not one of them, are you?

SOLDIER (MERYL)


Open that door! You've got a card, don't you?

SNAKE


Why?

SOLDIER (MERYL)


So we can get the hell out of here.
But then, the door opens, and enemy soldiers come pouring in.

Meryl points her gun at the enemy and opens fire.

If the player has the SOCOM, Snake readies it.

If the player doesn't have the SOCOM, Snake gets into a combat stance.

Enemies continue to pour into the room. The player must eliminate them.

Once the player defeats three enemies, Snake urges Meryl to shoot.

Meryl hesitates to fire that first shot, but once she takes out one soldier, it's like the dam has broken, and she takes out others without stopping.

Meryl and the player continue to shoot. If the player runs out of ammo, Meryl cleans up the rest. If the player doesn't have a gun, they can engage the enemy through punches and/or throws.

Once a certain number of soldiers (4 to 5) have been taken care of, the enemy force is eliminated.
Meeting Meryl 2

Meryl Flees Cutscene

Outside the DARPA Chief's cell. Snake and Meryl have taken out all the soldiers.

Meryl looks at the open door on the right, making sure there aren't any reinforcements waiting to come in.

Meryl goes running out the room.

Snake follows her into the corridor.

Close-up of Meryl's butt as she runs away. Its movements are decidedly feminine.

She's running toward the elevator at the end of the corridor.

She doesn't have to wait—the elevator arrives, and its doors open.

Psycho Mantis' brainwashing music, sung in Russian, becomes audible. Snake experiences psychometric interference, giving him a glimpse into Mantis' mind leading to a scene from Mantis' POV.

SNAKE


Looks like we'll be a little delayed.

SOLDIER (MERYL)


Tch!

SNAKE


What are you waiting for!! Shoot!!

SOLDIER (MERYL)


Thanks for the help.

SNAKE


Wait!

SNAKE


Who are you!?
Meeting Meryl 3

Mantis Mind Jump Cutscene

The real Chief lies on a torture device.

He's already dead. The lighting prevents any good look at his face.

Standing over the torture device are Ocelot, Mantis, and Liquid.

Shot of an unconscious Meryl.
Meeting Meryl 4

Meryl Escapes Cutscene

Snake's awareness returns to the corridor to reality.

The soldier (Meryl) is about to get on the elevator.

Snake starts heading toward her. She takes out her sidearm and fires a burst of rounds.

Snake drops to the floor to avoid them.

The elevator doors close.

Another bout of psychometric interference. Mantis' translucent, ghostly thought form appears, then disappears in front of the elevator.

Mantis is wearing a coat.

When he disappears, the sound of his breathing through his gas mask lingers in Snake's ears.

Mantis' brainwashing music, sung in Russian, fades out.

Snake contacts Naomi on the Codec once more.

LIQUID


*angrily* You fool! You've killed him!!

OCELOT


I'm sorry, Sir.

MANTIS


*breathing* ... His mental shielding was very strong. I couldn't dive into his mind.

LIQUID


*impatiently* Now we'll never get that detonation code...

MANTIS


Boss, I have a good idea.

SNAKE


Damn...

MANTIS


Good girl. Just like that...
Meeting Meryl 5

Psychometric Interference Explanation Codec Call

Snake now heads to B2 to rescue President Baker.


VS Ocelot 1


Enter Ocelot Cutscene

Snake reaches the room where Baker is being held. In the middle of it are five pillars made of iron.

There's a web of wires running from four corner pillars to a center pillar, which stands about a meter (three feet) tall. Tied to it is an elderly man in a suit. It's the ArmsTech president, Kenneth Baker. He may already be dead—he's motionless, his left hand still clawed around his cane.

Snake walks up to Baker.

Suddenly, he regains consciousness, lifting his head. He's been tortured, having sustained some pretty severe injuries.

One of them being to his right arm—it's been broken, and now rests under his coat instead of in the sleeve.

Snake gets right up under Baker.

Baker has just enough strength to muster a slight nod.

Baker looks at Snake as though there's something he desperately has to tell him.

Snake moves his hand to the wires to figure out how to free the president.

Snake takes a closer look at the wires.

The center pillar, where all the wires converge, has been packed with C4.

A massive amount of the explosive has been positioned right above Baker's head.

The instant Snake spots the C4, a bullet is fired at his feet.

Snake takes a step back.

Revolver Ocelot's cool, measured footsteps echo in the enclosed space.

Ocelot emerges from behind one of the far pillars.

Smoke still rises from the revolver he just fired.

SNAKE


Naomi, I just had some kind of hallucination. Is it from the nanomachines?

NAOMI


No, Snake. The nanomachines are functioning properly.

SNAKE


So what was it?

NAOMI


It must have been psychometric interference coming from Psycho Mantis, FOX-HOUND's psychic. Think of it as a mental feedback loop.

SNAKE


So that was Mantis...?

SNAKE


Am I too late?

KENNETH


Oooooo...

KENNETH


Huhuuhuhuh...

SNAKE


He's alive...

SNAKE


You're the ArmsTech president, Kenneth Baker, right?

SNAKE


Don't worry, I'm here to save you.

KENNETH


Noooo! Don't touch it...

SNAKE


C4!

VOICE


Right. Touch that wire... and the C4 will blow up along with the old man!

OCELOT


So you're the one that the Boss keeps talking about.
Snake draws back and braces himself.

Ocelot demonstrates his proficiency with spinning a revolver.

He stops and points the barrel of the gun upward.

Ocelot amuses himself with more of his gun spinning.

With a quick, clean motion, he holsters the revolver into his gun belt.

Dripping with confidence, Ocelot walks right up to the wires.

Ocelot draws his revolver from his belt again.

He spins the gun two, then three more times, and dumps out the shell casings. They clink to the floor and roll away.

Ocelot then slams fresh cartridges into the chambers in a blur of speed.

He swings the cylinder back into place, then glares at Snake.

Ocelot returns the revolver to its holster with one final flourish. He relaxes his arms by his sides.

The only sound in the room is that of his fingers creaking.
VS Ocelot 2

The Ninja Intrudes Cutscene

Snake and Ocelot are in the middle of a heated gun battle.

The following is triggered once Snake has dealt a certain amount of damage to Ocelot.

*1) If the player has sustained little to no damage

*2) If the player has sustained a considerable amount of damage

Ocelot points his gun at Snake again, only this time, something strikes his hand.

Ocelot drops his revolver.

In fact, he's dropped more than just the revolver—his right hand lies on the ground, the fingers still gripping the gun.

Ocelot raises what remains of his right arm—it's been severed from below the elbow.

Blood gushes from the wound high into the air. Ocelot struggles to process what has just happened!

An invisible enemy cuts down all the pillars in the room. The only visual indicators are sparks and a concentration of lights.

The intruder slices through the center pillar diagonally.

With the wires severed, the ArmsTech president is thrown to the ground.

SNAKE


And you?

OCELOT


Special Operations FOX-HOUND...

OCELOT


Revolver Ocelot.

OCELOT


I've been waiting for you, Solid Snake.

OCELOT


Now we'll see if the man can live up to the legend!

OCELOT


This is the greatest handgun ever made. The Colt Single Action Army.

OCELOT


Six bullets. More than enough to kill anything that moves.

OCELOT


Now I'll show you why they call me... "Revolver."

OCELOT


Draw!

OCELOT


You're pretty good. Just what I'd expect from the man with the same code (double meaning of a shared genetic code and code name) as the Boss (Liquid).

OCELOT


It's been a long time since I had such a good fight... but I'm just getting warmed up.

OCELOT


I'm disappointed. You're no match for the Boss (Liquid).

OCELOT


Playtime's over, friend. You're not cut out for war. Don't worry. I'll kill you quickly.

OCELOT


What!

OCELOT


My hand!!!
A moment later, the pillar slides down its slanted axis, and the C4 detonates.

The blast slams Ocelot against a wall, delivering a firm blow to the back of his head.

A kind of visual noise travels across the screen—noise that could only come from stealth camouflage.

A silhouette appears, highlighted by the flames from the explosion dancing around it.

It's the distorted outline of the Cyborg Ninja, brandishing a long sword.

The explosion has interfered with his camouflage, causing it to deactivate and reveal his form.

Ocelot looks over at Snake.

He picks up his revolver and his severed appendage, and darts out of the room through a hole in the wall (or a door).

Snake points his gun at the approaching Ninja.

The Ninja comes ambling out of the blaze.

This voice isn't the product of vocal cords. It's a mechanical, digitized utterance.

Baker tries to use his cane to get up.
The Ninja directs his blade toward Baker.

Baker looks up at him, studying his body.

Suddenly, as though some memory has come rushing back to him, the Ninja looks up at the ceiling and lets out a terrible scream!

It's like the roar of a wild beast rather than that of a man. Snake is forced to cover his ears.

With astonishing power, the Ninja jumps up toward the ceiling and fades from view.

Snake watches him leave.

The sounds of the Ninja's leaps bounce across the room.

OCELOT


Aaaaaahhh!!

OCELOT


Stealth camouflage!

OCELOT


Can't you even die right!?

OCELOT


You were lucky. We'll meet again!

SNAKE


Who are you!?

NINJA


I'm like you... I have no name.

KENNETH


Ohhh... Ohhhh!

KENNETH


That... that exoskeleton...!

NINJA


Ggggyyyaaaaaaahhh!!!

SNAKE


Who the hell...?
VS Ocelot 3

Rescuing the ArmsTech President Cutscene

With both Ocelot and the Ninja gone, Snake and ArmsTech president Kenneth Baker are alone in the room the latter was confined to. Snake helps Baker up.

Despite his best efforts and Snake's assistance, Baker still struggles to stand.

Snake lends him his shoulder.

They talk as they walk to the north side of the room.

Baker, reluctant to answer, hangs his head. This doesn't stop Snake—he asks again.

Snake lets out his irritation as he looks at the ArmsTech president.

He offers up an excuse, clearly still rattled by what he's been through.

Now sitting against the wall, Baker lies his legs flat against the ground, making himself more comfortable.

Baker lets out a small cough. There's blood on his chin.

Snake points to Baker's arm.

SNAKE


Can you talk?

KENNETH


Who are you?

SNAKE


I'm not one of them.

SNAKE


The DARPA Chief told me he gave them his detonation code. What about yours?

KENNETH


Oh, I get it. Jim sent you... You... you're from the Pentagon
9 .

SNAKE


Answer my question!

KENNETH


...

SNAKE


What about your code!? There's no time!

KENNETH


I... talked.

SNAKE


What!

SNAKE


Now the terrorists have both codes and can launch anytime!

KENNETH


It's not like I didn't fight. I managed to resist Psycho Mantis' mind probe.

SNAKE


He couldn't read you? How'd you do it?

KENNETH


Surgical implants in my brain.

SNAKE


Surgical implants?

KENNETH


Kind of like a psychic insulation. Everyone who knows these top-secret codes has it.

SNAKE


Even the DARPA Chief?

KENNETH


Of course.

SNAKE


But the DARPA Chief said Mantis got his code by reading his mind.

KENNETH


Are you sure you heard him right?

SNAKE


Yeah, I'm sure... In that case, how did they get your code?

KENNETH


*bitterly* I never had any training on how to resist torture...

SNAKE


It looks like he had some fun with you all right.

KENNETH


He's not human. I tell you, he loved every second of it...

SNAKE


What happened to your arm?

KENNETH


He broke it.

Baker uses his cane to sit up straight.

Baker looks into Snake's eyes.

From Baker's expression, something about this doesn't add up.

Baker explodes into a fit of agitation, whacking Snake on the leg with his cane repeatedly.

Snake grabs the cane and pushes back against Baker.

Baker slumps to the floor.

Baker's shoulders droop, and he hangs his head.

Snake approaches the door to the armory. He continues to talk while keeping an eye on the door.

Snake turns back toward Baker.

SNAKE


Looks like you're more than even now. His was sliced off.

KENNETH


Ha. You're a funny man.

KENNETH


... So... the DARPA Chief... Is he okay?

SNAKE


Dead.

KENNETH


What!?

KENNETH


It can't be!

KENNETH


You know, that's not what you promised, Jim! Now you want to shut me up!

SNAKE


Calm down!

SNAKE


What's wrong with you? I just told you I was here to save you!

KENNETH


...

SNAKE


I didn't kill the DARPA Chief. He had a heart attack or something...

KENNETH


*is extremely doubtful* A heart attack? Oh, don't be a fool...

SNAKE


Anyway, the terrorists have both codes now.

KENNETH


Those boys are totally insane. They wouldn't hesitate to launch...

SNAKE


I agree. But what do they really want?

KENNETH


Who knows. Maybe they're like us in the arms industry...

KENNETH


Always looking forward to the next good war...

SNAKE


Well I'm not going to let these maniacs start a war today.

SNAKE


Do you still have the card keys?

KENNETH


Card keys?

SNAKE


To override the detonation code! I heard you had them...

KENNETH


No, not anymore...

SNAKE


What!? Who does then!? Not the terrorists!?

KENNETH


No. That woman.

SNAKE


Woman!? Who?

KENNETH


A soldier that was thrown in prison along with me.

SNAKE


A female soldier? It must be...

KENNETH


She said that she had just joined up as a new recruit. They threw her in prison... 'cause she refused to take part in the rebellion.

Snake walks back to Baker.

Snake gives a firm nod.

Snake slaps both his knees and stands back up. Baker follows Snake with his eyes.
Baker nods as he answers Snake's question.

Baker looks up at Snake.

Snake walks back and forth in front of Baker again.

Scenes of nuclear weapons being decommissioned, news footage of smaller countries armed with nukes, etc.

Reel after reel of black-and-white news footage.

Baker spouts off about the situation.

SNAKE


A new recruit? Could that be the Colonel's niece!?

KENNETH


I gave her the key.

KENNETH


Looks like she managed to break out of here though. I hope she's okay.

SNAKE


I'm sure she is. She's green... but as tough as they come. But how did you know she escaped?

KENNETH


I was in contact with her by Codec. Until I was tied up here that is.

SNAKE


Codec?

KENNETH


Yes. She stole it from the guard. If she still has it, you should be able to contact her.

SNAKE


I'm sure she still has it. What frequency was she at?

KENNETH


Oh yeah. Let me tell you. It's...

KENNETH


Huh?... Oh... Sorry... I forgot.

SNAKE


Damn!

KENNETH


Oh that's right! It should be on the back of the CD case. Try to contact her.

SNAKE


I'll contact her right away. But tell me... if this doesn't work, is there some other way to prevent the missile launch?

KENNETH


Hmmm. You need to find Hal Emmerich, one of my employees.

SNAKE


Who's that?

KENNETH


The team leader of the Metal Gear Rex project. A genius at engineering, but a little bit of an oddball. If there's anyone who can figure out how to stop Metal Gear from launching, it's him.

SNAKE


What if he can't come up with anything?

KENNETH


You'll have to destroy it. Emmerich knows how to destroy Metal Gear.

SNAKE


Where is this Emmerich?

KENNETH


Well... he's probably being held somewhere in the... Nuclear Warhead Storage Building. It's north from here. That's where he worked.

SNAKE


I understand, but... why Metal Gear? The Nuclear Age ended with the turn of the millennium.

KENNETH


You're wrong. The threat of nuclear war isn't gone... In fact it's greater than it's ever been.

KENNETH


The amount of spent nuclear fuel and plutonium is increasing even today. Listen, have you ever seen a warehouse full of nuclear material?

Baker continues.

Visuals of Metal Gear Rex dormant in its hangar. Snake and Baker continue to speak over them.

Snake approaches Baker.

SNAKE


... No.

KENNETH


Drums and drums of nuclear waste stacked this high... as far as you can see... because there's still no real way to dispose of the stuff.

SNAKE


So they just close the lid and try to pretend like it'll go away?

KENNETH


Essentially, yes. And they're not even doing a good job of storing it. Many of the drums are corroded... with nuclear waste seeping out of them.

SNAKE


Unbelievable.

KENNETH


Not only that, several pounds of MUF are reported every year.

SNAKE


MUF?

KENNETH


It stands for "material unaccounted for." It proves that there's a large and... well organized black market in nuclear materials.

KENNETH


Furthermore, since the end of the Cold War, Russian nuclear engineers, in particular, are out of work with nowhere to turn.

KENNETH


In other words, there's plenty of available nuclear material and scientists... for making a bomb. We live in an age when any small country... can have a nuclear weapons program.

SNAKE


What about the other superpowers?

KENNETH


Russia and China still maintain a significant nuclear presence.

KENNETH


Complete nuclear disarmament is an impossibility...

KENNETH


To maintain our own policy of deterrence, we need a weapon of overwhelming power.

SNAKE


You mean Metal Gear.

KENNETH


Yes. You know, our industry suffered quite a blow... as a result of the cuts in military budgets... due to this so-called "peace."

SNAKE


I remember hearing a lot about mergers and takeovers among the big weapons makers.

KENNETH


Yes. And after my company lost their bid to produce the Air Force's next line of fighter jet, the Metal Gear system was our last ace in the hole.

KENNETH


That's why we pushed to have Metal Gear developed as a black project.

SNAKE


Black project?

KENNETH


Secret projects paid for by the Pentagon's black budget. You can avoid a lot of red tape and get a great lead time on your weapons production. And no one can bother you...

KENNETH


Not even those bleeding heart liberals on the military oversight committee.

SNAKE


Bribes...

KENNETH


I prefer to think of it as good business...

KENNETH


Anyway, Metal Gear was going to be formally adopted... after the results of this exercise were analyzed....

SNAKE


I don't give a crap about you and your company.

Baker removes an optical disc from his coat sleeve. Close-up of the disc.

Baker gives Snake a level two card.

Snake places a hand on Baker's shoulder.

Baker looks worse than before. His face has lost even more of its color.

Baker clutches his chest. His breathing grows heavy.

Baker coughs again. He repositions himself.

Snake comes back around in front of Baker.

Suddenly, Baker is in agony.

Snake goes to touch Baker but stops himself.

Baker presses his hand against his chest.

KENNETH


Yes. That's about what I'd expect from a grunt like you...

KENNETH


Here. This is what you came for, right?

SNAKE


What's that?

KENNETH


An optical disk. It's all here.

KENNETH


The main hard drive was destroyed by gunfire. This is the only remaining copy of the data.

SNAKE


What kind of data?

KENNETH


All the data collected from this exercise.

KENNETH


Don't play dumb. I know you were sent to get this. I hid it from that sadistic maniac while he was torturing me.

KENNETH


They don't know that this disk exists. Make sure that you report this to Jim... to your boss.

SNAKE


...

KENNETH


I'll give you my card too. It'll open up all security level two doors.

SNAKE


Can you walk?

KENNETH


... No... You go on without me.

KENNETH


They got my password... They don't want anything else from me.

SNAKE


I have one more question. Who or what was that ninja thing? It looked like you knew something.

KENNETH


That ninja? That was FOX-HOUND's dark little secret...

SNAKE


Dark little secret?

KENNETH


An experimental... genome... soldier...

SNAKE


You know him?

KENNETH


You should ask Dr. Naomi Hunter from FOX-HOUND.

SNAKE


Naomi?

KENNETH


You've got to stop them... If it goes public, my company and I are... finished...

SNAKE


What? Doesn't Metal Gear use currently existing technology?

KENNETH


Metal Gear itself does, but...

SNAKE


Huh!?

KENNETH


What... what did you do to me!?
He grabs at Snake. Snake backs away.

Snake can't believe this is happening again. Baker is able to grab him by the collar.

Baker's struggling stops. FoxDie has claimed another victim.

His body continues to twitch briefly before becoming still.

This is the second person to die under mysterious circumstances since Snake's mission began.

Snake calls Campbell.


VS Ocelot 4


ArmsTech President Post-Death Codec Call

KENNETH


Uh... Oooh... No!... Ooh... Oh no, it can't be!... Those Pentagon bastards!... So they... they actually went and did it...!

SNAKE


What are you talking about!

KENNETH


They... they're just... using you for... uuuhhh... Uuuuhhh...

SNAKE


What the hell?

SNAKE


Colonel! Are you listening? Now he's dead, too!

CAMPBELL


... I have no idea!

SNAKE


Don't lie to me!

NAOMI


It looked like another heart attack, but...

SNAKE


Some kind of poison!?

NAOMI


Well, there are lots of drugs that can cause a heart attack in large doses. For example, potassium chloride or dioxides... But... we won't be able to tell without doing an autopsy.

SNAKE


Damn...!

CAMPBELL


Snake, I want you and Meryl to work together!

SNAKE


Can I trust her!?

CAMPBELL


... More than you can trust me.

SNAKE


...

CAMPBELL


Get in contact with her.

MEI LING


... Snake, there's a lot of electrical interference coming from there. It should be okay if you do burst transmission like us, but normal transmission is probably impossible. Try moving away from that area.

CAMPBELL


Snake, get a hold of yourself...

SNAKE


Naomi, what the hell was that ninja thing!?

NAOMI


...

SNAKE


A member of FOX-HOUND?

NAOMI


No...

SNAKE


Are you sure?

NAOMI


Yes, we have no one like that in our unit.

SNAKE


... Is that right?

CAMPBELL


Snake, I'm counting on you.
Calling Meryl 1

Calling Meryl Codec Call

Meryl appears in the Codec window. She's still wearing the balaclava.

*If player didn't have the SOCOM at the time

Meryl remembers Snake.

Meryl removes the balaclava, revealing a fresh face that matches her inexperience.

Meryl sounds a little starstruck. Her tone suddenly becomes much more familiar.

Snake thinks back to their stare-down outside the cell.

If load times aren’t an issue, play a flashback of the cutscene where Snake encounters Meryl. Add a sepia filter and some blur.

MERYL


Who are you?

SNAKE


I was really impressed with the way you busted yourself out of there.

MERYL


The one from the prison...?

SNAKE


You're the Colonel's niece, Meryl, right?

MERYL


... No... it's not him... (She thought Snake was Liquid.)

MERYL


Just exactly who are you?

SNAKE


I'm the fool that your uncle sent all alone into the middle of this whole mess.

MERYL


You came by yourself? You think you're some kind of one-man army?

MERYL


You're not even armed.

SNAKE


I appreciate your help from before. But...

SNAKE


I don't need lectures. You're just like your uncle, you know.

MERYL


How do you know my uncle?

SNAKE


We go way back.

MERYL


What's your name?

SNAKE


My name's not important.

MERYL


Aha!

MERYL


Could you be Snake? Are you Solid Snake?

SNAKE


That's what some people called me.

MERYL


The legendary Solid Snake...! You!?

MERYL


Sorry about before... I wasn't sure if you were one of the good guys.

SNAKE


But, I knew you were.

MERYL


How?

SNAKE


It's your eyes.

MERYL


My eyes?

SNAKE


They're not soldier's eyes.

MERYL


They're rookie's eyes, right?

SNAKE


No, they're beautiful, compassionate eyes.

MERYL


Oh, just what I'd expect from the legendary Solid Snake. You trying to sweep me off my feet?

Meryl can't believe Snake had to ask such a question.

SNAKE


Don't worry. You'll land back on them once you meet me. The reality is no match for the legend, I'm afraid.

MERYL


Oh, I don't believe that.

SNAKE


Why did you look so surprised when you saw my face?

MERYL


Because, you look just like him.

SNAKE


... You mean the terrorists' leader, Liquid Snake?

MERYL


Yeah, you know him? You're not brothers, are you!?

SNAKE


I have no family.

MERYL


So, what's the deal then?

SNAKE


Who knows. Why don't you ask him?

SNAKE


But first, I want some information. You were involved in this exercise from the beginning. What exactly happened here?

MERYL


*somewhat baffled* I'm sorry. I was captured along with President Baker, right after the terrorist attack.

SNAKE


That's okay. But, what is this place? I don't think it's just a nuclear weapons disposal facility...

MERYL


Boy, oh boy... it's just like them! Nobody's told you anything, did they? Okay... you see, this place isn't really for disposing nuclear weapons. This base is owned and operated by a dummy corporation of ArmsTech.

SNAKE


This is a civilian base?

MERYL


Right. For the development of Metal Gear.

SNAKE


Colonel!

MERYL


FOX-HOUND and the Next-Generation Special Forces were called here for the test launching of a dummy nuclear warhead.

SNAKE


Why FOX-HOUND?

MERYL


Because, they're a Special Ops group used to handling top secret missions. They figured they could help keep it all hush-hush.

SNAKE


But, we must have fired nuclear warheads before. Why just this time?

MERYL


I heard it was because this was to be a final test before the formal adoption of the Metal Gear program... That's what I heard anyway.

SNAKE


Hmmm... sounds kinda fishy... So, what do you think the terrorists want?

MERYL


*apologetically* Hmmm. Sorry, I'm not sure... I was captured with President Baker right after the revolt started...

SNAKE


Oh yeah. That's when he gave you detonation code override keys, right?

MERYL


That's right.

SNAKE


Amazing you were able to keep'em hidden from the guards.

MERYL


Well... women have more hiding places than men. Anyway, you met Baker, huh? How's he holding up?

Remembering the sight of the chief's body lying in his cell, Meryl cocks her head in puzzlement.

Snake pauses briefly.

SNAKE


... He's dead.

MERYL


What!?

SNAKE


Heart attack. Same as the DARPA Chief...

MERYL


The Chief died from a heart attack, too...?

SNAKE


Yeah... Was either of them sick or anything?

MERYL


No... not that I heard of.

SNAKE


Well, I don't believe in coincidences. Something funny's going on.

MERYL


Hmmm. Sounds like it. But, I have no idea what.

SNAKE


Me neither... yet.

SNAKE


Do you know the person who designed Metal Gear?

MERYL


You mean Dr. Emmerich?

SNAKE


Yes. Is he still alive?

MERYL


Probably. He should be in the research lab in the second floor basement of the Nuclear Warhead Storage Building to the north.

SNAKE


Second floor basement?

MERYL


Yeah, that's where his lab is. I think they're forcing him to work on the nuclear launching program.

SNAKE


So, they'll need him alive until that's done anyway...

MERYL


Then, we'd better do something before he finishes.

SNAKE


You're right. In case we can't override the detonation code in time, I need to ask him how to destroy Metal Gear.

MERYL


*surprised by Snake's rashness* You plan to take that thing on by yourself, Snake?

SNAKE


*nonchalantly* It won't be the first time...

MERYL


Ahhhh.

SNAKE


What's the best way to get to the building where the doctor is being held?

MERYL


There's a cargo door on the first floor of this building that leads to the north.

SNAKE


What's the security level of the door there?

MERYL


Five, but it's okay... I've got a level five card.

SNAKE


Well... I've got to go save the doctor. You should go...

MERYL


I'm going with you!

SNAKE


No way. You're still too green. I want you to hide somewhere.

MERYL


I'm not green.

SNAKE


Oh, yes you are.

MERYL


...

Having this failure pointed out by Snake stings. Meryl's head drops.

Meryl mutters to herself, like she needs to hear herself say it.

Meryl forces herself to refocus on the situation at hand.

This gets Meryl smiling again.

The two of them share a laugh.

SNAKE


You pause for just one second in front of your enemy and it's all over! Good luck doesn't last forever!

MERYL


I don't know what happened. I just couldn't pull the trigger right away.

MERYL


I never had any problems in training...

MERYL


But, when I thought about my bullets tearing through those soldiers' bodies, I... I hesitated...

SNAKE


Shooting at targets and shooting at living, breathing people are different.

MERYL


Ever since I was a little girl, I always dreamed about being a soldier...

MERYL


Everyday of my life, I've trained my mind and body for the one day when I could finally see some real action, and now...

SNAKE


So, what now? You wanna quit?

MERYL


I can't quit. I can't allow myself to quit now.

SNAKE


Listen, Meryl. Everybody feels sick the first time they kill someone.

SNAKE
