•Nastasha


Prior to Ocelot Battle

Armory south – gun camera area

*If player has Stinger Missiles

NASTASHA


This is Nastasha Romanenko. A pleasure to work with you, Solid Snake.

SNAKE


You're the nuclear specialist that the Colonel mentioned?

NASTASHA


That's me. You can ask me anything about nukes that you want.

NASTASHA


I am also a military analyst, so I have an extensive knowledge of weapon systems as well.

NASTASHA


They asked me to participate in this operation as a supervisor from the Nuclear Emergency Search Team. I was happy to accept.

NASTASHA


We must not allow terrorists to get their hands on nuclear weapons of any kind. I hope I can help you to stop them.

SNAKE


You're a tough lady.

NASTASHA


*seriously* Those terrorists are serious about launching a nuclear weapon? The world cannot stand by idly and allow that to happen. And neither can I...

NASTASHA


Unfortunately, all I can do from here is provide you with information...

SNAKE


*kindly while acknowledging Nastasha's enthusiasm* Hopefully, that'll be enough. Another soldier here wouldn't make a difference anyway. It's good to work with you, Nastasha.

NASTASHA


Same here, Snake.

NASTASHA


Security cameras? Da. That is the wireless type which transmits visual data to a central security area. If you use Chaff, you will be able to disable it.

NASTASHA


Snake, there are gun cameras somewhere around there. They'll open fire automatically if they detect you. Be careful.

NASTASHA


You should be able to confuse their sensors briefly with your Chaff. Get past them while they are disabled!

NASTASHA


You could also destroy them with your Stinger Missiles.
•Nastasha

Prior to Calling Meryl

Armory FAMAS room – infrared sensors

*First time only

Armory south – Ocelot battle

*First time only

*Second and subsequent times
•Nastasha

Prior to M1 Tank Battle

Canyon – after hearing about minefield

*If player doesn't have the Mine Detector

*If player does have the Mine Detector

*End of branching dialogue, first time only

NASTASHA


Snake, that room is set with infrared sensors. You should be able to see them if you had some smoke... cigarette smoke or something.

SNAKE


Sorry, but these are smokeless cigarettes.

NASTASHA


You mean those cigarettes that are designed to cut down on second-hand smoke? Oh well. Don't worry... If you blow the smoke in the direction of the infrared sensors, you should be able to see them.

NASTASHA


That was a good idea bringing the cigarettes. But don't smoke too much. Cigarettes make you weak, in mind and body. They are bad for you.

NASTASHA


*with some surprise* He's using a Single Action Army? The first model of that gun was made in 1873... over 130 years ago.

NASTASHA


Today they're still being made in small numbers, but that's just for collectors and such. Nobody uses them in combat anymore...

NASTASHA


The biggest drawback to revolver style handguns is the reload time. That's your chance.

NASTASHA


That area is mined?

NASTASHA


If you only had a Mine Detector...

NASTASHA


After you locate the mines on your radar, crawl forward and retrieve them.

NASTASHA


Anti-personnel mines have killed over 20,000 non-combatants in the past thirty years. In countries like Cambodia and Nicaragua, the killing and maiming of innocent victims continues long after the wars have ended.

NASTASHA


It is easy to plant the mines, you see, but removing them is a different matter. It requires more time and manpower than anyone is willing to invest.

NASTASHA


The superpowers need to donate more mine detectors and other equipment to remove them. It is the least we could do after laying them.
•Nastasha

Prior to Entering Nuclear Warhead Storage Building

Canyon – M1 tank battle

*First time only

*Second time only
•Master

Prior to Entering Heliport Duct

Standing on snow at the heliport


•Master


Prior to Meeting the DARPA Chief

Master Miller's self-introduction

*First call

NASTASHA


That M1 tank is equipped with advanced vetronics. Once it locks on to a target, it automatically tracks it, and its main gun is effective up to 3000 meters (9842 feet).

NASTASHA


To get close, you'll have to confuse its tracking system. Use your Chaff. If you can jam the system and get close enough, it won't be able to use its main gun.

NASTASHA


Use your Chaff at a long distance to fool its electronic systems.

NASTASHA


Even if you can get close, the M1 tank's maximum speed is 45 miles per hour. First, you'll have to slow it down. Go after its caterpillars with C4 or Grenades.

NASTASHA


Once it slows down, toss a Grenade in the commander's turret. The M1 has exceptionally strong armor. With your weapons, the only way to beat it is to attack the soldiers inside through the hatch.

NASTASHA


Try to aim at the upper hatch with your grenades.

MASTER


If you leave a lot of footprints, you can confuse your enemy. But don't let your footprints reveal the direction you went in. Disguise your footprints to fool the enemy.

MASTER


Snake, this is McDonell Miller. It's been a long time.

SNAKE


Master? What are you doing here?

MASTER


I quit being a drill instructor, so I moved out here for some peace and quiet. I'm in retirement just like you. Once in a while I still help train the Alaskan Scouts.

SNAKE


Passing on the skills to a new generation, huh?

MASTER


Campbell told me about the situation here. I thought I might be of some use.

SNAKE


There's no one I'd rather have in a foxhole than you.

MASTER


Well I know lots about survival in a harsh environment.

MASTER


I've lived in Alaska longer than you, so call me if you have any questions about the flora or fauna out here. My frequency is 141.80.
Inside duct
*First time only

*Second and subsequent times
Tank Hangar 2F – noisy walkway
*First time only

*Second and subsequent times

MASTER


Those mice are Alaskan field mice. Don't worry. They can't hurt you.

MASTER


Wild field mice don't have a thick layer of fat, but they can still survive the bitter winters here without hibernating. They dig tunnels under the snow and that's where they stay warm.

SNAKE


Survival specialists, huh? I should learn from them.

MASTER


But there's a dark side too. Sometimes the males will kill and eat offspring that's not their own.

SNAKE


To ensure the survival of their own genes, right?

MASTER


Yeah. Pretty brilliant program, huh?

MASTER


If there are mice, that means there must be an exit somewhere. Follow the mice.

MASTER


Snake, that floor is designed so that your footsteps echo.

MASTER


Listen, Snake. There's a way to walk so that your footsteps won't be heard. I call it "stalking." Here's how you do it.

MASTER


First, put your weight on the opposite foot that you're going to step with. Then take a step so that your heel makes contact with the ground first. Then as you slowly lower the tip of your foot to the floor, gradually shift your weight onto that foot.

MASTER


Use your knees to maintain the subtle balance. Try it.

SNAKE


I... I can't do it...

MASTER


Another way is to wear your socks over your shoes...

MASTER


If you crawl on your stomach, you won't make any noise either...
•Master

Prior to Ocelot Battle

The prison – after the DARPA Chief's death

*First time only
•Master

Prior to Calling Meryl

Armory south – Ocelot battle

*First time only

*Second and subsequent times

After Baker's death

*First time only

MASTER


*surprised* You say the DARPA Chief is dead!?

SNAKE


Yeah... According to Naomi, it was a heart attack.

MASTER


It couldn't be...

MASTER


*bitterly* Well... it looks like all you can do now is find Kenneth Baker, the president of ArmsTech.

MASTER


He's in the second floor basement, isn't he?

SNAKE


Yeah, on the other side of the wall that was cemented over.

MASTER


Okay. Good luck, Snake. You can do it...

MASTER


The muzzle velocity of a bullet fired from a revolver is slower than one fired from an automatic. That's bad for you.

MASTER


The slower a gun's muzzle velocity, the more damage it does. That's 'cause the bullet will tend to lodge in the body instead of going right through.

MASTER


Those kind of wounds take a long time to heal. Sometimes they never do. I think that's part of the reason he likes that gun. He's a real sick puppy, that Ocelot...

MASTER


The biggest drawback to a revolver is the reload time. That's your chance!

MASTER


First, the DARPA Chief and then President Baker die of a heart attack?

SNAKE


Yeah. Smells pretty rotten to me. Master, do you know anything?

MASTER


*thinking* No... but there's definitely something going on. Keep your eyes open out there.
•Master

Prior to M1 Tank Battle

After Deepthroat calls

*First time only
•Meryl

Prior to M1 Tank Battle

Before she opens cargo door

*First time only

*Second and subsequent times

Tank Hangar ground floors – after cargo door is open

Tank Hangar basement floors – after cargo door is open

Heliport – after cargo door is open

Cargo door air lock (incoming call)

SNAKE


Master, does the name Deepthroat mean anything to you?

MASTER


Deepthroat? What? You mean the guy from Watergate?

SNAKE


No. But he uses the same name. Whoever he is, he's not part of our operation, but he's been giving me advice by Codec.

MASTER


What?

SNAKE


On top of that, he wasn't using burst transmission. It seems he was transmitting from somewhere on this base.

MASTER


*hiding his surprise* Somewhere on the base?

SNAKE


Yes.

MASTER


... I have no idea who that could be.

SNAKE


I see...

MERYL


Snake?... Don't be so impatient. Settle down. I need a little more time to get the cargo door open.

MERYL


I'll call you when I get the door open. Just wait a little. Okay?

MERYL


The cargo door's open already. If you exit there and go north, you'll get to the Warhead Storage Building where Dr. Emmerich is being held.

MERYL


I'll head there now and wait for you. Hurry after me okay?

MERYL


Snake, did you lose your way? The cargo door is on the first floor.

MERYL


*shocked* Snake, where are you going? The Warhead Storage Building is north. I can't believe it... Solid Snake is lost... I guess it's true, the reality really can't live up to the legend.

MERYL


Be careful, Snake. That air lock is set with infrared sensors.
*First time only

Obtained a cardboard box

*First time only

Canyon – basics

*First time only

Minefield

*First time only

*If player doesn't have the Mine Detector


•Meryl


Prior to Entering Nuclear Warhead Storage Building

M1 tank battle

*A or B, at random

(A)

(B)

MERYL


You probably can't see them with your naked eyes, but there are infrared beams coming out of that wall. Touch any one of them, and the doors will seal off and the place will be flooded with poison gas.

MERYL


Somehow, you've got to get through without setting off those sensors.

MERYL


A cardboard box? I heard stories from my uncle, but I always thought he was pulling my leg... I... I've got no comment.

MERYL


If you go north from there, you'll eventually come to the Warhead Storage Building. Dr. Emmerich should be in the laboratory area in the second floor basement.

MERYL


I'll go ahead and wait for you there.

SNAKE


Meryl.

MERYL


What? Are you going to tell me to stay back 'cause I'm too green again?

SNAKE


Nope. It's your decision. I can't stop you from doing what you want, but...

MERYL


But?

SNAKE


*concerned* Don't do anything stupid, okay?

MERYL


*jokingly pouting* Stupid? Boy... Thanks for the great show of confidence...

SNAKE


*admonishingly* Meryl...

MERYL


Anyway... I'll see you there.

MERYL


The place is mined? Well, if you use a Mine Detector, you'll be able to see the mines displayed on your radar.

MERYL


If you need a Mine Detector, there should be one on the second floor of the Tank Hangar.

MERYL


I think you might be able to fool the tank's electronic systems with a Chaff Grenade.

MERYL


No matter how good you are, there's no way you can match up against an M1 tank. All you can do is try to take out the person in the driver's seat.

MERYL


With grenades, you should be able to attack the soldier on top of the tank too.
Nuclear Warhead Storage Building 1F

Codec Call
Cyborg Ninja Battle 0

High-Voltage Current Warning

CAMPBELL


Snake, never use your weapon on that floor.

NAOMI


I've already programmed the nanomachines so that he won't be able to, Colonel.

SNAKE


What! What are you talking about!?

NAOMI


Have you forgotten? That's where they keep the nuclear warheads. Can't you see them?

SNAKE


Yeah. There's lots of boxes piled up here, but... are they all warheads?

CAMPBELL


Yes. They're all dismantled warheads.

SNAKE


*disgusted* They just leave them here? It's like President Baker said... totally careless.

CAMPBELL


They're working on a limited budget. They try to put on a pretty face for the media, but this is the grim reality of it. Nastasha knows lots more about it than I do.

CAMPBELL


Her frequency is 141.52.

NAOMI


All of the warheads in those boxes have had their detonation mechanisms removed so there's no fear of them exploding. But if the warheads are broken, they might leak plutonium and that would be a serious problem.

CAMPBELL


Be careful. You absolutely must not use weapons in that area.

DEEPTHROAT


Snake, watch out!

DEEPTHROAT


That place is filled with gas.

DEEPTHROAT


Also, the floor is electrified.

DEEPTHROAT


First, destroy the high-voltage switch.

DEEPTHROAT


It's the switchboard on the northwest wall.

SNAKE


But how? I can't reach it.

DEEPTHROAT


Use a Remote-Controlled Missile.
Cyborg Ninja Battle 1

Soldiers' Bodies Cutscene

Snake enters the narrow passageway that leads to the lab belonging to Metal Gear's development chief, Dr. Hal Emmerich (Otacon). He scans the area.

Cold fluorescent lights reveal bodies of soldiers wearing gas masks piled up along both sides of the passageway, the walls and floor stained with blood.

From the presentation of the mangled flesh and blood spatter, it would appear all of the men were killed by a sword.

Snake traces one of the wounds with his fingers.

Overhead view. The player has control, but the camera drops down behind Snake (facing north), switching to an angle that is closer to a behind-the-character view than a top-down one.

Snake proceeds down the passageway. There's a left turn at the end of it. Before Snake can round the corner, a soldier comes staggering into view and collapses in front of him.

The soldier breathes his last.


Cyborg Ninja Battle 2


In Front of Lab Door Cutscene

Trudging past the stacks of corpses, Snake finds himself in front of the lab.

A second later, gunfire erupts inside as more soldiers engage the Ninja. Their dying screams ricochet off the walls as they are cut down in quick succession.

In front of the open doorway to the lab, one of the soldiers has had a blade shoved clean through his chest by some invisible force.

Sparks shoot out of this unseen foe (the Ninja) at regular intervals. His outline resembles the waves of a mirage.

The soldier's body drops to the ground, and the vague silhouette of the Ninja passes through the doorway back into the lab.

Snake watches him enter in blank amazement.

He follows the Ninja inside.
Cyborg Ninja Battle 3

The Ninja Reappears Cutscene

Otacon's personal lab. Partitions divide it into several booths—one for Otacon, others for his assistants. It's a spotless, well-organized environment.

Its features include office automation computers, large supercomputers (behind the partition on the west side of the room), hard drives, documents, and impressive shelving containing files, books, and even manga, specifically titles that were later adapted into Japanimation.

Flasks, beakers, and test tubes sit on shelves and equipment used for chemical and other experiments.

One nook of the lab has lockers for Otacon and his team.

When Snake enters the room, he sees a man in a lab coat (Otacon). Something has scared him so much his legs have given way.

Bloody footprints lead from the entrance to the space in front of Otacon.

The shimmering shape of the Ninja approaches Otacon, forcing him up against the glass partition in front of the lockers.

Otacon scooches back on his butt toward the wall. He's got nowhere to run.

He's so terrified he wets himself.

His form still hidden, the Ninja scrapes his sword along the patch of floor Otacon has soiled, sending sparks everywhere!

The sparks disrupt the Ninja's stealth camouflage, causing him to flash into view.

A moment later, he materializes and stays that way.

SNAKE


It looks like they were cut by some type of blade.

SOLDIER A


It's... it's a ghost!!!... Uuurgh!

OTACON


!...

OTACON


Stealth camouflage? Who are you?

NINJA


Where is my friend?

OTACON


What... what are you talking about?
Snake moves toward the middle of the room. Otacon spots Snake and directs his attention at him now.

Noticing the change in Otacon's gaze, the Ninja slowly turns around. He sees who Otacon was looking at.

His voice is hard to make out at times—mixed in with it are respiratory noises that sound like they're coming directly from his trachea.

The Ninja turns so he's squarely facing Snake, then readies his blade.

Blood from the soldiers he's just killed still drips from the weapon.

Otacon listens to their exchange as he slowly slides along the wall, putting as much distance between him and the Ninja as possible as he waits for the right moment to run.

As he continues to move, he chokes out in exasperation at the situation he's found himself in.

From the look on Otacon's face, he's made up his mind. He springs into action.

Otacon runs as fast as he can, but not at Snake or the Ninja.

No, he's running for the lockers in the back of the room.

He climbs into the nearest one and slams the door shut.

The Ninja scoffs, unfazed by this. He doesn't move an inch.

The Ninja flourishes his sword, then repositions himself for the battle to come.

OTACON


What next?

NINJA


Snake!!

SNAKE


You're that Ninja...

NINJA


I've been waiting for you, Snake.

SNAKE


Who are you!?

NINJA


Neither enemy nor friend. I am back from a world where such words are meaningless...

NINJA


I've removed all obstacles. Now you and I will battle to the death.

SNAKE


What do you want?

NINJA


I've waited a long time for this day. Now I want to enjoy the moment.

OTACON


What... what's with these guys?... It's like one of my Japanese animes...

NINJA


I've come from another world to do battle with you.

SNAKE


What is it? Revenge?

NINJA


It is nothing so trivial as revenge.

NINJA


A fight to the death with you. Only in that can my soul find respite.

NINJA


I will kill you... or you will kill me... It makes no difference.

OTACON


Waaaaaaaaahhh!!!

NINJA


Hah! Fine! He can watch from inside there.

SNAKE


I need that man. Keep your hands off him.

NINJA


Now. Make me feel it! Make me feel alive again!
Cyborg Ninja Battle 4

The Ninja Flees Cutscene

There can be only one winner of this hand-to-hand contest, and it isn't the Ninja.

He falls to his hands and knees, his body heaving as he catches his breath.

Snake looks down at him, not saying a word.

Slowly the Ninja rises.

It hits Snake like a ton of bricks—this adversary's behavior is all too familiar.

With a swing of his arm, the Ninja's sword reappears.

Suddenly, he arches his back, like an electric current is surging through his body, and starts to spasm.

The Ninja is back on all fours, shaking his head in short, oscillating movements.

He begins banging his head against the ground to try to get some measure of release from the pain.

The sound is like that of a post being driven into the ground.

Inside the locker, Otacon trembles as he sits with his knees against his chest, his hands over his ears.

The Ninja thrashes in agony.
Snake can only stand there and watch as he tries to process this sudden change in the Ninja.

It's as if whoever he is under there is fading away. But the spasms stop, and he sluggishly lifts his head away from the floor.

Snake still doesn't know how to react to all this.

The Ninja quietly observes Snake. It would seem the pain has finally left him.

Otacon lifts his head at this moment of respite.

With another animal roar, the Ninja disappears!

Snake looks up at the ceiling.

The lab practically shakes as the Ninja lets out one final cry.

Snake contacts Campbell.

NINJA


I felt that, Snake...

NINJA


Do you remember me now?

SNAKE


It can't be...! You were killed in Zanzibar...

NINJA


Eeeeyaaaaah!

SNAKE


What!? Not again!! (He thinks he's about to witness another mysterious death.)

NINJA


The... the mediciiiiiine!

SNAKE


What's happening?

NINJA


...I... I... I'm losing myself...

SNAKE


...

OTACON


Is it over?

NINJA


Waaaaaaaaaahhhh!!!!
Cyborg Ninja Battle 5

Post-The Ninja Flees Codec Call

SNAKE


Gray Fox... Colonel, that Ninja is Gray Fox. No doubt about it.

CAMPBELL


Ridiculous. You of all people should know he died in Zanzibar...

NAOMI


*sounding desperate* No. He should have died. ...but he didn't.

CAMPBELL


What!?

NAOMI


It happened before I joined FOX- HOUND's medical staff. They were using a soldier for their gene therapy experiments.

CAMPBELL


I never heard that.

NAOMI


It happened right after you retired... My predecessor, Dr. Clark, was in charge.

CAMPBELL


Dr. Clark?

NAOMI


Yes. He started the gene therapy project.

SNAKE


And where is he now?

NAOMI


He was killed in an explosion in his lab two years ago.

SNAKE


So what about this soldier?

NAOMI


Apparently for their test subject, they decided to use the body of a soldier who was recovered after the fall of Zanzibar...

SNAKE


And that was Gray Fox?

CAMPBELL


But he was already dead!

NAOMI


*holding back anger* Yes. But they revived him. They fitted him with a prototype exoskeleton and kept him drugged for four years... while they experimented on him like a plaything.

NAOMI


Today's Genome Soldiers were born from those experiments.

CAMPBELL


That's the sickest thing I ever heard...

NAOMI


They used him to test all sorts of gene therapy techniques.

SNAKE


... Naomi, why didn't you tell us about this sooner?

NAOMI


... Because it's confidential information.

SNAKE


Is that the only reason?

NAOMI


...

CAMPBELL


Naomi, what happened to Gray Fox after that?


Otacon Rescue 1


Otacon Rescue Cutscene 1

The Ninja has just disappeared from the lab. There's no indication he's still lurking in stealth, and his screams can no longer be heard. Snake approaches the locker Otacon is in.

Otacon lifts his head.

He answers Snake.
With an abundance of caution Otacon opens the locker, then comes crawling out as he looks around.

He gets his first good look at Snake, and a wave of relief washes over him.

Otacon gets up.

Snake realizes Otacon is dragging one of his feet.

He pats his leg.

Snake walks closer to Otacon.

NAOMI


The record says he died in the explosion.

CAMPBELL


I see. But even if that ninja is Gray Fox, the question is why?

SNAKE


From what I could tell, he didn't know who he was.

CAMPBELL


Are you saying that he's just a mindless robot?

SNAKE


I'm not sure, but he seems intent on fighting me to the death... We'll meet again, I know it.

NAOMI


So you'll fight again? Until you kill him?

SNAKE


*sounding upset* Hmmmm... I'd rather not, but maybe that's what he wants...

NAOMI


...

SNAKE


How long are you gonna stay in there?

OTACON


Huh?... Are you one of them?

SNAKE


No, I'm not. I always work alone.

OTACON


Alone? Are you an Otaku too?

SNAKE


C'mon get out. We can't stay here forever.

OTACON


Your uniform's different than theirs.

SNAKE


You're the Metal Gear chief engineer, Hal Emmerich, right?

OTACON


You know me?

SNAKE


I heard about you from Meryl.

OTACON


Oh. So you're here to rescue me?

SNAKE


Sorry, but no. There's something that I've got to do first.

OTACON


Oh. Well... at least you're not one of them...

SNAKE


Huh? Are you hurt?

OTACON


I'm okay. I just twisted my ankle a little bit trying to get away.

SNAKE


Well if that's all, it's nothing to worry about.

SNAKE


I want to ask you something. I need information about Metal Gear.

OTACON


Huh? Metal Gear?

Snake grabs Otacon.

The force behind Snake's words convinces Otacon he's telling the truth. He hangs his head.
Otacon cannot believe what Snake has told him.

The camera shows off Rex in its hangar.

Close-up of the rail gun unit as Snake and Otacon continue.

Close-up of Metal Gear's nuclear module (resembles a
randoseru backpack).

SNAKE


Yeah. What's Metal Gear really designed for?

OTACON


It's a mobile TMD
1 (theater missile defense). It's designed to shoot down nuclear missiles... only for defensive purposes, of course.

SNAKE


Liar! I already know that Metal Gear is nothing but a nuclear-equipped, walking death-mobile!

OTACON


Nuclear? What are you talking about?

SNAKE


The terrorists are planning to use Metal Gear to launch a nuclear missile. You telling me you didn't know?

OTACON


They're gonna put a dismantled warhead into Metal Gear's... TMD missile module?

SNAKE


Wrong. From the beginning, the purpose of this exercise was to... test Metal Gear's nuclear launch capability... using a dummy nuclear warhead. The terrorists are just continuing the work... you started!

OTACON


No, you're wrong...

SNAKE


I heard it directly from your boss, Baker.

OTACON


No... a nuclear missile on Rex...?

SNAKE


*completely shocked* ... So you really didn't know?

OTACON


No. All the armament was built by a separate department... and the president personally supervised the final assembly... of the main unit.

SNAKE


President Baker?

OTACON


Yeah. I was never told exactly what they armed Rex with. I... I only know it's equipped with a vulcan cannon, a laser, and a rail gun.

SNAKE


A rail gun, you said?

OTACON


Yeah. It uses magnets to fire bullets at extremely high velocities. The technology was originally developed for the SDI
2 system... and later scrapped. We were successful in miniaturizing it in a joint venture between ArmsTech and Rivermore National Labs 3 . The rail gun is on Rex's right arm.

SNAKE


Metal Gear's main function is to launch nuclear missiles. You sure you're not forgetting something?

OTACON


It's true that Metal Gear has a missile module on his back that can carry up to eight missiles. But... are you saying it was originally meant to carry nuclear missiles?
Otacon Rescue 2

Otacon's Lab – Otacon's Desk

Snake and Otacon are now at Otacon's desk.

Otacon is sitting in his chair.

Snake sits on the desk.

On the wall by the desk are what appears to be blueprints for Metal Gear.

Snake points to them as he continues.

Otacon thinks it over.

He suddenly realizes what's likely going on. He moves his hands in an over-the-top manner.

News footage (black and white) of a virtual laboratory. Film of nuclear testing.

Snake and Otacon have changed locations again.

They're by the row of supercomputers (damaged if they were hit during the battle).

Otacon continues in front of them.

Snake looks at the supercomputers.

Otacon falls to the ground.

He pounds it with his fist, over and over and over, blood seeping out of his hand.

Otacon sheds tears as he speaks.

Footage of the Manhattan Project, the Enola Gay, the Fat Man nuclear bomb, Hiroshima, Nagasaki.

SNAKE


Yeah. But that's not all I think. If Metal Gear fired only standard nuclear missiles, then they should already have all the practical data they need.

OTACON


No... could it be?

OTACON


Metal Gear's co-developer... Rivermore National Labs, was working on a new type of nuclear weapon. They were using NOVA and NIF laser nuclear fusion testing equipment... and supercomputers.

SNAKE


So they developed a new type of nuclear weapon... in a VR testing lab, huh?

OTACON


Yes, but... you can't use virtual data on a battlefield. They would need actual launch data.

OTACON


These are some of the supercomputers. If you link these, you can test everything in a virtual environment. But it's all just theoretical...

SNAKE


So this exercise was designed to test the real thing?

OTACON


What did our president do!? If the terrorists launch that thing...

OTACON


Damn!!

OTACON


...Damn!!

OTACON


I'm such a fool! It's all my fault...

OTACON


The truth is... my grandfather was part of the Manhattan Project
4 .

OTACON


He suffered with the guilt for the rest of his life. And my father... he was born on August 6, 1945...

SNAKE


The day of the Hiroshima bomb... God's got a sense of humor all right.

OTACON


Three generations of Emmerich men... We must have the curse of nuclear weapons written into our DNA.
Snake and Otacon are back in front of the lockers.

Otacon breaks down crying.
In front of the lockers. Otacon is wearing a stealth camouflage coat he removed from one of them (he hasn't activated it, so he's still visible). Otacon is raring to go. He starts walking, with big swings of his arms as he drags his foot.

Snake readies his weapon and starts preparing to leave the lab.

OTACON


I used to think that I could use science to help mankind.

OTACON


But the one that wound up getting used was me... Using science to help mankind... that's just in the movies...

SNAKE


That's enough crying. Pull yourself together!

SNAKE


Where is Metal Gear? Where on this base are they keeping it?

OTACON


Rex is in the underground maintenance base.

SNAKE


Where is that?

OTACON


North of the Communications Tower. But it's a long way there.

SNAKE


The emergency override system... for the detonation code is there too?

OTACON


Yeah... In the maintenance base's Control Room.

OTACON


You'd better hurry. If they were planning a launch from the start, then their ballistic program is probably finished. And since they haven't called for me in a few hours, they must not need me. In other words, they must be ready to launch.

SNAKE


Meryl's got the detonation code override keys. We'll link up with her.

OTACON


If we can't override the launch, we'll have to destroy Rex.

OTACON


I'll show you the way.

SNAKE


On that leg of yours? You'll just slow me down.

OTACON


You'll need me if you're gonna destroy Rex.

SNAKE


I don't need you. I just need your brain.

OTACON


I created Rex. It's my right... my duty to destroy him.

SNAKE


If you get a chance, try to escape. When the coast is clear I'll contact you by Codec.

OTACON


How am I supposed to escape from an island?

SNAKE


Okay.

OTACON


So what then?

SNAKE


I want you to hide somewhere and keep me informed. You know this place well, don't you?

OTACON


Course I do. And don't worry... I've got this.
Otacon activates his stealth camouflage.

He's now invisible, just like the Ninja. Only a vague outline of his body can be seen.

Snake calls Meryl.


Otacon Rescue 3


Calling Meryl Codec Call

Gunfire, then static...

Mantis' brainwashing music is audible in the background.

The static after the gunfire was from Meryl's radio being destroyed.

Snake ends the call.
Otacon Rescue 4

Otacon Rescue Cutscene 2

Snake and Otacon are back in front of Otacon's desk.

Snake is concerned.

Otacon folds his arms and thinks.

Snake thinks back to the rear view he got of Meryl as she was running away from him.

Flashback video of that moment.

OTACON


It's the same stealth technology as the Ninja. FOX-HOUND was going to use them, but... With this I'll be fine, bad leg and all.

SNAKE


Good. But I want Meryl to watch after you too.

SNAKE


Meryl, the engineer's okay.

MERYL


That's a relief.

SNAKE


I want you to look after him. Where are you now?

MERYL


Very close.

ENEMY VOICE


There she is! Over there!

MERYL


Oh no! Damn... they've spotted me!!

SNAKE


Meryl! What happened!?

SNAKE


Something's wrong.

OTACON


Did you hear something? Wasn't that some kind of music?

SNAKE


What did she look like?

OTACON


She... she was wearing the same green uniform as the terrorists.

SNAKE


A disguise?

OTACON


She had such a cute way of walking. She kind of wiggles her behind...

SNAKE


You were really looking.

OTACON


Well... she's got a very cute behind...

SNAKE


Way of walking, huh.

OTACON


If she's disguised as the enemy, you'll have to contact her when she's alone, huh.

Hiding his embarrassment, Otacon hands Snake a card.

Snake suddenly realizes something.

He touches Otacon's shoulder.

Snake places his hand on Otacon, wondering if he's okay. This strikes Otacon as odd.

Otacon looks around his lab.

He's got posters and models related to Japanimation and
tokusatsu media.
Close-up of the POLICENAUTS EMPS poster. Otacon starts walking around the lab like he's introducing Snake to the place.

Snake stays seated on the desk as he follows Otacon with his eyes.

OTACON


There's only one place where we can be sure she's by herself.

SNAKE


Where's that?

OTACON


Don't be so dense...

OTACON


Here... Use this security card.

OTACON


It's security level 4.

SNAKE


You're not in pain are you!? (Referring to FoxDie.)

OTACON


Huh?

SNAKE


You feel okay? Nothing bothering you?

OTACON


What's wrong? Getting friendly all of a sudden?

SNAKE


Oh nothing... I'm glad you're okay.

OTACON


You're strange.

SNAKE


I'm little nervous. Everyone else I've saved suddenly dies.

OTACON


You're bad luck.

SNAKE


Forget it, Doctor.

OTACON


Call me Otacon.

SNAKE


Otacon?

OTACON


It stands for Otaku Convention. An otaku is a guy like me who likes Japanimation.

OTACON


Japan was the first country to successfully make bipedal robots. They're still the best in the field of robotics.

SNAKE


And Japanese cartoons played some part in that?

OTACON


They did. I didn't get into science to make nuclear weapons, you know.

SNAKE


That's what all scientists say.

OTACON


I became a scientist because I wanted to make robots like the ones in the Japanese animes. Really, it's true.

SNAKE


It just sounds like a childish excuse to me.

OTACON


You're right. We have to take responsibility. Science has always thrived on war. The greatest weapons of mass destruction were created by... scientists who wanted to be famous.
Otacon has given this some serious thought. He looks at Snake like a man determined to start a new chapter of his life.

Snake walks toward Otacon.

Otacon reactivates his stealth camo. Just like that, it's like he's not even there.

The door opens automatically, the invisible Otacon leaves, and the door closes behind him.
Find Meryl 1

Meeting Meryl Cutscene

B1 of Nuclear Warhead Storage Building. Snake needs to locate Meryl, who's disguised as an enemy soldier. He spots one of them entering the ladies' bathroom, which is indeed the only place there where a woman would be by herself.

Snake follows the soldier into the bathroom.

However, there's no sign of the soldier (Meryl).

There are three stalls.

Snake starts looking under the doors.

There's no one visible in the left or middle stalls.

But then, he notices a pair of boots in the stall on the right.

Meryl is actually hiding in the cabinet under the sink.

Snake barges into the stall.

But he's been had—the boots were deliberately positioned in front of the toilet to make it look like someone was sitting on it.

Light infantry camo and a balaclava have been placed on the toilet too.

Snake turns around to see Meryl standing there (she was hiding in the cabinet under the sink).

Meryl lowers the barrel of her FAMAS.

She's already taken off the fatigues she was wearing and is back to the tank top from before. Meryl isn't wearing a bra either, with the result that her nipples can be seen poking through the material.

She's still wearing the ammo belt and harness she stole from Johnny Sasaki.

The ammo belt has a magazine pouch and first-aid kit attached to it. She wears a pair of tight leather pants and sports a large survival knife sheathed on her thigh.

OTACON


But that's all over now. I won't take part in murder anymore.

SNAKE


Whatever. All I want from you is information.

OTACON


Sure. I know everything about this whole base. Ask me anything about Rex or about this place...

OTACON


Also, with this stealth camouflage, I can sneak in and out of the armory and mess hall. If you need ammo or rations, just tell me and I'll bring them to you.

OTACON


I'm on frequency 141.12. See ya later...

MERYL


Don't move!

MERYL


That's the second time I've been able to sneak up on the legendary Solid Snake.

SNAKE


You're Meryl?
Snake needs a moment to get over Meryl's looks.

Meryl takes a little offense to this.

Meryl looks down at the floor, something clearly troubling her. She has a tattoo of FOX-HOUND's old insignia on her left shoulder.

She twists her hips to look at it herself.
Meryl looks at Snake with a nostalgia for something she never got to experience.

She's a little baffled by Snake's answer.

Snake sidesteps Meryl's question.

SNAKE


There's no way you could pass for a man for long.

MERYL


What do you mean? Hey! Men aren't allowed in here.

SNAKE


I had no idea you were so feminine.

MERYL


This is no time to try and hit on me, Snake.

MERYL


Besides, it's a waste of time. When I joined up, they gave me psychotherapy to destroy my interest in men.

SNAKE


Same smart mouth... You're Meryl all right. Are you hurt?

MERYL


Not yet. After all, I was disguised as a Genome Soldier.

SNAKE


So why'd you change? You'd be a lot better off dressed like one of them.

MERYL


... I got tired of disguising myself.

MERYL


The truth is... the uniform smelled like blood...

SNAKE


What's that mark?

MERYL


Huh? Oh. This? It's a paint tattoo. It's not real. I was a fan of FOX-HOUND way back. When guys like you and my uncle were in it.

MERYL


None of that gene therapy like there is today. You guys were real heroes.

SNAKE


There are no heroes in war. All the heroes I know are either dead... or in prison.

MERYL


One or the other. But, Snake. You're a hero. Aren't you?

SNAKE


I'm just a man who's good at what he does. Killing. There's no winning or losing for a mercenary. The only winners in war are the people.

MERYL


That's right. And you fight for the people.

SNAKE


I've never fought for anyone but myself. I've got no purpose in life. No ultimate goal...

MERYL


Come on.

SNAKE


It's only when I'm cheating death on the battlefield. The only time I feel truly alive.

MERYL


Seeing other people die makes you feel alive, huh? You love war and don't want it to stop... Is it the same with all great soldiers throughout history?

SNAKE


Why didn't you contact me?

MERYL


My Codec was broken.

SNAKE


Is that all?

MERYL


Shouldn't you just be happy we met up like this!?
Meryl rests the FAMAS against a wall, perhaps as part of an attempt to reset the mood.

Snake looks down at Meryl's lower half.

They look each other in the eye. A bit of silence...

Meryl draws the knife from her thigh, holds it up, and moves her wrist back and forth (same thing the Meryl in POLICENAUTS likes to do).
Meryl sheathes her knife and, reaching into her tank top, takes out the key.

She's holding only one key.

Snake takes the key. He asks the obvious.

Meryl takes Snake by the arm and turns him so he's facing her.

Their bodies are reflected in the mirror behind them.

Meryl looks into Snake's eyes and responds with all seriousness.

Without batting an eye, Snake answers back.

Meryl steps away from Snake and looks at herself in the mirror as she walks up to the sink and continues.

MERYL


How did you recognize me in disguise?

SNAKE


I never forget a lady.

MERYL


So there's something you like about me, huh?

SNAKE


Yeah, you've got a great butt.

MERYL


My butt?

MERYL


Oh I see... First it's my eyes, now it's my butt. What's next?

SNAKE


On the battlefield you never think about what's next.

MERYL


So Snake... how are the negotiations going?

SNAKE


No progress.

MERYL


So it's all up to you, huh?

SNAKE


Somebody's got to stop them from launching a nuclear missile.

MERYL


There are two ways. Either we destroy Metal Gear, or...

SNAKE


... We override the detonation code. You got the card keys from Baker?

MERYL


... Card keys? You mean this?

SNAKE


Where are the others? There should be three keys.

MERYL


This is all I've got.

SNAKE


Where could the other two be?

MERYL


I have no idea, but they must be somewhere. If we can't find them we'll have no choice but to destroy Metal Gear.

SNAKE


Metal Gear is in an underground maintenance base to the north.

MERYL


Take me too. I know this place better than you do.

SNAKE


You'll just slow me down. You don't have enough battle experience.

MERYL


I won't slow you down. I promise...

SNAKE


And what if you do?

MERYL


Then you can shoot me.

SNAKE


I don't like to waste bullets.

Snake stands behind Meryl, hearing her out.

Snake goes through his gear, getting ready to leave.

Meryl wipes away a tear with the back of her hand.

Snake points to the FAMAS lying against the wall.

Snake looks at Meryl's Desert Eagle.

Snake glances at his SOCOM.

MERYL


Got it. I'll be careful...

MERYL


Y'know... I don't use makeup the way other women do...

MERYL


I hardly ever look at myself in the mirror. I've always despised that kind of woman.

MERYL


I always dreamed of becoming a soldier.

MERYL


But I was wrong... It wasn't really my dream. My father... he was killed in action when I was younger.

SNAKE


You wanted to follow in your father's footsteps?

MERYL


Not really. I thought that if I became a soldier I could understand him better.

SNAKE


So are you a soldier yet?

MERYL


I thought I was until today. But... now I understand. The truth is I was just afraid of looking at myself. Afraid of having to make my own decisions in life.

MERYL


But I'm not going to lie to myself anymore. It's time I took a long hard look at myself...

MERYL


I want to know who I am, what I'm capable of... I want to know why I've lived the way I've lived until now. I want to know...

SNAKE


Take a good look. You won't get another chance for a while. You should wash your face too while you're at it.

MERYL


Yeah...

SNAKE


This isn't a training exercise. Our lives are riding on this. There are no heroes or heroines. If you lose, you're worm food.

MERYL


Yeah...

SNAKE


Is that FAMAS functional?

MERYL


Unfortunately it's out of ammo.

SNAKE


Where did ya get that Desert Eagle?

MERYL


I found it in the armory.

MERYL


It's a .50 caliber Action Express
5 ...

MERYL


There was a SOCOM pistol too, but I chose this.

SNAKE


Hmm. So I got a leftover, huh.

SNAKE


Isn't that gun a little big for a girl?

MERYL


Don't worry, I can handle it.

SNAKE


C'mon. Use my .45.

MERYL


Listen, I've used a gun like this since I was 8 years old. I'm more comfortable with it than I am with a bra.
Meryl pops a new magazine into her gun. She pulls back its heavy slide and lets it spring forward, chambering the first round.

Meryl hands Snake the card.

He takes it.

Snake has finished checking his equipment. He stands in front of the south door in his ready stance.

Meryl exits the bathroom ahead of Snake.

He follows her back into the corridor.

Standing outside the bathroom entrance, Meryl looks around.

There isn't a guard in sight.

Mantis' "hymn," which had been playing before, can no longer be heard.
Find Meryl 2

Mantis' Thoughts Slip In Cutscene

Snake and Meryl make their way to the commander's room, passing through the door that leads to it.

Once through the door, it's like they've stepped into another world. The corridor wouldn't feel out of place in an opulent residence or a five-star hotel.

A red carpet leads toward the commander's room.

They can see the door at the end of the long corridor.

Once Snake reaches a certain point in the corridor, Meryl moves past him and stops in front of the commander's room.

Mantis' hymn gradually fades back in.

When Meryl hears it, she crouches and grabs her head.

Snake tries to approach her, but she orders him to stay back.

MERYL


If we're gonna go to the north, we'll have to go through the Commander's Room on this floor.

MERYL


The overland route is blocked by glaciers.

MERYL


The door to the commander's room is security level 5. This card will open it.

MERYL


It was inside the pocket of the uniform I was wearing.

SNAKE


Looks like he must have been guarding someplace important.

MERYL


Okay. Let's go. I know this place better than you.

MERYL


I'll be pointman. Follow me...

MERYL


That's strange. There's no guard.

SNAKE


What happened to the music?

MERYL


I'll keep a look out. Make sure you're ready, okay?

MERYL


My head!.... Ooh. It hurts!...

SNAKE


What's wrong?

MERYL


Don't come here, Snake!
Find Meryl 3

Puppet Meryl Cutscene

Psycho Mantis' POV as seen from inside the commander's room pops into view. High-speed flashing back and forth between Mantis' POV and the game's regular overhead view.

Mantis' POV flies through the door. Once outside the commander's room, he sees Snake and Meryl standing there. His POV then goes shooting into Meryl's head. Mantis' hymn grows louder.

After a bout of pain, Meryl collapses to her knees and goes limp.

Meryl comes to, then shakes her head as she stands.

Meryl talks with a steely voice, like nothing happened.

She continues on, walking like she's possessed.

Meryl stops just outside the commander's room.
Mantis Battle 1

Meryl Controlled By Mantis Cutscene

Snake enters the commander's room. Meryl follows him in.

The place appears to be empty.

The red carpet extends into the room. Voluminous bookcases complement the walls. In the center is a grand desk, presumably the commander's, with a high-back chair to match. The walls are decorated with framed photos of previous commanders, commendations, and other achievements. On the desk is a computer, paperwork, an ashtray, and various other items.

On the left side of the room is a holographic model of the entire base, including the Communications Tower.

On the right are seats for visitors.

Hanging on the wall behind the commander's desk is the Outer Heaven insignia.

It's a neatly arranged room, and also one that gives the impression someone was in it until just moments ago.

The one thing out of the ordinary is what was a full-length mirror on the east side of the room. It's been shattered, the pieces scattered across the floor.

The polished floor offers a reflection of the room's walls, furniture, and furnishings.

A bookshelf at the back of the room hides the door leading to the caves.

When Snake enters the room, the hymn gets noticeably louder.

Snake is free to move around the room for now.

After a set amount of time, the song increases to max volume, and right as it does so, Meryl is bent backwards, as though she has just been electrocuted.

SNAKE


Are you okay!!?

SNAKE


What happened!?

MERYL


... I'm fine.

MERYL


Okay. Let's go.

MERYL


C'mon, Mr. FOX-HOUND. The commander is waiting.

MERYL


Aaargh...!
After recovering from this, she starts to shamble toward Snake like a zombie.

Her eyes don't appear to be focused on anything at all.

Meryl raises her Desert Eagle in front of her, holding it with just one hand as she continues walking.

This isn't any proper shooting stance that's been drummed into her; her arm behaves as if her wrist is being held up with a string—like a puppet.

She begins to speak in a strained tone of voice that seems very out of character. Gradually she becomes more and more muffled, her breathing labored, as though she were wearing a gas mask (Mantis has assimilated her). Mantis briefly flashes into sight behind her before disappearing.

Snake can't quite believe what he's seeing.

Snake backs away from Meryl.

Mantis appears behind Meryl once more.

Meryl points her gun at Snake, though now her eyes aren't even looking in his direction.

Meryl opens fire.
Mantis Battle 2

Mantis Appears Cutscene

Snake manages to knock Meryl unconscious.

Mantis deactivates his stealth camouflage, appearing from out of thin air. He floats about a foot off the ground.

Judging from Mantis' visible reaction, Snake's words have hurt his pride.

Snake remains vigilant as he goes over to Meryl and touches her neck to check her pulse.

Snake is admittedly perplexed at how Mantis knew exactly what he was thinking.

Snake points his SOCOM (or FAMAS) at Mantis and is about to shoot him.

Mantis holds his arms out at 45-degree angles as he remains floating.

Mantis analyzes three factors as he continues the conversation: (1) the player's actions up to this point, (2) their save data, and (3) peripherals connected to the console.

MERYL


Snake... do you... like me?

SNAKE


What the...

MERYL


Do you like me? Hold me, Snake!

SNAKE


What's wrong!?

SNAKE


Huh?

MANTIS


Useless woman!

SNAKE


Optic camouflage, huh? I hope that's not your only trick.

MANTIS


You! You doubt my power!?

MANTIS


Now I will show you... why I am the most powerful practitioner of... psychokinesis and telepathy in the world.

MANTIS


No... there's no need for words, Snake.

MANTIS


I am Psycho Mantis.

MANTIS


That's right... This is no trick. It is true power.

MANTIS


It's useless. I told you... I can read your every thought.
(1) Player's Actions

Determined according to: (A) number of times spotted by the enemy, (B) number of times killed by the enemy, and (C) number of times killed by a trap. Mantis shares with the player an analysis of their gameplay history (their pattern).

*Pattern 1

(A) If the player has been spotted a lot

(B) If the player has been killed a lot

(C) If the player has been killed by traps a lot/not a lot

(B) If the player hasn't been killed a lot

(C) If the player has been killed by traps a lot/not a lot

*Pattern 2

(A) If the player hasn't been spotted a lot
(B) If the player has been killed a lot

(C) If the player has been killed by traps a lot/not a lot

(B) If the player hasn't been killed a lot

(C) If the player has been killed by traps a lot/not a lot

(2) Save Data

Mantis' lines change according to the contents of the player's save data. However, this is limited to Konami titles only.

*If there is no save data

*If there is save data

*By Title

1. If there's a lot of data from TOKIMEKI MEMORIAL games

MANTIS


Now let me read your mind. No... perhaps I should say your past.

MANTIS


You're a careless man, aren't you?

MANTIS


And you're a poor warrior as well.

MANTIS


And the same goes with traps.

MANTIS


However, you are skillful at eluding traps.

MANTIS


However, you are a skilled warrior. You like brute force...

MANTIS


But you are careless around traps.

MANTIS


You are extremely cautious around traps.

MANTIS


You are a very methodical man. The type that always kicks his tires before he leaves.

MANTIS


And yet you are rather ineffective in battle.

MANTIS


And you need to beware of traps as well.

MANTIS


It seems that you are careful with traps.

MANTIS


You are a highly skilled warrior, well suited to this stealth mission.

MANTIS


However, traps are your weak point.

MANTIS


You are extremely careful of traps. You are either very cautious, or you are a coward...

MANTIS


Still don't believe me? Now I'll read more deeply into your soul.

MANTIS


Hmmm...Your memory is completely clean.

MANTIS


Ah...I can see into your mind...

MANTIS


So you like TOKIMEKI MEMORIAL?
2. If there's data from POLICENAUTS

3. If there's data from SUIKODEN

4. If there's data from AZURE DREAMS

5. If there's data from Castlevania

6. If there's data from VANDAL HEARTS

Editor's Note: Option 1 and 2 are only available in the Japanese release.

*By Genre

1. If there's a lot of data from graphic adventure games

2. If there's a lot of data from RPGs

3. If there's a lot of data from action games

4. If there's a lot of data from sports games

5. If there's a lot of data from arcade ports
*By Game Company

1. If there's a lot of data from Konami titles

*By MGS Save Data

1. If there's a lot of save data

2. If there's little save data

3. If there's no save data

(3) If an analog controller is connected

MANTIS


You like POLICENAUTS, don't you?

MANTIS


So you like SUIKODEN?

MANTIS


So you like AZURE DREAMS?

MANTIS


You like Castlevania, don't you?

MANTIS


So you like VANDAL HEARTS.

MANTIS


So you like adventure games?

MANTIS


You enjoy role-playing games.

MANTIS


You like action games!

MANTIS


You like to play sports games!

MANTIS


You like arcade games.

MANTIS


I see that you enjoy Konami games.

MR.KOJIMA


Thank you for your support.

MANTIS


Hmmm. You have saved often. You are a prudent person.

MANTIS


Hmmm. You have not saved often. You are somewhat reckless.

MANTIS


And you are neglecting to save this game as well. You will regret it.

MANTIS


I can read you like an open book!

MANTIS


You still don't believe me!? I will show you my psychokinetic power.

MANTIS


Put your controller on the floor.

MANTIS


Put it down as flat as you can... That's good.

MANTIS


Now I will move your controller... by the power of my will alone!!

MANTIS


Huaaagh!
If rumble is turned on, the controller vibrates on the floor!

End of demonstration.

Mantis materializes, floating in mid-air, and attacks.

Once the player has inflicted a certain amount of damage to him, he takes control of Meryl again.

After the player knocks her out once more:

Mantis forces Meryl to point the barrel of her gun at her own head.

Snake wastes no time in going up to her and stopping her from pulling the trigger.

He knocks her out yet again, and the battle against Mantis resumes.
Mantis Battle 3

Mantis Defeated Cutscene

Snake comes out on top in his battle to the death with Mantis.

Mantis deactivates his stealth camo and falls to his knees.

Snake calls Campbell to let him know Meryl is okay.


Mantis Battle 4


Post-Mantis Defeat Codec Call

MANTIS


What do you think now!? Can you feel my power now!!!?

MANTIS


The demonstration is over!!

MANTIS


You are powerful indeed...

MANTIS


But I know your weak point!

MANTIS


Meryl. Stand right where he can see you...

MANTIS


And blow your brains out!!!

MERYL


Aaah!!

SNAKE


Stop! Meryl!!

MANTIS


No!! It cannot be!! Noo!!

SNAKE


Colonel, your niece is going to be okay.

CAMPBELL


Thanks, Snake. I owe you one.

SNAKE


Now that Mantis is beaten, Meryl's brainwashing should wear off, right Naomi?

NAOMI


Yes... Why did you go so far out of your way to save her? For Campbell's sake? ... Or... maybe it's because you like her? (She is unaware of it, but she says this with some jealously in her voice.)

SNAKE


I don't want to see any woman die right in front of me.

NAOMI


*harshly* Oh really? Since when did anybody's death bother you so much?

CAMPBELL


*admonishingly* Naomi! It's true that Snake has killed a lot of people... That doesn't mean he doesn't have a heart.

SNAKE


It's okay, Colonel... She's right.

NAOMI


...
Mantis Battle 5

Mantis Dies Cutscene

A defeated Mantis lies face-up on the floor. Meryl, still out cold, is face-down on it.

Snake walks up to Mantis.

Meryl regains consciousness. She shakes her head a little.

Mantis has been shot in the abdomen. Some of his internal organs—covered with excrement—are sticking out.

Mantis holds them in, desperately trying to keep them from spilling out entirely.

He casts a sidelong glance at Meryl as he speaks, struggling to breathe.

Mantis is lying face-up.

Snake gets down on one knee next to him.

Not too far away, Meryl looks down at him, appearing creeped out.
Meryl, still on the defensive, walks up next to Snake.

Snake takes off Mantis' mask from the bottom up, revealing his face for the first time.

It has no skin whatsoever. There are stitches running across his forehead and mouth. His eye sockets are sunken, the eyes themselves—bloodshot and devoid of any luster—are cold and unwelcoming.

Mantis continues. With his mouth sewn shut, he isn't speaking verbally—he talks directly into Snake and Meryl's minds.

The familiar sound of his breathing through the gas mask is gone.

MANTIS


So... you used the other...

MANTIS


I... I wasn't able to read the future...

SNAKE


A strong man doesn't need to read the future. He makes his own.

MANTIS


Perhaps so... But I will read your future...

MANTIS


To get to Metal Gear's underground maintenance base... you have to go through that hidden door. There's a hidden door behind the bookcase.

MANTIS


The overland route... It's blocked by frozen glaciers. Go past the Communication Towers. Then use the tower's walkway.

SNAKE


Why are you telling me this?

MANTIS


I can read people's minds. In my lifetime, I have read the pasts, presents and futures... of thousands upon thousands of men and women...

MERYL


Oh... gross...

MANTIS


And each mind that I peered into... was stuffed with the same single object of obsession. That selfish and atavistic desire to pass on one's seed... It was enough to make me sick. Every living thing on this planet exists to mindlessly pass on their DNA. We're designed that way. And that's why there is war.

MANTIS


But you... you are different...

MANTIS


You're the same as us. We have no past, no future. We live in the moment. That's our only purpose.

MANTIS


Humans weren't designed to bring each other happiness. From the moment we're thrown into this world, we're fated to bring each other nothing but pain and misery.

MANTIS


The first person who's mind I dove into was my father's.

MANTIS


I saw nothing but disgust and hatred for me in his heart. My mother died in childbirth... and he despised me for it...

MANTIS


I thought my father was going to kill me.

MANTIS


That's when my future disappeared. I lost my past as well. When I came to, the village was engulfed in flames...

Snake reaches for Mantis' body.

Mantis glances at Meryl and speaks.

Mantis nods slowly.
Listening next to Snake, Meryl blushes. She pulls on Snake's hand a little, getting him to look at her.

Snake puts the mask back on.

Mantis spits out a sigh of relief. He's glad to be back inside.

Mantis uses his last shred of telekinetic power to move the heavy bookcase behind them.

Behind it was a door.

It will remain open from now on.

His strength almost exhausted, Mantis can just barely manage a smile—but he does.

Mantis dies. Snake gets up, leaving him where he is.

SNAKE


Are you saying that you burned your village down to... bury your past?

MANTIS


*with a twisted, but joyous laugh* I see that you have suffered the same trauma. We are truly the same, you and I...

MANTIS


...The world is a more interesting place with people like you in it...

MANTIS


I never agreed with the Boss's revolution... His dreams of world conquest do not interest me. I just wanted an excuse to kill as many people as I could.

MERYL


You monster...!

SNAKE


Let him talk. He doesn't have much time left.

MANTIS


I've seen true evil. You, Snake. You're just like the Boss... No, you're worse. Compared to you, I'm not so bad.

MANTIS


... I read her mind as well.

SNAKE


Meryl's?

MANTIS


I saw you there... You have a large place in her heart.

SNAKE


A large place?

MANTIS


Yes. A large place.

MANTIS


But I do not know if your futures lie together.

MANTIS


I have a last request...

SNAKE


What is it?

MANTIS


My mask... put it back on.

SNAKE


Okay...

MANTIS


Like this... other people's thoughts force their way into my mind. Before I die... I want to be by myself. I want to be left alone in my own world.

MANTIS


... I'll open the door for you. If you want to find your future, go through that door.

MANTIS


This is the first time... I've ever used my power to help someone.

MANTIS


It's strange... It feels... kind of... nice.
Mantis Battle 6

With Meryl Cutscene

Mantis is dead.

Leaving his body where it lies, Snake makes his way to the open door.

He peers through it, scoping out the path ahead, then looks back at Meryl.

Meryl is staring at the ground. She mutters.

Snake turns around and looks at Meryl.

Meryl feels a little better about the situation.

Just as Snake is about to head through the door, Meryl calls out to him again.

Meryl changes the subject, avoiding what she really wanted to ask.

Snake waits a moment before finally turning around.

Snake is bothered by the barrage of questions.

SNAKE


Let's go, Meryl.

MERYL


I'm sorry...

SNAKE


Meryl?

MERYL


How could I let Mantis control my mind like that...

SNAKE


If you're going to doubt yourself, I'll leave you here.

MERYL


You're right.

SNAKE


Never doubt yourself. Just let it make you stronger. Learn something from it.

MERYL


You're right. I'm sorry. I won't do it again.

MERYL


Snake, can I ask you something?

SNAKE


What!?

MERYL


About what Mantis said... I was just wondering...

SNAKE


What? What's the problem now?

MERYL


Oh no... nothing.

MERYL


So tell me Snake. What's your name? Your real name?

SNAKE


A name means nothing on the battlefield.

MERYL


How old are you?

SNAKE


Old enough to know what death looks like...

MERYL


Any family?

SNAKE


No, but I was raised by many people.

MERYL


Is there anyone you like?

SNAKE


I've never been interested in anyone else's life...

MERYL


So you are all alone. Just like Mantis said...

SNAKE


Other people just complicate my life. I don't like to get involved.

MERYL


... You're a sad, lonely man.

SNAKE


C'mon... Let's go...
Wolf Battle 1

Heading North with Meryl Cutscene

Overhead view. Snake and Meryl go through the door behind the bookcase in the commander's room, emerging into a frozen cave.

It appears to be limestone. Lanterns and other quick, man-made touches have been added to the walls of this space that nature has carved out.

A handful of the lanterns flicker like fluorescent lights on the fritz.

Snow falls through gaps here and there in the ceiling.

Thanks to their water content, mosses have frozen to the bedrock.

The cave is like a maze, full of narrow, winding paths.

There are also a few low arch formations.

When Snake and Meryl enter, they hear what sounds like the distant howls of wolves.

Meryl walks on ahead.

Then, she takes off, soon disappearing from view.

There are two wolf dogs in an open space in the middle of the cave. If the player approaches them, they attack.

If the wolf dogs follow the player to the exit, where Meryl waits for Snake, they suddenly become friendly and start wagging their tails (since Meryl smells like Sniper Wolf) before returning to the middle of the cave.

When the dogs leave, Meryl speaks.
Wolf Battle 2

Going Through Underground Passageway with Meryl Cutscene

Overhead view. After the frozen cave, Snake and Meryl come to an underground passageway leading straight to the Communications Tower.

The passageway extends a good 60 meters (197 feet) at least.

Its walls have been reinforced with concrete.

This is a preventative measure due to a glacier that has advanced onto the island, causing areas of surface ground (i.e., the ceiling of the passageway) to cave in.

Like with the cave, snow comes falling in through such holes in the ceiling.

The concrete has fallen loose in places, revealing the iron rods underneath.

The snow that has made it down to the passageway has melted, creating puddles that, cause the entire ground to gleam like the skin of a reptile.

Lights have been embedded into both walls at regular intervals.

When they step into the passageway, Meryl takes point once again.

Meryl advances, walking around the claymores.

Once she's clear of the minefield, she stops and turns around.

MERYL


Could there be wolves in there?

SNAKE


Wolf dogs. Half-wolf, half-huskie.

MERYL


How do you know so much?

SNAKE


I ride dog sleds. I'm a musher.

MERYL


I'll take point. Snake, you follow me.

MERYL


Snake, what's wrong? I thought you were good with dogs.

MERYL


This place is mined. I'll take point again. Stay back, okay?

SNAKE


But the radar isn't working. And since we can't use the mine detector either...

MERYL


Leave it to me.


Wolf Battle 3


Meryl is Shot Cutscene

Meryl has avoided the mines planted in the underground passageway.

Snake notices a red dot traveling along her shoulder.

He has a bad feeling about this.

Meryl spots the change in his expression.

The dot slithers along her body like a snake.

Meryl turns to face down the passageway, the direction the dot is coming from. She looks down at her chest—precisely where the dot is moving at that moment.

She holds her palm up to the dot, then turns her hand over so the back of it is facing it.

Finally, Meryl also realizes what this dot is.
But Snake's warning is in vain—a bullet tears through Meryl's right knee.

Meryl crumples to the ground. A second bullet goes through her left thigh.

Meryl rolls onto her back. The bloodstains on her pants spread rapidly. She tries to get up, but another shot strikes her left arm. The shock causes Meryl to drop her Desert Eagle.

Meryl can no longer move at all.

Lying in pools of her own blood, she is just able to turn her head toward Snake.

Snake immediately takes cover behind an obstacle (a wall) on the right.

Snake peeks out at Meryl from the edge of the wall.

MERYL


So what do you think? Pretty good, huh.

SNAKE


How did you know where the mines were?

MERYL


It sounds weird, but when Mantis dove into my mind I was able to see where the mines were placed. Are you impressed?

SNAKE


Well... a little bit...

MERYL


Only a little?

SNAKE


Meryl??

MERYL


What is it?

SNAKE


Meryl, get down!!

MERYL


Aaaaaaaahhh!!!

SNAKE


Meryl!!

MERYL


Oooooohhhh!!

SNAKE


Meryl!!

MERYL


Aaaaaaaghhh!!

MERYL


Snake... leave me and run...

SNAKE


Meryl...

MERYL


I guess... I am a rookie after all...

SNAKE


Don't worry, Meryl. It's me they want.

MERYL


Even I know that. It's the oldest trick in the book...

MERYL


The sniper's using me for bait to lure you out.

SNAKE


Damn!!

With a big shake of his head, Snake absolutely rejects this.

The Desert Eagles lies on the ground just out of reach.

As the blood continues to pool, Meryl raises her voice.

She lets her head drop and starts to cry a little.

Big tears run down her cheek.

Snake's Codec rings!

Snake answers it.
Wolf Battle 4

Post-Meryl Shot Codec Call

MERYL


Shoot me, Snake!!

SNAKE


No!

MERYL


My gun... I can't reach it by myself...

SNAKE


Don't move.

MERYL


I promised... I wouldn't slow you down!

MERYL


I... I... I... I can still help... I want to help you!

SNAKE


Quiet down. Save your strength!

MERYL


I was a fool. I wanted to be a soldier...

MERYL


But war is ugly... There's nothing glamorous about it.

MERYL


Snake, please! Save yourself! Go on living and don't give up on people!

MERYL


Don't forget me...

MERYL


Now get out of here...!

CAMPBELL


Meryl!

NAOMI


Colonel...

CAMPBELL


*is worried, but as commanding officier, holds back his feelings* Damn!! Snake, it's a trap! Sniper's trick to lure you out. The sniper's waiting for you to go and help Meryl so he can pick you off... Don't do it!

NAOMI


It must be Sniper Wolf... FOX-HOUND's best shooter.

SNAKE


Snipers usually work in pairs, but this one's alone, huh?

NAOMI


I know her. She can wait for hours, days or weeks. It doesn't matter to her. She's just watching and waiting for you to expose yourself.

SNAKE


Maybe so, but Meryl can't hold out that long...

NAOMI


Snake, can you see Wolf from where you are?

SNAKE


There's nowhere to hide between here and the tower... She must be on the second floor of the tower.

CAMPBELL


*forcing himself to keep speaking* If Wolf is in the Communications Tower, she can see you perfectly! It's the classic sniper's position!!

CAMPBELL


At that distance you won't be able to hit her with a standard weapon either! You'll need a sniper rifle!!

SNAKE


Colonel! Take it easy.
Wolf Battle 5

Wolf Dies Cutscene

Snake returns with a PSG-1 sniper rifle, using it to take out Sniper Wolf from long range.


Wolf Battle 6


Snake Captured Cutscene

Overhead view. Snake has bested Wolf, but Meryl is nowhere in sight.

Snake proceeds down the passageway, reaching the underground entrance to the Communications Tower.

Snake gets about five meters (16 feet) from the door.

Several heavily armed soldiers were lying in wait behind both walls. A few more rappel down, barely making a sound.

Before he can react, the soldiers converge on Snake with their weapons pointed at him.

Trapped, Snake slowly puts his hands up.

CAMPBELL


...

SNAKE


I'm going to save Meryl no matter what it takes.

CAMPBELL


*happy* Okay... Thanks.

NAOMI


...

SNAKE


What's wrong, Naomi?

NAOMI


Nothing... I'm just surprised you're willing to sacrifice yourself... You've got the genes of a soldier, not a savior.

SNAKE


*sarcastically* Trying to say I'm only interested in saving my own skin?

NAOMI


I wouldn't go that far, but...

SNAKE


I don't know what the hell my genes look like and I don't care. I operate on instinct.

NAOMI


Like an animal?

SNAKE


I'm going to save Meryl. I don't need an excuse.

NAOMI


Okay...

SNAKE


And I'm not doing it for someone else either. I'm going to save Meryl for myself. Colonel, don't worry!

CAMPBELL


Snake, thanks.

NAOMI


I understand. I'm sorry.

SNAKE


I got her!

SOLDIER


Don't move!
Wolf Battle 7

Enter Wolf Cutscene

Snake is surrounded by the soldiers. A red laser sight creeps up his chest.

Snake watches it move.

It comes to a stop on his forehead.

Snake looks ahead to see Sniper Wolf.

She saunters toward him, her rifle still trained on him. It's like she's showing off.

Snake throws his gun in front of him.

A nearby soldier swoops in and picks it up.

Her safety assured, Wolf lowers her weapon and walks up to Snake.

The soldiers around Snake gingerly close the distance between them and him.

Snake and Wolf stand opposite each other.

Snake glances at the soldiers surrounding him, wondering where this is headed.

Wolf is intrigued by Snake's attitude. She places a hand on his chest.

Wolf's palm travels from Snake's bulging pecs to his square jaw as she speaks.

Wolf caresses Snake's cheek, running her fingernails along it. He shakes his head in rejection.

One of her fingernails has cut him below the eye.

Blood runs down his cheek like a tear.

With a flick of her jaw, Wolf signals to the soldier behind Snake.

The soldier strikes the back of Snake's head with the butt of his FAMAS.

Snake collapses to the ground.

WOLF


It's hard to miss when you're this close.

WOLF


Toss your weapon over here. Slowly...

WOLF


You were a fool to come back here... stupid man!

SNAKE


A lady sniper, huh?

WOLF


Didn't you know that two thirds of the world's greatest assassins... are women?

WOLF


Do you want to die now? Or after your female friend? Which will it be?

SNAKE


I'll die after I kill you.

WOLF


Is that right? Well at least you've got spirit.

WOLF


I'm Sniper Wolf and I always kill what I aim at.

WOLF


You're my... special prey... Got it?

WOLF


I've left my mark on you... I won't forget it.

WOLF


Until I kill you... you're all I'll think about.

SOLDIER


Take him away...
Wolf Battle 8

Snake Carried Away Cutscene

Snake's POV. Two soldiers, each with an arm hooked under his armpits, drag Snake away.

The underground entrance to the Communications Tower grows smaller, more distant.

Fade out.

Snake hears voices that sound muffled and far off.

Snake's consciousness recedes once more. Fade out.
Footnotes

1
See the related Nastasha Codec calls for details (p. 520).
2
Acronym for the Strategic Defense Initiative, a U.S. proposal to deploy lasers and other weapons in outer space to intercept ballistic missiles. Was also known as the " Star Wars program."
3
A nuclear weapons research and development facility located in Livermore, California.
4
A World War II effort to develop an atomic bomb, beginning in 1942 by order of President Roosevelt. The first nuclear test was carried out on July 16, 1945. Shortly thereafter, atomic bombs were dropped on Hiroshima and Nagasaki on August 6 and August 9, 1945, respectively.
5
One of three calibers of ammunition that can be chambered in the Desert Eagle. Boasts roughly three times the power of the .357 Magnum cartridge.

LIQUID


Don't kill him yet... I want him alive.

OCELOT


Leave it to me.

LIQUID


I want no more accidents like that DARPA Chief.

WOLF


Yes. He's my target. Mine alone.
Codec Conversations

•Campbell

Prior to Ninja Battle

After M1 tank battle – basics

Nuclear Warhead Storage Building 1F – flooded with gas

*First time only

Nuclear Warhead Storage Building B2 – before rescuing Otacon

*If player hasn't been contacted by Deepthroat yet

*If player has been contacted by Deepthroat


Nuclear Warhead Storage Building B2 – after destroying switchboard


CAMPBELL


Snake, you've got to rescue Dr. Emmerich, the Metal Gear engineer.

NAOMI


He's probably being held prisoner in the second floor basement of the Warhead Storage Building.

CAMPBELL


Snake, it's gas! Hold your breath!

CAMPBELL


Your O2 Gauge should appear underneath your Life Gauge. If you don't breathe, the gauge will decrease. When it reaches zero, your Life Gauge will begin decrease.

CAMPBELL


Try to find a Gas Mask.

NAOMI


The gas that's being dispersed is probably an organic phosphorus- based nerve gas. It destroys the nervous system by interfering with the breakdown of acetylcholine, an important neurotransmitter.

NAOMI


And you don't have to breathe it in for it to kill you. It can enter your body through skin contact as well. Victims die within fifteen minutes of the onset of symptoms such as nausea, perspiration, convulsions, headache, or difficulty with breathing.

NAOMI


Your Sneaking Suit will give you some protection. It's made of a material similar to that which the NBC soldiers use. Also, I injected you with nanomachines that contain PAM (protopan chloride), a nerve gas neutralizing agent.

NAOMI


But that will only give you temporary protection. You'd better find a Gas Mask!

CAMPBELL


You've got to rescue Dr. Emmerich and find out Metal Gear's weak point.

NAOMI


Isn't he being held in the laboratory in the northeast part of the floor you're on?

CAMPBELL


For the time being, let's trust what Deepthroat told us. Use a Remote Controlled Missile to destroy the switchboard in the northwest section of the Warhead Storage Building's second floor basement.

CAMPBELL


Make sure your Remote Controlled Missile doesn't get shot down by those gun cameras.

CAMPBELL


You did it. You destroyed the switchboard. The electrical current running through the floor should be off now.

CAMPBELL


You've got to rescue Dr. Emmerich and find out Metal Gear's weak point.

•Campbell

Prior to Meeting Meryl

Lab – Ninja battle

*First time

SNAKE


What's this pile of corpses...!? It looks like they were all slashed by some kind of sword.

NAOMI


It couldn't be!...

SNAKE


What!?

NAOMI


... Nothing.....

CAMPBELL


Snake, I'm worried about Emmerich. Hurry up and get to him!

SNAKE


The ninja!

NAOMI


Huh?

CAMPBELL


What?

SNAKE


That stealth camouflage, it's him. It must be!

CAMPBELL


Snake! Emmerich's in danger! Hurry and go after him!

CAMPBELL


Snake! Hurry! Emmerich's in danger!

CAMPBELL


If you have a question about members of FOX-HOUND, you should ask Naomi.

NAOMI


I'm sorry, but there's no one in FOX-HOUND like that.

NAOMI


There are currently only six members of FOX-HOUND.

NAOMI


Psycho Mantis, Sniper Wolf, Vulcan Raven, Decoy Octopus, Revolver Ocelot...

NAOMI


And finally Liquid Snake.

NAOMI


The Genome Soldiers under his command are Next Generation Special Forces. FOX-HOUND is intended to be a small number of highly elite, hand-picked soldiers.

SNAKE


You're talking about the current FOX-HOUND, right?

NAOMI


Yes...

CAMPBELL


Snake, who or what is that thing? Is he an enemy or not?

SNAKE


That's what I'd like to know. Naomi, you really don't have any idea?

NAOMI


*hiding her anger* ... Maybe I should ask you the same thing.

SNAKE


What?

NAOMI


Nothing... Forget about it.

(B)

Lab – after end of Otacon Rescue cutscenes

*First time

*Second and subsequent times

*If player is somewhere other than nuclear warhead storage

*If player is on the same floor as Meryl

*If player has a cardboard box

CAMPBELL


It looks like your weapons won't work on him. You'll have to think of something else.

CAMPBELL


He's fast! If you lose sight of him, switch to First Person View Mode and look for him.

CAMPBELL


Snake, he's obviously trying to provoke you. Throw away your weapon and take him on.

CAMPBELL


Well it looks like you've rescued Emmerich for the time being.

SNAKE


Yeah. With that stealth camouflage, he should be able to hide safely.

SNAKE


*a bit worried* Gray Fox... I can't believe it... But the real problem is your niece. The way the Codec got cut off like that has me worried. Something must have happened to her...

NAOMI


*surprised* You're worried? About Meryl?

SNAKE


*is actually worried* Not exactly. It's just that she's holding the detonation code override keys. They're our last chance of stopping that nuclear launch.

NAOMI


*scathing* You're a cold man. Your mission is more important than the life of your companions?

SNAKE


*a bit hurt* This is war. Survival is the name of the game. Sometimes you have to be cold to survive.

NAOMI


*unconvinced* Yes, but...

CAMPBELL


Snake, either way I want you to find Meryl as soon as possible.

SNAKE


I understand.

CAMPBELL


Didn't Meryl say that she's somewhere close by? Why don't you start by searching in that building.

CAMPBELL


Meryl said that she's close by. She's probably in the Warhead Storage Building. Why don't you start by looking there.

CAMPBELL


So Meryl's disguised as an enemy soldier, huh? Well even so, you should be able to spot her if you look close enough.

CAMPBELL


Use either First Person View or Corner View Mode to get a really close look.

CAMPBELL


You might also try to sneak in by covering yourself with that cardboard box.

Prior to Mantis Battle

Nuclear Warhead Storage Building B1 – after linking up with Meryl

*First time only

SNAKE


Colonel, I saw your niece, but...

CAMPBELL


*happy* Really? Where?

SNAKE


She went in the ladies' bathroom.

SNAKE


That's strange. I saw her go in, but now she's nowhere to be found.

CAMPBELL


You'll just have to look in the stalls, I guess.

SNAKE


I guess you're right. I'll take 'em in order.

CAMPBELL


You didn't find Meryl? Why don't you take another look around?

SNAKE


Colonel, your niece is fine.

CAMPBELL


Thank goodness!

SNAKE


We can't relax... Not yet.

CAMPBELL


I know. Snake...

SNAKE


She is quite a woman.

CAMPBELL


As commander of this operation, I can't ask you to watch after Meryl, but...

SNAKE


Duty first?

CAMPBELL


Maybe I was wrong...sending my own flesh and blood to war.

SNAKE


She understands about duty.

CAMPBELL


I know she does...

SNAKE


But what I want to know is what was the real purpose of this military exercise?

CAMPBELL


I don't know. Like I said, I'm nothing more than a middleman.

SNAKE


Is this transmission being monitored by the military?

CAMPBELL


Of course.
