Torture 1

Snake Wakes Up Cutscene (Torture Room – POV)

Fade in from black. Snake's POV.

Snake wakes up. He finds himself lying face-up on a torture device, his arms and legs spread in an "X" position. He's strapped in tight.

Snake tries to move his head as best he can, but the only thing he can see is the lights on the ceiling irritating his bleary eyes.

After a few moments, the player hears someone speaking right next to them, just off-screen.

This is followed by Sniper Wolf's frosty voice.

Snake tries to turn his head in the directions of the voices, but he can't see who's speaking.

The game now accepts inputs from the player.

In this cutscene, the game will accept inputs from the player for about 20 seconds, while Liquid and Wolf are speaking. If the player presses an input, the two of them stop speaking and Ocelot comments on what the player is trying to do.

The First Person Mode, Punch, and Weapon buttons don't do anything. The Item Equip and Weapon Equip Buttons open the item and weapon windows as before, but all of Snake's equipment is gone.
*Item Equip or Weapon Equip Button

*Action or Weapon button

*Directional Buttons

Liquid and Wolf's conversation (1)

Liquid and Wolf's conversation (2)

LIQUID


Can you hear me, Solid Snake?

WOLF


He's tougher than I thought...

LIQUID


Do you know who I am?

LIQUID


I always knew that one day I would meet you.

LIQUID


*with intense jealousy* The man who stole what was rightly mine... the man who stole my birthright.

OCELOT


It's no use. We've taken away all your weapons and items.

OCELOT


Don't worry, they're safe. But you won't be needing them anymore.

OCELOT


Don't make me laugh. These shackles are steel.

OCELOT


Forget it. Your body is strapped down tight.

LIQUID


Me? I'm the man you stole everything good from.

LIQUID


And now, after the sacrifice of our brothers... after 30 long years, finally the two of us meet. The brother of light and the brother of dark.

WOLF


Do you need his DNA too?

LIQUID


Yes. I want a sample while he's still alive. We need it to correct the Genome Soldiers' mutations.

WOLF


Then we'll be able to cure them?

LIQUID


No. We still have to get our hands on Big Boss's DNA.
Liquid and Wolf's conversation (3)

The bed (torture device) Snake is lying on is raised until it's perpendicular to the floor.
Torture 2

Pre-Torture Cutscene (Torture Room)

Snake was facing the ceiling before, but now that the torture bed has been raised, he gets his first good look at the room he's in.

It's divided off by glass and contains a host of cutting-edge medical equipment.

On the other side of the glass is what appears to be a cell with iron bars.

On the floor, a twisting mess of cables resembling arteries feeds into the torture machine (bed).

Walls and desks display photos of cross-sections of human anatomy.

To Snake's right, Revolver Ocelot is pressing buttons on the control panel for the torture bed. He's no longer wearing his coat. He has on a starched white shirt, on top of which is a black vest, almost like he's in a state of mourning.

Ocelot wears a gun belt diagonally across his chest, and a Single Action Army is holstered on his hip. A bandage is wrapped around the wound he received when his right hand was severed.

Standing opposite Snake is Liquid Snake.

As before, he's naked from the waist up, wearing a leather long coat.

The open apparel gives a generous look at his bulging, chiseled chest and abdomen. Hanging around his neck are two dog tags, which reflect light in a dull sort of manner.

Liquid has shoulder-length, somewhat wavy hair, in addition to an olive complexion and piercing, deep blue eyes.

He stands with both hands stuffed into his coat pockets.

Sniper Wolf is to Snake's left, a tight shirt offering support to her ample bosom. She has a strikingly pale, almost vampiric complexion.

Her well-defined collarbones are complimented by a thin leather choker around her neck.

Despite making eye contact with Snake, Wolf's expression doesn't change. She just stands there, rattling the plastic case containing her tranquilizers, looking at Snake in silence.

Liquid goes nose to nose with Snake, looking him right in the eye.

WOLF


Have they given in to our demands yet?

LIQUID


Not yet.

WOLF


They won't give in. They're all hypocrites, every one of them.

LIQUID


Is that your opinion as a Kurd?

WOLF


They always put politics first.

LIQUID


That's right. That's why they want to avoid any leak about their precious new nuclear weapon.

OCELOT


Boss, it looks like our friend is awake.

Snake doesn't know what to make of Liquid's out-of-the-blue remark.

He turns around and moves to the back of the room.

Liquid gets a call.

He seems to have been expecting it—he takes his radio out of his coat and places it to his ear. Turning his back to Snake, he answers.

Wolf and Ocelot turn their attention to the conversation Liquid is having.

Liquid glances at Wolf and Ocelot and signals to them with a nod of his head.

Liquid puts his radio back in his pocket and looks at Wolf and Ocelot. He pauses.

Wolf hits the edge of the torture bed with her fist.

Ocelot seems oddly indifferent to the news.

Ocelot shoots Snake a look and continues.

Ocelot nods with great satisfaction. He turns to Wolf:

Wolf rattles her plastic pill case again, checking how many are left. She brings it to her mouth.

Wolf opens the lid, pops two or three tranquilizers (Diazepam), and swallows them.

Liquid heads for the door. Before he leaves, he stops and warns Ocelot.

LIQUID


There definitely is a resemblance. Don't you think, little brother?

SNAKE


...

LIQUID


Or should I say big brother? I'm not sure... Anyway, it doesn't matter.

LIQUID


You and I are both the last surviving "sons of Big Boss."

LIQUID


It's me... Really?

LIQUID


Then what? Those idiots!

LIQUID


Alright, Raven. I'll be right there.

LIQUID


They're not responding to our demands. We'll launch the first one in 10 hours as planned.

WOLF


Damn Americans!!

OCELOT


Looks like you read them wrong.

LIQUID


*thinks* Something's funny... Normally the Americans are the first ones to the negotiating table. They must think they have something up their sleeves...

OCELOT


So it's come down to it, has it. We're gonna launch that nuke and ride it all the way into history.

LIQUID


I've got to take care of some launch preparations. You're in charge here, Ocelot.

OCELOT


What about you? Wanna stay for the show?

WOLF


I'm not interested.

WOLF


It's time to feed the family.

OCELOT


So you prefer your wolves to my show, huh?

LIQUID


Ocelot, don't screw up like you did with the Chief.

OCELOT


Yes, I know. That was an accident.

OCELOT


I didn't think a pencil pusher like him would be so tough.

LIQUID


Well... his mental defenses were reinforced by hypnotherapy.
Ocelot, like he just remembered:

With that meaningful choice of words from Liquid, Wolf and Ocelot exchange glances.

Liquid leaves. Wolf takes off as well. On her way out, she whispers into Snake's ear.

Wolf kisses the wound she left on Snake's cheek. Ocelot teases Snake with a wolf whistle.

Wolf exits the room.

After making sure Wolf has left, Ocelot turns and faces Snake.

Next to the torture bed is a box containing all the weapons and items the player acquired before they were captured.

Ocelot, deducing that Snake hasn't been told anything, shrugs his shoulders out of pity for the man. Snake has no idea what that gesture is supposed to mean.

Ocelot's attitude changes—he now speaks to Snake in a hushed voice.

OCELOT


Boss, what about that ninja?

LIQUID


He's killed 12 men. Whoever he is, he's some kind of lunatic.

OCELOT


Bastard took my hand... How could he have gotten in here?

LIQUID


Perhaps there's a spy among us...

LIQUID


Mantis is dead. We've also got to find out what killed Baker and Octopus. We're shorthanded, so make this little torture show of yours as short as possible.

OCELOT


Torture? This is an interrogation.

LIQUID


As you wish. See you later, brother. (The second phrase is directed at Snake.)

WOLF


Your woman is still in this world...

SNAKE


Meryl?

WOLF


Catch you later... handsome.

OCELOT


Once she picks a target, she doesn't think about anything else.

OCELOT


Sometimes she even falls in love with them before she kills them.

OCELOT


Finally, just the two of us.

OCELOT


How are you feeling?

SNAKE


Not bad. I caught a nice nap on this revolving bed of yours. Too bad I was sleeping alone.

OCELOT


Glad to hear that. This is some bed all right...

OCELOT


I'm about to show you some of its nicer features...

SNAKE


Where are my things?

OCELOT


Oh, don't worry, they're all there.

OCELOT


*mockingly* Washington was taking quite a chance sending you here. Someone must have a lot of faith in your skill. Huh, carrier boy?

SNAKE


?

SNAKE


So... Metal Gear is armed with a new type of nuclear warhead, huh?

OCELOT


Why don't you go ask Campbell for the full story.

SNAKE


The Colonel?

OCELOT


By the way, you got an optical disc from President Baker, didn't you?

Ocelot nods to himself.

He moves around the torture bed in a hurry, getting things ready to go.

Ocelot is already back to his usual self.

He continues to check the machine as he answers, sounding greatly inconvenienced by the question.

*If player's last save was so long ago that starting over from that point would be a real pain

SNAKE


What if I did?

OCELOT


Is that the only disc? There's no other data?

SNAKE


What do you mean?

OCELOT


There's no copy? If not, that's fine.

SNAKE


Is Meryl okay?

OCELOT


She's not dead yet. Wolf must have been feeling generous. But if you want her to stay that way you better start answering my questions right now.

OCELOT


You were holding one card key. Where are the other two? What's the trick behind that key!?

SNAKE


Trick?

OCELOT


That weasel of a president said there's some kind of trick to using the key.

SNAKE


Hell if I know.

OCELOT


*lightly* I see. No problem then.

OCELOT


*announces* We're going to play a game, Snake. And we'll find out what kind of man you really are. When the pain becomes too great to bear, just give up and your suffering will end. But if you do, the girl's life is mine.

OCELOT


Press the Action Button repeatedly to regain your strength. When you've had enough, press the Codec Button to submit.

OCELOT


When your life reaches zero, the game is over. There are no continues, my friend.

OCELOT


Don't even think about using auto-fire or I'll know.

OCELOT


Snake, it's been a long time since you saved your game.

SNAKE


Yeah? So what?

OCELOT


If you're body can't survive the torture, it'll be game over. You really wanna travel down that long road again? C'mon I won't tell. Why don't you just give up?

OCELOT


I'm going to run a high voltage electric current through your body. If it's just for a short time, it won't kill you.

SNAKE


But I never heard that before.

OCELOT


You're a tough guy, Snake. But I got some bad news for you. You're no POW (prisoner of war).

OCELOT


You're a hostage. There's no Geneva Convention
1 . No one is coming to save you.

OCELOT


Startin' to feel a little scared?

OCELOT


Good... You should be.

OCELOT


Okay. Let's get started.
Torture 3

Ocelot's Lecture Cutscene (Torture Room – POV)

Snake's POV. Still attached to the torture bed, he gasps for air.

Ocelot looks down at Snake, appearing mighty pleased with himself.

The torture bed is returned to its horizontal position.

As Ocelot speaks, all Snake can see once again are the ceiling lights.

*First time

Sounds of Snake's arm restraints being released...

Sounds of Snake's leg restraints being released...

Snake is returned to his cell.

*Second time

Sounds of Snake's leg restraints being released...

Snake is returned to his cell.

*Third time

Sounds of Snake's arm restraints being released...

Ocelot's tone is part admiration, part respect, part jealousy, part self-derision.

Sounds of Snake's leg restraints being released...

Snake is returned to his cell.

OCELOT


You're a strong man. Well, that's enough for now I think.

OCELOT


You're the Boss's brother all right.

OCELOT


Your brother... he's an amazing man. Who else could shoot down two F-16s with a Hind helicopter. The "Les enfants terribles" project was not a total failure.

OCELOT


He is the one man who could make my dream into a reality...

OCELOT


We live in a sad age.

OCELOT


Imperialism, totalitarianism, perestroika
2 ... 20th century Russia had its share of problems, but at least they had an ideology. Russia today has nothing.

SNAKE


They're struggling between freedom and order. And with that struggle, a new spirit of nationalism has been born.

OCELOT


The Boss has a close friend high up in the Russian government. He's currently the head of the Spetsnaz
4 .

OCELOT


He's agreed to purchase this new nuclear weapons system. The Hind was just a downpayment.

SNAKE


So you're in this for money?

OCELOT


I don't need money. I want Russia to be reborn... to lead a brave, new world order.

OCELOT


You're a soldier. You should understand.

OCELOT


You and I can't continue to live in a world like this.

OCELOT


We need tension... conflict.

OCELOT


The world today has become too soft. We're living in an age where true feelings are suppressed.

OCELOT


So we're going to shake things up a bit. We'll create a world dripping with tension... a world filled with greed and suspicion, bravery and cowardice.

OCELOT


...You want the same thing that we do.

SNAKE


...

OCELOT


Liquid Snake is the one. He is an incredible man. He is the man who can really make it happen.
Torture 4

Snake Submits Cutscene

Snake's POV.

If the player presses the Submit Button (the Codec Button) during a torture sequence, Ocelot brings it to an end immediately, even if Snake is in the middle of being electrocuted.

Snake is returned to his cell.


Torture 5


Returned to the Cell Cutscene (Torture Room)

Snake is released from the torture bed.

Two soldiers walk up to Snake's limp body.

They each grab one side of him and drag him to his cell.

Snake's legs dangle along the ground as he's hauled back.
Torture 6

Torture Resumes Cutscene (Cell – Overhead View)

Overhead view. Snake is locked up in his cell. The guard calls out to him.

Soldiers grab Snake by his sides and take him back to the torture room.

Fade out.

*Proceeds to Returned To Torture Room cutscene.


Torture 7


Returned to Torture Room Cutscene (Torture Room)

Fade in from black.

Snake is looking up at the torture room ceiling again.

Ocelot speaks from off-screen.

He gives him the same explanation of the controls.

OCELOT


Had enough? So you're human after all.

OCELOT


The torture will stop as I promised.

OCELOT


But I'll take the woman in return. I'll have my fun with her before I kill her.

SNAKE


... Meryl.

OCELOT


I hope you can still look at yourself in the mirror, my friend.

JOHNNY


Snake. It's show time. Ocelot wants you.

OCELOT


Okay. I'll tell you once more.

OCELOT


I've fought wars in Afghanistan, Mozambique, Eritrea, and Chad.

OCELOT


Among the Mujahaddin guerrillas, I was known and feared as "Shalashaska."

OCELOT


I was trained by the Russian GRU
3 .

OCELOT


I am not like one of those KGB slugs. To me, this isn't torture.... It's a sport.

SNAKE


You're all just a bunch of sadists.

OCELOT


Don't confuse me with those uniformed fools.

OCELOT


Well... shall we begin?

OCELOT


Okay. Here we go.
Escape from the Cell 1

DARPA Chief Discovered Cutscene (Cell)

After being tortured for the first time, Snake is thrown into a cell.

The cell is surrounded by iron bars. The door is an old-fashioned iron door with a small observation window.

The cell contains one pipe-frame bed and a simple toilet lacking even a seat. It is disgustingly dirty.

In a corner of the cell, a Black man lies slumped against the wall. It's too dark to make out his face from a distance.

Spotting him, Snake moves in for a closer look.

The man has no external wounds, but blood has seeped out of his eyes, nose, and mouth. Several grumbles of maggots are devouring his flesh.

The remainder of the man's blood has been drained, which gives him a desiccated look not unlike that of a mummy.

The man was wearing a white shirt, a tie, and slacks, which would seem out of place for Alaska. Though technically, the shirt
was white—it's stained with blood and sweat, and there are even some marks that look like burns (caused by the electroshock torture he was subjected to).
Snake catches a whiff of the corpse's putrid smell and grimaces.
Escape from the Cell 2

Campbell Codec Call (Cell)

Snake is put in the cell. A short while later, his Codec rings.

Snake answers it.

SNAKE


Looks like I got a roommate...

SNAKE


The DARPA Chief!?... Whew...What a stench!

CAMPBELL


Snake, are you okay?

SNAKE


I've been better...

NAOMI


How's Meryl?

SNAKE


... They've got her.

CAMPBELL


*upset* Damn...!

NAOMI


Colonel...

CAMPBELL


*trying to calm down* Snake... the government has decided not to give in to their demands. We're trying to buy some more time.

SNAKE


C'mon Colonel... why don't you stop playing dumb? I'm sorry about Meryl. But I want the lies to end now.

CAMPBELL


What are you talking about?

SNAKE


Metal Gear was designed to launch a new type of nuclear warhead, wasn't it?

CAMPBELL


!

SNAKE


*bitterly* You knew it all along, didn't you?

CAMPBELL


...

SNAKE


Why did you try to hide it?

CAMPBELL


... I'm sorry...

(The government won't give in to their demands because they're already using Snake to spread FoxDie, but Campbell can't reveal this to him.)

SNAKE


Can't tell the grunts, huh... You've changed a lot.

SNAKE


Metal Gear... secret advanced nuclear weapons research... Does the White House know about this? How deep does it go?

CAMPBELL


... As far as I know, as of yesterday, the President had not been briefed about the Rex Project.

SNAKE


"Need to know basis," is that the idea?

CAMPBELL


These are sensitive times. Even sub-critical nuclear tests are causing quite a stir.

SNAKE


Plausible deniability, huh?

CAMPBELL


Yes. And tomorrow, the President and his Russian counterpart are scheduled to sign the Start 3 Accord
5 .

SNAKE


I get it. That's the reason for the deadline.

NAOMI


That's right, Snake. And that's why we can't let this terrorist attack go public.

CAMPBELL


We still haven't even ratified Start 2 or dealt with the issue of TMDs. This has to do with the President's reputation and America's place as the dominant superpower.

SNAKE


So, patriotism is your excuse for circumventing the Constitution?

CAMPBELL


Please, Snake, just stop them...

SNAKE


Why should I?

CAMPBELL


Because you're the only one who can.

SNAKE


In that case, tell me the truth about this new type of nuclear warhead.

CAMPBELL


I told you before. I don't know the details.

SNAKE


I don't believe you.

CAMPBELL


...

SNAKE


If the situation is so serious, why don't you give in to their demands? Let them have Big Boss's remains.

CAMPBELL


You see...

SNAKE


Or is there some reason that you can't do that? Something you haven't told me about...

NAOMI


Publicly, the President has been very vocal in his opposition to eugenics experiments. We don't want the existence of the genome army to go public.

SNAKE


And that's the only reason?

CAMPBELL


...

SNAKE


Huh! Hell with you!

CAMPBELL


I'm sorry...

SNAKE


The corpse of the DARPA Chief is lying right here next to me.

NAOMI


Poor man.

SNAKE


But it's strange. He looks and smells like he's been dead for days.

SNAKE


All his blood's been drained out too.

If the player submits during the first torture sequence, this call is followed by Escape from the Cell 3 – Naomi Codec Call.

CAMPBELL


Drained!?

NAOMI


Maybe, to slow down decomposition?

SNAKE


I have no idea.

NAOMI


But the Chief only died a few hours ago, right?

SNAKE


Right. But he's already started to decompose.

NAOMI


What could it all be about?

SNAKE


Something in his blood that they wanted?

NAOMI


I doubt it. Just the nanomachines and the transmitter.

CAMPBELL


Did the Chief tell them his detonation code?

SNAKE


I'm afraid so. It looks like they've got both codes and are nearly ready to launch.

CAMPBELL


Damn. Is there any way to prevent it?

SNAKE


It seems that there's some type of emergency override device that can cancel out the detonation code. It's a countermeasure that ArmsTech installed secretly. You have to unlock it with three special card keys.

CAMPBELL


And where are those keys?

SNAKE


I've got one of them. I don't know where the other two are. Besides, I'm locked up here.

CAMPBELL


We've got no choice. Forget about the keys. Your top priority now is to destroy Metal Gear itself. I'm sorry to have to lay it all in your lap, but you're all I've got. Bust out of there and get to the Communications Tower.

CAMPBELL


Also...

SNAKE


What?

CAMPBELL


...

SNAKE


Meryl, right?

CAMPBELL


Yeah...

SNAKE


I'll save her.

CAMPBELL


Thanks.
Escape from the Cell 3

Naomi Codec Call (Cell)

A little bit after the second torture sequence, Snake receives another call.

He answers it.

*If this takes place after a torture sequence

*If player pressed the Action Button at least a certain number of times during the torture sequence, and they have an analog controller connected with rumble turned on

The analog controller's rumble pack vibrates!

*If this takes place after the player gave in

*Continues to the following conversation if the player submitted during the first torture sequence

CAMPBELL


You okay, Snake?

SNAKE


Yeah... nothing new to report.

NAOMI


Snake, is there anything I can do?

SNAKE


Yeah, my arm hurts...

NAOMI


... Poor Snake. I'll increase the level of pain killers in your blood.

SNAKE


Okay, but you can leave out the benzedrine. That stuff makes me too frisky.

NAOMI


I guess you're not feeling too bad after all.

NAOMI


Snake, put the controller up against your arm.

SNAKE


What?

NAOMI


Don't worry. It'll feel good.

SNAKE


Huh?

NAOMI


Okay, here I go.

SNAKE


*surprised* Ooooh.

NAOMI


How does that feel, Snake? A little better?

SNAKE


*surprised and grateful* How did you do that?

NAOMI


I stimulated your muscle fibers with the nanomachine's cilia. That's about all I can do for you...

SNAKE


I'm not the right guy. I can't save the world.

NAOMI


What's wrong?

SNAKE


I gave in to the pain...

SNAKE


I'm sorry, Colonel. I sacrificed Meryl to save myself...

CAMPBELL


*with anger, sadness, and guilt* ...Snake...

NAOMI


Don't blame yourself. You still have a mission to do.

SNAKE


Naomi, please talk to me. Say something to take my mind off the pain.

NAOMI


What can I say?

SNAKE


Anything.

NAOMI


I... I'm not a very good talker...

SNAKE


Please... tell me about yourself.

NAOMI


Myself?... That's a tough one.

Naomi is learning for the first time of the deep hurt Snake carries in his heart. She feels a mixture of surprise and compassion.

SNAKE


Any family?

NAOMI


... That's not a happy topic for me.

SNAKE


I don't have any family... No wait, there was a man who said he was my father...

NAOMI


Where is he?

SNAKE


Dead... by my own hand.

CAMPBELL


Big Boss.

NAOMI


What!? Big Boss!!? I had no idea.

CAMPBELL


There was no way you could. It happened in Zanzibar six years ago. Only Snake and I know the real truth of what happened there.

NAOMI


So, ...is it true? Was Big Boss really your father?

SNAKE


That's what he said... That's all I know.

NAOMI


And you were able to kill him, knowing that?

SNAKE


Yup.

NAOMI


How?

SNAKE


He wanted it. Besides, some people just need killing...

NAOMI


That's patricide...!

SNAKE


*weakly* Yup. That's the trauma that Mantis was talking about. The one we share in common.

NAOMI


Is that why you left FOX-HOUND?

SNAKE


Let's just say that I needed to be alone for a while and Alaska was the perfect place...

NAOMI


... Snake.

NAOMI


... Snake... I didn't have a real family either. Just a big brother who put me through school. We weren't even blood-related, and he was much older than me.

SNAKE


Where is he?

NAOMI


*with anger and sadness* ... He's dead...

SNAKE


I'm sorry...

NAOMI


Snake... is there a woman in your life?

SNAKE


After you've been through as many wars as me, it's hard to trust anyone.

NAOMI


Friends?

SNAKE


...Roy Campbell...

CAMPBELL


*with a self-mocking laugh* Huh? You're still calling me friend?

NAOMI


Is that it?

SNAKE


No, there was another... Frank Jaeger.

NAOMI


What!?

CAMPBELL


Big Boss's most trusted lieutenant, and the only member of FOX-HOUND ever to receive the codename "Fox." ... Gray Fox.

NAOMI


...

SNAKE


*nostalgically* I learned a lot from him...

NAOMI


*hesitantly* But... didn't you try to kill each other?

SNAKE


It's true. We did. In Zanzibar. But, it was nothing personal... We were just professionals on opposite sides, that's all.

NAOMI


And you still call yourself "friends"!?

SNAKE


Hard to believe? War is no reason to end a friendship.

NAOMI


That's insane.

SNAKE


I first met him on the battlefield.

SNAKE


He was being held a prisoner of Outer Heaven. But he didn't look like a prisoner to me.

SNAKE


He was always so cool and precise. I was still green, and he showed me the ropes.

NAOMI


You knew him well?

SNAKE


No. We never talked about our personal lives. Sort of an unwritten rule...

SNAKE


The next time I saw him on the battlefield, we were enemies.

SNAKE


We were fighting barehanded in a minefield.

SNAKE


I know it sounds strange to most people. But we were just two soldiers doing our jobs. It's like a sport.

NAOMI


Men and their games! You're like wild animals!

SNAKE


You're right. We are animals.

NAOMI


So if you were friends, then how do you explain the Ninja's behavior?

SNAKE


I don't know.

NAOMI


It's your genes... They make you predisposed towards violence!

SNAKE


You really like talking about genes, Naomi. Why did you get into genetic research anyway?

NAOMI


... I never knew who my parents were or even what they looked like. I guess I got into genetics because I wanted to figure out why I am the way I am.

SNAKE


So, you studied about DNA?

NAOMI


Yeah. I thought if I studied my genetic structure, I'd find out who I really was.

NAOMI


I thought that by analyzing a person's genetic information, I could retrieve the blank spots in that person's memory.

SNAKE


Memory is stored in DNA?

NAOMI


We're not sure. But, we know that a person's genetic fate is determined just by the sequence of the four bases in their DNA.

SNAKE


*lightly* So, what about my fate? You know my DNA sequence, don't you?

NAOMI


*straining* Your fate? I... I'm sorry. I have no idea.

SNAKE


Of course not. You're a scientist, not a fortune-teller. (He hasn't noticed Naomi's distress.)

NAOMI


...
Escape from the Cell 4

Suffering Johnny Sasaki (Cell – Overhead View)

In-game screen. There's only one guard keeping an eye on Snake's cell. The guard, light infantry gear, is Johnny Sasaki, the same soldier whose uniform and gear Meryl stole before. As Johnny alluded to while Snake eavesdropped on him earlier, he's recently caught a cold—and being left in the nude like that has only made it worse.

*Johnny's behavior (1) – sneezing

Johnny will sneeze at random, sometimes cursing the situation he's found himself in.

*Johnny's behavior (2) – diarrhea

After a certain amount of time on duty, Johnny will have to go to the toilet to relieve himself of the diarrhea brought on by his cold.

He races off to the toilet next to the torture room to take care of business. He emerges feeling like a new man, then returns to his post.

*Johnny's behavior (3) – dozing off

After a certain amount of time on duty, Johnny will fall asleep standing up, a side effect of the cold medicine he's taking. After he wakes up, he grumbles about his predicament some more.
Escape from the Cell 5

Otacon Shows Up Cutscene (Cell – Overhead View)

Overhead view. Snake calls Otacon from the cell. Otacon waits until Johnny is in the toilet to approach it.

An exhausted Snake sits on the bed in the cell.

Then, from out of nowhere he hears Otacon's voice.

Snake looks around, but there's no sign of him anywhere. This is no surprise, really, as Otacon has his stealth camouflage on.

Otacon turns his camo off, then appears on the other side of the iron bars.

Snake runs over to the corner of the cell where Otacon is.

JOHNNY


Hachooh!!! Damn!... I caught a cold...

JOHNNY


That witch! She took my clothes!

JOHNNY


Ooooooooohhhh!!! Ooooohh... Oh my stomach!!! Oh!.. Damn it!! Mmmmnnnn!!

JOHNNY


Mmmmnnnn!!!... Not again!!!... Uuunnnffff....

JOHNNY


Aaah! That's better...

JOHNNY


Shoot! That cold medicine knocked me out... and it doesn't even work!

JOHNNY


I'm so sleepy... Maybe if I walk a little...

OTACON


Hey! I'm here!

SNAKE


Where...?

OTACON


It's me!

SNAKE


Otacon!

OTACON


Wow! They even captured you!
Escape from the Cell 6

Otacon Shows Up Cutscene

Snake reaches through the bars with both hands, pulling Otacon toward him.

Snake has pulled Otacon's face against the bars.

Snake lets him go. Otacon makes sure to keep some distance from the door now.

Snake indicates toward the bloated corpse he's sharing the cell with. Otacon glances over at what turns out to be a familiar face for him.

Otacon walks up to Snake, doing his best to stomach the stench.

Otacon takes out a ration and some ketchup from his pocket.

Snake accepts them.

He hands over the card.

Snake takes it.

Next, Otacon produces a woman's handkerchief—a pretty dirty one at that.

Snake takes the handkerchief too. It smells faintly of Sniper Wolf.

Otacon reflects on his experiences with Wolf as he talks.

SNAKE


Hurry! Get me out of here!

OTACON


That hurts! Lemme go!

SNAKE


Hurry up!

OTACON


Is that how you ask a guy a favor?

OTACON


Jeez! It's like an animal's cage... What a smell!

SNAKE


'Cause of him.

OTACON


Eeyaaah!! It's the DARPA Chief!!

SNAKE


If you don't hurry up and get me out of here, I'll be laying next to him.

OTACON


Those bastards!

OTACON


This lock won't open with a security card. You need a key like the soldiers carry.

SNAKE


So what are you doing here then?

OTACON


I... I thought you might be hungry.

OTACON


If you need more food, I can bring some more later.

OTACON


Also, I got you this level 6 card. It'll get you out of that Torture Room.

OTACON


Here, take this too...

SNAKE


What's this?

OTACON


It's a handkerchief. I got it from Sniper Wolf.

SNAKE


Why?

OTACON


I don't know why, but she's nice to me.

SNAKE


Sounds like Stockholm Syndrome to me.

OTACON


I was taking care of the dogs here.

OTACON


After the terrorists took over, they were planning to shoot all the dogs.

OTACON


But Sniper Wolf stopped 'em... She even let me feed them when I asked.

OTACON


She likes dogs. She must be a good person. Please don't hurt her.

Otacon shakes his head, rejecting Snake's assertion.

Snake isn't satisfied with Otacon's effort. He reaches out for him, trying to grab him again, but Otacon manages to back away first.

Sound of Johnny flushing the toilet.

Otacon starts to tremble at the thought of this.

Sound of Johnny slamming the bathroom door shut.
Escape from the Cell 7

Otacon Takes Off Cutscene (Cell)

Overhead view.

Otacon turns his stealth camouflage back on. The door leading away from the cell opens, and his transparent silhouette takes off.

But Otacon isn't coming back.

Snake is alone once again.


Escape from the Cell 8


Escape 1 – Hiding Under the Bed (Cell – Overhead View)

Overhead view. When Johnny returns to the cell and looks back in (he's there to bring Snake back out for another torture session), Snake is hiding under the bed.

He opens the door and storms into the middle of the cell. After looking everywhere and seeing Snake is nowhere to be found, he checks under the bed. The player can then crawl out from under the bed, take out Johnny, and escape.

SNAKE


Wake up you idiot! She's the one who shot Meryl!

OTACON


Well, that's all I can do...

SNAKE


They're planning to launch a nuke! I've got to stop them!

OTACON


Then you'll have to get past the Communications Tower.

SNAKE


First, you have to get me out of here!

OTACON


C'mon... I'm trying my best!...

SNAKE


That guard's got the key. You'll have to take him out!

OTACON


Gimme a break! I'm no soldier! I can't take anybody out!

SNAKE


You have to!!

OTACON


I'll be killed!

SNAKE


?

OTACON


Oh jeez... He's coming back... See ya later...

SNAKE


Wait.

JOHNNY


Ha!? He's gone!
Escape from the Cell 9

Escape 2 – Using the Ketchup (Cell – Overhead View)

Overhead view. If the player equips the Ketchup, goes prone, and remains still, the ketchup will ooze out, making it look like Snake is bleeding.

*If player remains still when Johnny returns...

He opens the door to investigate. The player can then take out Johnny and escape.

*But if the player uses the Ketchup while Johnny is watching...

He laughs. What's more, the Ketchup can only be used once.


Escape from the Cell 10


Escape 3 – The Ninja Busts Snake Out (Cell – Overhead View)

Overhead view. After the third torture session, as soon as Johnny is gone something strikes the door out of the blue. Sound of the doorknob being broken. The door then slowly swings open.

After a fleeting moment of gratitude, the unidentified ally's stealth camouflage flickers, revealing it to be the Ninja.

As quickly as he appears, the Ninja is gone. Snake escapes the cell.
Ocelot's Trap 1

Post-Explosion Codec Call (Torture Room)

Snake has escaped the cell and recovered his gear that was being held in the torture room.

But Ocelot hid a time bomb among Snake's equipment in the event he managed to break out. Snake discovers the bomb before it's too late—either by himself or thanks to another tip from the mysterious Deepthroat—avoiding what would have been an unfortunate, grisly end.

After the bomb explodes, Snake receives a call from Campbell.

*If player heard the Codec tip from Deepthroat

JOHNNY


What the hell?

JOHNNY


What are you playing around with that ketchup for?

JOHNNY


What the hell are you doing?

SNAKE


Otacon? So you are here to get me out.

SNAKE


The Ninja?

CAMPBELL


That was a close one, Snake.

SNAKE


Ocelot... you'll pay for that...

SNAKE


That Deepthroat's a real enigma. He's definitely from inside their ranks.

CAMPBELL


Is he an informer? Maybe some kind of renegade?

CAMPBELL


I've got the feeling there's some other force at work here.
Ocelot's Trap 2

Meryl Flashback Cutscene (Underground Passageway to Communications Tower)

Having busted out of the cell, Snake retraces his steps to the Communications Tower in order to reach Metal Gear's underground hangar on the other side of them. He's soon back at the location where Meryl was shot.

Snake stands beside the bloodstained snow where Meryl fell. His head drops.

He thinks back to their last moments together.

Flashback to the scene where Meryl is shot. Black and white visuals.

As the blood continues to pool, Meryl raises her voice.

She lets her head drop and starts to cry a little.

Big tears run down her cheek.

Back to the underground passageway to the Communications Tower.

Snake continues to hang his head. He gets a call from Campbell.

Snake answers.
Ocelot's Trap 3

Naomi's Upbringing Codec Call

*If Meryl is dead

*If Meryl is alive

SNAKE


...

MERYL


I... I... I can still help... I want to help you!

SNAKE


Quiet down. Save your strength!

MERYL


I was a fool. I wanted to be a soldier.

MERYL


But war is ugly. There's nothing glamorous about it.

MERYL


Snake, please! Save yourself! Go on living and don't give up on people!

MERYL


Don't forget me...

CAMPBELL


Snake, about Meryl...

SNAKE


Colonel, I'm sorry...

CAMPBELL


Listen to me.

SNAKE


I wasn't able to protect her.

CAMPBELL


*tryng to force away his sadness* Snake, it's okay. You did what you could, now let it rest.

SNAKE


Colonel...

CAMPBELL


*saying it to himself too* She was a soldier. She knew the risks. Battlefield casualties are always tragic, but they're an unavoidable part of war.

CAMPBELL


Snake... she's a soldier. She knows that prisoners are a part of war.

CAMPBELL


She joined up of her own free will. I'm sure she was prepared for this.

SNAKE


No. You're wrong...

CAMPBELL


...?

SNAKE


Meryl thought she had to become a soldier... thought it was the only way. She said she thought it would bring her closer to her dead father.

*If Meryl is dead

*If Meryl is alive

*End of branching dialogue

Snake and Naomi's charming little back-and-forth allows Campbell to forget—at least for a brief while—the sadness that's gripped him ever since what happened to Meryl. In some way, he feels this has helped him pull himself together. Consequently, his mood is a little lighter than it's been recently.

CAMPBELL


*surprised because he's actually her father* She said that!?

SNAKE


She wasn't ready for real combat. I shouldn't have pushed her so hard... It's all my fault.

MASTER


That's not like you, Snake.

CAMPBELL


Master? What is it?

MASTER


Sorry for eavesdropping, but I just couldn't listen anymore.

SNAKE


Master...

MASTER


Snake, you can have regrets if you want to... It's only natural. But you can't keep attacking yourself for things that happened in the past. That road leads to madness, believe me.

MEI LING


He's right. Don't kick yourself. It doesn't suit a legend like you.

MEI LING


And besides that, for all we know Meryl's okay, right?

MEI LING


I'm sure Meryl's just fine.

SNAKE


Mei Ling...

CAMPBELL


Snake, forget about Meryl. Stop Liquid. That's what Meryl would want, too.

SNAKE


You're right. Meryl would say the same thing.

NAOMI


...Snake?

SNAKE


What?

NAOMI


*jealous* Meryl... she's pretty special to you, huh?

SNAKE


Yes, she's special. There aren't many women like her around.

NAOMI


*irritated jealousy* ... That's not what I meant...

SNAKE


She's the Colonel's niece... And a combat buddy.

NAOMI


*jealous* Is that all? C'mon...

SNAKE


... This is like a police interrogation.

NAOMI


No... I just...

CAMPBELL


I guess it's in the genes...

SNAKE


The genes? What are you talking about, Colonel?

CAMPBELL


No, I just remembered about Naomi's grandfather. I think Naomi said he rose as high as assistant secretary in the FBI
6 during Edgar Hoover's time.

SNAKE


Is that right?

NAOMI


*shocked Snake has moved on and alters her lies* Yes... yes, he was Japanese and he became a special undercover investigator to nab the mafia.
Communications Tower A 1

Antenna Explosion Cutscene (Communications Tower A)

The two towers, A and B, stand at a little over 100 meters (328 feet) tall and are just shy of 20 meters (66 feet) long on each side. They're supported by two massive columns, and on each roof is a large parabolic antenna with a radius of several dozen meters.

The towers are connected by two walkways—one about 50 meters (164 feet) up, and another linking the roofs.

Snake reaches the roof of Tower A. He's about to pass by its antenna when suddenly, he hears the swoosh of a missile being launched, which is soon followed by a huge explosion.

Snake instinctively hits the deck. He tilts his head up slightly, giving him a look at the giant antenna going up in flames.

This is immediately followed by the sound of another missile launch and a second explosion. The disc-shaped antenna, freed from its anchors, starts to slowly tilt, gaining speed until it's pressing against the steel frame of the walkway.

There's an additional, smaller blast. The dish stops rotating, and the flaming remains gradually topples sideways. The whole tower shakes violently as pieces of the antenna come flying at Snake. He covers his face and torso with his arms. This is followed by yet another explosion and a shower of sparks.

The walkway's railing has caught the toppled antenna. Snake hops over the handrail and heads a little east to survey the damage. The antenna has completely blocked off the walkway to Tower B.

Snake grasps the situation, and it isn't a good one. He stands back up.

Then, past the burning antenna, the nose of a Hind D rises into view, accompanied by the deafening chopping of its rotors. Snake is nearly blown off his feet by the high winds generated by the helicopter. He loops an arm around the handrail and leans forward, covering his face with his hands as he strains his eyes ahead.

Beyond the flames, he sees a familiar face in the cockpit—his own. At the controls is none other than Liquid Snake.

MASTER


When was that?

NAOMI


Oh... sometime in the 50's, I guess.

MASTER


Where?

NAOMI


... New York, I think...

SNAKE


Naomi... I thought that you didn't have any family...

NAOMI


*shaking a little* Well... I... I researched it after I became an adult. My grandfather was already dead by the time I learned about him. I never even had the chance to meet him...

CAMPBELL


Oh...

NAOMI


... Snake, good luck.

CAMPBELL


Watch your back, Snake.

SNAKE


Damn!!

LIQUID


Snaaaaake!!
Liquid yells over the loudspeaker.

Snake leans over the handrail, looking down at the other walkway far below.

The other walkway connecting the two towers is located 50 meters (164 feet) below him. This is Snake's only other way to Tower B. From this height, the walkway looks like a length of string.

*If player already has the rappelling rope

*If player doesn't have the rappelling rope

Snake gives the handrail two or three firm wiggles to test its strength. Liquid wonders what Snake is planning.

Out of patience, Liquid hovers closer to Snake. Their eyes meet.

The antenna was balanced on the upper walkway, but the gusts from the Hind are causing it to tilt further. Snake looks over at it. He has to make a decision.

Whatever he decides, Snake needs to move.
Communications Tower A 2

Rappelling Prep Cutscene (Communications Tower A Roof)

Snake takes out the rope and ties it to the handrail. He checks the knot, tests its strength, steps over the handrail, and gets ready to rappel. He uses one hand to maintain his balance and the other to support his weight. Snake places the soles of his boots against the tower, controlling the speed of his descent by how tightly he grips the rope with the hand that's supporting his weight.


Communications Tower A 2a


Rappelling Codec Call (Communications Tower A Roof)

Mandatory incoming call from Campbell. He explains how to rappel.

LIQUID


I'm afraid I can't let you get past here!

SNAKE


Liquid?

LIQUID


You're not going any farther. Die!!!

SNAKE


It's a long way down. If only I had a rope.

SNAKE


I should be able to use that rope I got...

SNAKE


There must be one around here somewhere.

LIQUID


What are you going to do? Take on a Hind with your bare hands?

LIQUID


Now you're mine!

SNAKE


If I stay here, I'm finished.

CAMPBELL


Here's how to rappel.

CAMPBELL


Press the Crawl Button to jump away from the wall. While you're away from the wall, press down on the Directional Button to drop down. If you jump while pressing right or left on the Directional Button, you can make a big jump in that direction.

CAMPBELL


If you press and hold the Action Button while using the Directional Button, you can walk slowly across the wall.

CAMPBELL


If you're careful with the timing, you should be able to dodge the gunfire from the Hind while you rappel down. If anyone can do it, you can Snake!
Communications Tower A 3

Rappelling Complete Cutscene (Communications Tower A Rappelling)

Snake rappels down the side of Tower A, dodging machine-gun fire from the Hind. He's just a few meters (around 10 feet) above the walkway he needs to reach.

It's then that he realizes the rope isn't long enough. He can't continue down it any further.

Snake makes up his mind and jumps.

Snake lands on his butt, but at least he made it to the walkway.


Hind D Battle 1


Otacon Encounter Cutscene (Communications Tower B Spiral Staircase)

Snake crosses the walkway and starts climbing the staircase of Communications Tower B.

He starts on B4, where the walkway ends. There are elevator doors and a panel for calling the elevator. Ordinarily Snake would be able to use the elevator, but—perhaps because the power to it is out—nothing happens when he presses the button on the panel (Action Button).

There is very little lighting in the staircase. Despite how hard he tries, Snake can only see about 10 meters (33 feet) in front of him.

There are no enemy soldiers—or anyone else, for that matter—in the staircase. In fact, the only sound is that of the Hind circling outside, waiting for Snake to reappear.

Snake climbs to B6. As he's about to make a left turn to continue up the staircase, he hears what sounds like something hitting a wall.

Snake immediately points his weapon in the direction the noise came from.

A vague figure can be seen on the staircase landing.

Snake is primed to shoot.

The figure is concealed by stealth camouflage.

The humanoid silhouette raises both hands and pleads.

But Snake remains in his shooting stance.

The figure presses the switch on their stealth camouflage, and with a visual noise effect, Otacon pops into view. It's only him. He takes a step forward and speaks again.

Confirming it is in fact Otacon, Snake lowers his gun.

Otacon pulls up the bottom of his lab coat (stealth camo), clearly proud of his achievement.

This gets Snake thinking. Otacon doesn't follow.

SNAKE


*shouts as he falls several meters (around 10 feet)*

SNAKE


*groans as he lands*

OTACON


Don't shoot!!

OTACON


It's me! Don't shoot!

OTACON


It's me, Snake!!

SNAKE


Otacon? How'd you get here?

OTACON


It wasn't as dramatic as your entrance, believe me. I'm afraid of heights.

SNAKE


You were watching?

OTACON


Yeah, I was watching. I was riding in the back of their truck... thanks to the stealth camouflage.

SNAKE


How did you get up here?

OTACON


The elevator, of course.

SNAKE


The first floor of the circular staircase was destroyed.

OTACON


That's why I took the elevator...

Snake grows more and more wary.

He peers down the elevator shaft like he's got something on his mind. Otacon takes a closer look at him, catching his face from the side. Snake is covered in blood and dirt. He looks exhausted.

They can hear the chopping of the Hind D's rotors.

Otacon points up, referring to the helicopter circling overhead.

Otacon stops himself before he says any more.

There's a silence between them. Then, as Snake is still looking down the depths of the elevator shaft, Otacon speaks.

After hesitating a little, he summons up the courage to ask:

Snake is somewhat bewildered by this sudden question.

Otacon silently agrees. Snake's words have given him hope.

Snake looks away from the elevator shaft.

Otacon winces a little.

A small part of Otacon is offended that Snake wouldn't have entrusted such a task to him anyway. He leans against the wall as he agrees.

Otacon backs up, shaking his head. He gets a fright when he backs into the wall.

SNAKE


The elevator was working?

OTACON


Yeah... that's right.

OTACON


You're incredible... like a movie hero or something.

SNAKE


No... you're wrong. In the movies, the hero always saves the girl...

OTACON


... You mean Meryl?

OTACON


... Sorry... Forget I said anything...

OTACON


Snake, there's something I've really got to ask you.

OTACON


It's why I followed you up this far...

OTACON


Have you ever... loved someone?

SNAKE


That's what you came to ask?

OTACON


No I mean... I... I was wondering if even soldiers fall in love...

SNAKE


What are you trying to say?

OTACON


I wanna ask you... Do you think love can bloom even on a battlefield?

SNAKE


Yeah... I do. I think at any time, any place... people can fall in love with each other. But... if you love someone, you have to be able to protect them...

OTACON


I think so too.

SNAKE


I have a favor to ask.

OTACON


Uh oh.

SNAKE


Don't worry. It'll be easy.

OTACON


Umm... I told you before, I don't wanna hurt anyone.

SNAKE


I don't want you to either.

OTACON


Okay...

SNAKE


The elevator is stopped down there. I want you to get it to move.

SNAKE


You see?
Shot of the elevator.

Otacon stands next to Snake, looking down the elevator shaft. For a moment, he's forgotten all about his fear of heights.

They turn and look at each other. Suddenly, the Hind's rotors grow even louder.

Snake indicates above and speaks.

Leaving Snake behind, Otacon steps down from the landing onto the stairs. His face is covered with soot and oil.

Otacon stops and gives his face a wipe with his hands, his palms scraping across his stubble.

Otacon turns his stealth camouflage back on.

Otacon heads downstairs, his footsteps echoing up and down the staircase.
Hind D Battle 2

The Hind is Back Cutscene (Communications Tower B Roof)

Snake climbs up Tower B and steps out onto the roof.

There's another explosion as the nose of the Hind D surfaces above the edge of the roof. Liquid is still in the cockpit.


Hind D Battle 3


The Hind Crashes Cutscene (Communications Tower B Roof)

After a long, arduous battle, Snake manages to take down the Hind.

It loses altitude as smoke comes out the side of its fuselage (the engine compartments).

Hind D - Cockpit

Liquid wrestles with the control column as he tries to regain control of the chopper, but it isn't going very well.

Communications Tower B - Roof

Snake watches the Hind move erratically.

OTACON


That's weird.

SNAKE


It was working before, but now it isn't.

OTACON


... Maybe the panel's broken?

SNAKE


Can you fix it?

OTACON


It was working before. If it's the mechanism, leave it to me.

SNAKE


I've got to go and swat a noisy fly.

OTACON


Okay. I'll stay here and hold the fort. Good luck.

SNAKE


You really look like hell. Are you okay?

OTACON


Don't worry. If I do this, it doesn't matter.

OTACON


I just pretend like I'm not here. Then I'm not scared.

SNAKE


Strange logic. I'm counting on you.

LIQUID


So the Snake's finally come out of his hole? Are you ready now... my brother?

SNAKE


Why are you calling me brother? Who the hell are you!?

LIQUID


I'm you. I'm your shadow.

SNAKE


What!?

LIQUID


Ask the father that you killed! I'll send you to hell to meet him!!

LIQUID


C'mon, fly!
Liquid in the Cockpit
The helicopter is losing more and more altitude. Liquid pulls up as hard as he can, trying to avoid crashing into the towers. The instruments are going crazy, warning lights are flashing, an alarm is blaring.

Communications Tower B - Roof

The Hind continues to drop, disappearing from Snake's line of sight on the roof.

Snake runs up to the handrail to maintain a visual, but the Hind, spitting a long trail of black smoke that reduces Snake's visibility to near zero, fades into the darkness of the night.

Hind D - Cockpit POV

The Hind plummets toward the rock-hard Alaskan permafrost.

Liquid looks up at the roof as he goes down, watching Snake recede from view.

The Hind then slams into the ground and explodes.

A second explosion, presumably gasoline that's ignited, follows.

Snake turns around, his back to the crash. The Codec rings.

Snake answers it.
Hind D Battle 4

Post-Hind Crash Codec Call

LIQUID


Damn!!

LIQUID


Snaaake!!

SNAKE


See you in hell... Liquid.

SNAKE


... That takes care of the cremation.

OTACON


Snake, the elevator's working.

SNAKE


You fixed it?

OTACON


No, that's the weird thing. It just moved by itself. It's headed your way now.

SNAKE


Is that so? Okay.

OTACON


That explosion before... what was it?

SNAKE


Oh, I had to take out that helicopter.

OTACON


Helicopter? That's incredible, Snake!

SNAKE


Listen. I just want to make sure again. This is the way to get to where Metal Gear is being stored?

OTACON


Yeah. The entrance to the underground maintenance base is towards the back of the snowfield ahead.

SNAKE


Okay. Find a safe place to hide out for a while. I'm going underground.

OTACON


I know, I know. You don't have to tell me.

SNAKE


And stay outta my way. Don't try to be a hero or anything.

OTACON


Okay, call me if you need to.
Hind D Battle 5

Elevator Codec Call (Communications Tower B Elevator)

Snake gets on the elevator in Communications Tower B. The weight limit warning goes off, but the elevator moves anyway.

A short time later, Snake gets a call from Otacon.

OTACON


Snake, there's something I forgot to tell you before.

SNAKE


What?

OTACON


There were five stealth camouflage prototypes in my lab.

SNAKE


Yeah, so?

OTACON


If you take out the one I'm wearing, that leaves four.

SNAKE


Hey. This isn't first grade math class.

OTACON


I thought I'd get one for you, so I went back to the lab and...

SNAKE


Yeah?

OTACON


The four suits were missing.

SNAKE


...?

OTACON


Also... about the elevator that I checked out...

OTACON


It's really strange. It was like someone was intentionally holding it.

SNAKE


When you were riding on it, did the weight limit warning go off?

OTACON


That's another thing that bothered me about it...

OTACON


The warning went off and I know I couldn't be over the limit.

SNAKE


How much do you weigh?

OTACON


About 135. But that elevator had a weight limit of 650 pounds.

SNAKE


It would take at least five people to go over that limit...

OTACON


L... Look out, Snake!

OTACON


The guys who stole my stealth prototypes are in there with you!!!
Hind D Battle 6

Stealth Camo Soldiers Ambush Cutscene (Communications Tower B Elevator)

Overhead view.


Wolf Battle (2nd) 1


Wolf and Otacon Codec Call (Snowfield)

Snake heads north from Tower B. He steps out into a vast snowfield, an open space situated between mountains and steep cliffs. Between the darkness, the snow that's blowing, and the ice fog, visibility is extremely poor.

As Snake wanders the snowfield in search of the entrance to Metal Gear's underground base, he's hit by sniper fire. He retreats and repositions himself, then gets a call from Otacon.

Otacon can't bring himself to say it. After a brief silence, he blurts it out:

Wolf cuts into the conversation.

SOLDIER


Too late, Snake! Now die!

OTACON


Snake!! Are you okay!?

SNAKE


Otacon! Were there any other stealth prototypes?

OTACON


No. There were only five.

SNAKE


So... this isn't stealth camouflage then...

OTACON


What are you talking about?

SNAKE


Someone's aiming at me... in the middle of this blizzard...

OTACON


... It's her!!

SNAKE


Wolf?... Sniper Wolf?

OTACON


Yes it's her!... It's definitely her!

SNAKE


Otacon... You sound like you're happy.

OTACON


No I'm not.

SNAKE


So then what is it?

OTACON


Snake... please don't kill her!

SNAKE


*furiously* Are you insane!?

OTACON


*frantically* Please. She's a good person! You'd know that if you talked to her...

SNAKE


Listen to me, kid. She's a merciless killer.

WOLF


*laughes joyously over their reunion* I can see you perfectly from here. I told you... I'd never quit the hunt. Now you're mine.

OTACON


Wolf! No, you can't!

WOLF


Don't get between a wolf and its prey!

SNAKE


You're pretty good if you can hit me in this storm.

WOLF


You see? Women naturally make better soldiers.

OTACON


Wolf! Don't do this!!
Wolf Battle (2nd) 2

Wolf's Final Moments Cutscene (Snowfield)

Snake has beaten Wolf for a second time.

She's lying on the ground. He approaches her.

Wolf is face-up, bleeding from her chest. Her sniper rifle, also a PSG-1, lies out of reach nearby. Wolf stares up at the sky, catching snowflakes on her palms. Despite her defeat, her face suggests she is at peace. The mounds of her bosom, supported by her bloodstained shirt, rise and fall in irregular intervals.

Snake quietly walks up to her.

Wolf pays no mind to him, continuing to look up at the sky.

Snake crouches next to her to better hear her words.

Snake just listens. He can tell from the sound of her voice that she's fading fast.

Wolf coughs, clearly in a lot of pain. Blood can be heard flooding her lungs.

Blood from her chest wounds has pooled around her, continuing to grow in size.

Snake can't comply with her request right away. She looks at him, then back up at the sky as she starts to talk about her life.

The history and suffering of Kurdish refugees.

News footage (Kurdish refugees, the Gulf War, the invasion of Erbil, etc.).

WOLF


Snake, I'm near. Can't you sense me near you?

SNAKE


It's a mistake for a sniper to reveal her location.

WOLF


Is that right? Well I'm going to send you a love letter, my dear. Do you know what that is? It's a bullet straight from my gun to your heart.

OTACON


Please!! Wolf!... Snake!... No!

WOLF


Quiet! Don't get in our way!

SNAKE


Now I'm gonna pay you back for Meryl...

WOLF


You men are so weak. You can never finish what you start...

WOLF


I... I've... waited for this moment...

WOLF


I am a sniper. Waiting is my job...

WOLF


Never moving a muscle... concentrating...

WOLF


I am lung-shot. Y... you cannot save me. Please... just finish me quick.

WOLF


I am a Kurd
7 . I have always dreamed of a peaceful place like this...

SNAKE


A Kurd? So that's why you're called Wolf...

Wolf sheds a tear. Snake wipes it away.

Wolf turns her head in Snake's direction for the first time.

Her sight failing, Wolf wonders who she's actually talking to.

Wolf looks into Snake's eyes, then gives a slight nod. She's accepted this is how her life will end.

Snake slowly raises his gun (SOCOM or FAMAS) at Wolf.

Sounds of footsteps crunching through the snow and a man crying. The footsteps get closer, though no body is visible. Otacon slowly materializes.

He falls to his knees on the snowy ground. He can't bring himself to go up to Wolf.

Otacon mutters in a voice too soft to be heard by Wolf. Even from where he is, he can see that she's going to die.

Wolf reaches up at Snake like she wants something.

WOLF


I was born on a battlefield. Raised on a battlefield. Gunfire, sirens and screams... they were my lullabies... Hunted like dogs day after day... driven from our ragged shelters... That... was my life. Each morning, I'd wake up... and find a few more of my family or friends dead beside me. I'd stare at the morning sun... and pray to make it through the day.

WOLF


The governments of the world turned a blind eye to our misery. But then... he appeared. My hero... Saladin... he took me away from all that...

SNAKE


Saladin?... You mean Big Boss?

WOLF


I became a sniper... hidden, watching everything through a rifle's scope. Now I could see war, not from the inside, but from the outside... as an observer...

WOLF


I watched the brutality... the stupidity of mankind through the scope of my rifle.

WOLF


I joined this group of revolutionaries... to take my revenge on the world.

WOLF


But... I have shamed myself and my people. I am no longer the wolf I was born to be... In the name of vengeance, I sold my body and my soul. Now... I am nothing more than a dog.

SNAKE


Wolves are noble animals. They're not like dogs. In Yupik, the word for wolf is "Kegluneq," and the Aleuts revere them as honorable cousins.

SNAKE


They call mercenaries like us "Dogs of War." It's true, we're all for sale at some price or another. But you're different... untamed... solitary. You're no dog... You're a wolf.

WOLF


Who are you?... Are you Saladin?

SNAKE


Wolf... you spared Meryl's life.

WOLF


She... she was never my real target... I don't kill for sport.

SNAKE


Rest easy. You'll die as the proud wolf you are.

WOLF


I finally understand. I wasn't waiting to kill people...

WOLF


I was waiting for someone to kill me...

WOLF


A man like you...

WOLF


You're a hero. Please... set me free...

OTACON


Why...!? Why...!?

OTACON


I loved you...

SNAKE


What is it?

WOLF


My gun... give it to me...
Otacon rushes over to the PSG-1, picks it up like an object worthy of respect, and brushes off the dusting of snow that's accumulated on it.

Otacon lays the rifle against Wolf's body.

Wolf smiles. She's at ease now. Otacon can't look her in the eye.

From a distance, the howls of wolves travel over the snowfield. One by one their cries turn into a chorus.

Snake signals Wolf with a look. She responds with a weak nod, then looks back up at the sky.

Otacon covers his ears and turns his back to Wolf.

A single gunshot echoes across the snowfield. The wolf dogs continue to mourn.

Snake and Otacon look down at Wolf's body.

Snake takes out the Handkerchief and lays it over Wolf's face.
Snake gets back up.

Snake's reply causes Otacon to burst out crying again. The wolves' lament fades away.

Snake starts walking, leaving Otacon behind.

Otacon's shoulders drop. He stands there staring at Wolf's body.

Suddenly, he remembers something. He looks back at Snake.

WOLF


She's a part of me...

WOLF


Everyone's here now...

WOLF


Okay hero, set me free...

OTACON


Goodbye...

OTACON


Snake... you said that love could bloom on a battlefield...

SNAKE


...

OTACON


But I couldn't save her.

OTACON


What are you doing?

SNAKE


Returning it to its owner. I don't need a handkerchief.

OTACON


Why?

SNAKE


I don't have any more tears to shed.

SNAKE


I'm going to the underground base. We're out of time.

OTACON


I know.

SNAKE


You'll have to protect yourself now. Don't trust anyone.

OTACON


Yeah...

SNAKE


If I can't stop Metal Gear, this whole place will probably be bombed to hell.

OTACON


... Yeah...

SNAKE


We might not meet again.

OTACON


I'll hang on to my Codec. I wanna keep helping.

SNAKE


You can leave any time. Get a headstart... a headstart on your new life.

OTACON


Snake!!
Snake stops.

Snake doesn't respond.

Snake remains quiet.

Snake turns to Otacon and shouts over to him.

Otacon smiles, and waves goodbye with a childlike innocence.

He turns his stealth camouflage back on, dissolving into the darkness.

His rhythmical, clockwork footprints in the snow extend in the opposite direction of Snake.

The only other trace of Otacon is his tears falling to the ground, glittering in the night.
Footnotes

1
A group of treaties, signed at various points between 1864 and 1949, that establishes standards for the treatment of prisoners of war. As part of these rules, a prisoner is only obligated to give their name, rank, serial number, and date of birth to their captor.
2
A political movement aimed at reforming the Soviet Union's economy, championed by Mikhail Gorbachev after becoming the country's general secretary in 1985.
3
Acronym for the former Soviet Union's Glavnoye Razvedyvatelnoye Upravlenie ("Main Intelligence Directorate"). Since the end of the Cold War, it has continued its activities as part of the Russian military, and its subordinate organizations utilize Spetsnaz special forces.
4
Special forces that handled military intelligence and reconnaissance activities for the former Soviet Union and have continued to operate for the Russian military since the end of the Cold War.
5
See the related Nastasha Codec calls for details (p. 523).
6
Acronym for the Federal Bureau of Investigation. The principal federal law enforcement agency of the United States, operating under the Department of Justice, its efforts are directed toward combating espionage, subversive activities, terrorism, and other crime and organized crime that threaten national security.
7
An ethnic group inhabiting a geographical area known as Kurdistan, which stretches across Turkey, Iran, Iraq, and Syria. In 1988, Iraq used chemical weapons on Kurds, a genocide that resulted in the deaths of over 5,000 people.

OTACON


What was she fighting for!?

OTACON


What am I fighting for!?

OTACON


What are you fighting for!?

SNAKE


If we make it through this, I'll tell you!

OTACON


Okay. I'll be searching too.

After taking out Johnny – the player can now escape
*If player didn't submit

After the Ninja appears – the player can now escape

*First time only

*Second and subsequent times

CAMPBELL


Snake, don't worry. You'll have a chance to escape. Hang on.

CAMPBELL


The guard is only human. He has to sleep and go to the bathroom like the rest of us. That'll be your chance.

CAMPBELL


Snake, that's a prison cell. You can't open the door from the inside. Somehow you'll have to get the key off the guard.

SNAKE


Yeah, but how?

NAOMI


Why don't you try disappearing?

CAMPBELL


The ketchup! You might be able to trick the guard if you use it right.

NAOMI


Snake, why don't you use the ketchup and pretend that you're dead?

CAMPBELL


Great job with the guard, Snake. Now is your chance to escape.

SNAKE


I plan on it. Next time I meet Ocelot, it's going to be on my terms...

NAOMI


How do you feel, Snake? Can you go on?

SNAKE


Yeah. Don't worry. That sadist can't keep me down.

CAMPBELL


I don't know how, but the door is open.

SNAKE


I saw the silhouette of someone in stealth cammies...

CAMPBELL


Stealth camouflage? Could it be Emmerich?

SNAKE


No, I don't think it was Otacon.

CAMPBELL


So who then?... You don't think it could be Gray Fox?

SNAKE


Yeah, I do. I think it was...

NAOMI


... Are you saying that he came to save his friend?

SNAKE


Could be. Or maybe he just doesn't want me to die in a prison cell.

NAOMI


... I don't know. I can't imagine what he could be thinking...

CAMPBELL


Snake, you can worry about it later. Now is the time to escape.

Communications Tower A – before checking 9F door

*First time only

CAMPBELL


Snake, wait a minute. You forgot to take your items.

NAOMI


They're probably being kept somewhere close by.

CAMPBELL


Snake, get that bomb out of your items!

CAMPBELL


Select the bomb in the Equipment Window and press the Action button to throw it away!

CAMPBELL


Hurry! Throw it away!

CAMPBELL


Snake, Naomi wants to talk to you.

NAOMI


How do you feel, Snake?

SNAKE


Well, to tell you the truth, I think I'm catching a cold...

NAOMI


I'm monitoring you via the nanomachines... Your body temperature is elevated and your lymph nodes are slightly swollen. But don't worry, it appears to be just a mild rhinovirus.

SNAKE


I guess I got it from that soldier.

NAOMI


I've increased your nutrition and elevated your blood sugar level.

SNAKE


You can't cure it?

NAOMI


Sorry, Snake. The nanomachines don't carry antibiotics.

NAOMI


Maybe you could find some garlic. It contains natural antibiotics, you know. Vitamins and minerals too.

SNAKE


Uhhh. Raw garlic. Gimme a break.

CAMPBELL


There must be some cold medicine somewhere on the base. That would make you feel better.

CAMPBELL


If not, you'll just have to wait until your body's natural defenses take over.

CAMPBELL


To get to the underground base where Metal Gear is, you'll have to climb the Communications Tower on the north side of the cave.

NAOMI


Wait a minute, Snake. You're in an armory. Why don't you load up on ammo?

CAMPBELL


Snake, the launch deadline for the new nuclear warhead is almost here. Hurry and get to Metal Gear's underground maintenance base!

CAMPBELL


The overland route is blocked by a glacier. Climb the Communications Tower so you can go over it.

The Communications Tower consists of Tower A and Tower B. You're in Tower A now. To get to Tower B, you'll have to use the outside walkway.

SNAKE


Yeah. Any ideas?

CAMPBELL


Why don't you ask Dr. Emmerich.

CAMPBELL


You can take that to the other side too.

NAOMI


Be careful, Snake.

Snake, you'll have to use the walkway on the roof. Climb up there!

SNAKE


That's easy for you to say...

CAMPBELL

CAMPBELL


The walkway on the roof of Tower A was destroyed...? That doesn't mean there's no other way.

CAMPBELL


Is there a rope or something around there? If you had a rope you could rappel from the roof of Tower A down to the walkway below. You're an expert at rappelling aren't you?

CAMPBELL


You'll have to go to the north part of Tower A and use that rope to rappel down to the walkway below.

NAOMI


It's too dangerous! That Hind is aiming at Snake! And he'll need to use both hands to rappel too!

CAMPBELL


You're right, but we have no choice! The Hind can't move in tight spaces. It's our best bet!

NAOMI


This is insane!

SNAKE


The colonel's right. There's no other way.

CAMPBELL


Here's how to rappel.

CAMPBELL


Press the Crawl Button to jump away from the wall. While you're away from the wall, press down on the Directional Button to drop down. If you jump while pressing right or left on the Directional Button, you can make a big jump in that direction.

CAMPBELL


Snake, why don't you try the door that leads from the walkway to Tower A?

NAOMI


Snake, you're under attack from off-screen.

SNAKE


What should I do?

CAMPBELL


First find out where the enemy is. Use your binoculars. Then attack with a PSG-1 or Remote Controlled Missile. Something with a longer range than an ordinary weapon.

CAMPBELL


Snake, the Hind is still circling above the Communications Tower.

SNAKE


*grinds his teeth in frustration* Damn. There's no weapon here that I can use to take him on.

CAMPBELL


Dr. Emmerich might know where there's a weapon you could use against the Hind. Why don't you ask him.

CAMPBELL


Snake, hurry up and get those Stinger Missiles. Didn't Emmerich say they're near the entrance to the walkway in Tower B?

*First time only

*If they don't know if Liquid survived

CAMPBELL


It looks like the weather is getting worse. Try using your Binoculars.

SNAKE


What about the satellite data?

MEI LING


I'm sorry, Snake. I can't see the entrance in the satellite photos either.

SNAKE


What about a heat source? An exhaust pipe or something?

MEI LING


I can't confirm anything. Only that there are multiple heat sources to the southeast of your position.

CAMPBELL


That's probably just the burning wreckage from the Hind.

MEI LING


Snake, you're in a big open space surrounded by walls. The entrance to the underground base should be somewhere in there.

MEI LING


Stay close to the walls and you won't get lost.

CAMPBELL


Snake, you're our only hope. Please stop them from launching that nuke.

SNAKE


*gravely* Colonel, listen to me. I found a parachute near the wreckage of the Hind.

CAMPBELL


A parachute? You don't think that Liquid survived....?

SNAKE


Impossible. As soon as he jumped out of the pilot's seat, he'd be sliced up faster than an onion on an infomercial.

NAOMI


... So what's that parachute doing there then?

SNAKE


I have no idea.

CAMPBELL


A trap?

SNAKE


Either that or a message...to me.

CAMPBELL


... Meaning "I'm not dead," I suppose...

SNAKE


Maybe... but I think it's more like "I'll string you up!"

NAOMI


...

CAMPBELL

SNAKE


I won't.

CAMPBELL


Snake, look at your C-rations. They're frozen. You can't use frozen C-rats.

They'll defrost in a warm place. Probably just your bare skin would be fine.

CAMPBELL


It's Sniper Wolf. You can only shoot at her with your PSG-1.

NAOMI


*worried* Snake, Wolf is hiding somewhere in that Snowfield. First you'll have to find out where she is.

CAMPBELL


She should come out of hiding briefly to shoot at you.

CAMPBELL


It looks like Wolf is down. Now get to Metal Gear's underground base on the double.

CAMPBELL


A sad story. We shouldn't have turned our backs on the Kurds after the Gulf War...

SNAKE


Listen. We're not responsible for her choices. Everyone decides their own fate, no matter where they were born.

SNAKE


Words like fate, karma... it's just an excuse for giving up if you ask me...

NAOMI


*empathizing because she was also born in a war zone* I don't agree with you. Maybe if she hadn't been born on a battlefield, she might have had a happier, more fulfilling life. She might not have turned into a killer...

SNAKE


...

CAMPBELL


Snake, hurry up and get to Metal Gear's underground base! The entrance should be towards the back of the Snowfield.

MEI LING


Snake, are you okay? I feel so scared for you. It must be horrible.

SNAKE


*courageously* I've been through a lot worse. Believe me.

MEI LING


*relieved* Wow. You really are a hero.

MEI LING


It's a good thing the Codec is connected directly to your inner ear. You can contact us anytime.

MEI LING


... It's always nice to hear that you're all right.

MEI LING


Why don't you contact the Colonel? If anyone can think of a way out, it's him.

SNAKE

MEI LING


... Snake, don't blame yourself too much.

MEI LING


You just...

SNAKE


I just let them kill Meryl to save my own worthless hide!

MEI LING

MEI LING


*trying to find the right words* ...

MEI LING


Forget it... I'll use my own words this time.

MEI LING


Cheer up, Snake.

MEI LING


Don't listen to what he said. It's nothing but a bluff. I'm sure about that.

SNAKE


*hopelessly* I don't think he's the bluffing type...

MEI LING


*trying to cheer him up* But, Snake. You have a job to do. Pull yourself together for the world's sake.

MEI LING


First, you've got to figure out how to get out of there.

SNAKE


*can only respond with silence* ...

MEI LING


Snake, listen to me!

MEI LING


You... you've got to pull yourself together, and get back to work.

SNAKE


*appreciatively* You're right. I've sat here feeling sorry for myself long enough.

SNAKE


Thanks, Mei Ling...

NASTASHA


Just because you are locked up does not mean there is no chance of escape. Keep your eyes and ears open and when you see a chance, take it.

NASTASHA


You should call Campbell and wait for his instructions.

NASTASHA


Snake, do you like the atmosphere there or something? Hurry up and escape!

NASTASHA


What about your equipment? You're not going to leave behind everything you've collected are you? Hurry! Grab your stuff.

NASTASHA


Snake, hurry to the Communications Tower.

NASTASHA


That was a close one. I didn't think they would go so far as to booby trap your equipment... Sneaky bastards.

NASTASHA


It sounds like you have a bad cold. You had better try to shake it off.

NASTASHA


When you're in a dark place, you should use Night-Vision or Thermal Goggles.

NASTASHA


Rope? If it is at least 12 millimeters thick, lightweight and hard to cut you should be able to rappel with it as well. It is not a hemp rope is it?

SNAKE


No. It looks like it's made of nylon fibers.

NASTASHA


Good. When hemp rope gets wet it loses its flexibility. It would not be good for rappelling. But that rope sounds like it will not be a problem.

NASTASHA


To beat that Hind, you need a SAM, a surface to air missile. You cannot shoot it down with just small arms fire. If only you had a Stinger...

NASTASHA


Only a handful of pilots in the world could operate a Hind in a blizzard like this. The IR and night-vision equipment would be useless. He must be flying on manual. That means your Chaff won't work.

*Second time

NASTASHA


The Hind is still around. You'll need a surface to air missile to take him on. Like a Stinger or something...

NASTASHA


You are under long-distance attack. Shoot back with your sniper rifle.

NASTASHA


You have Stinger missiles. Now you have at least got a chance against the Hind...

SNAKE


Only a chance?

NASTASHA


Well you are not exactly evenly armed. That Hind is a monster. You have only a small chance to win, but at least it's better than no chance...

SNAKE


That's a pretty grim analysis, Nastasha.

NASTASHA


To shoot down that Hind, you will have to get to a place with good visibility. Do not try to fight in that walkway. Get up on that roof where you will have a clean shot at him.

NASTASHA


Your best chance is to hit him while he is circling, when his nose isn't pointed at you. That is your opening. Shove a Stinger Missile up his butt!

NASTASHA


That machine gun can rip you to shreds in seconds. When it is facing in your direction, you'd better hide in the shadows up there.

NASTASHA


You cannot move while operating your Stinger Missile. Focus your sights on that bird as soon as it shows its tail. When its gun turret is aimed at you, quickly hide in the shadows. Use your Weapon Quick Change Button effectively.

NASTASHA


That Hind is equipped with infrared and night-vision equipment. It can fly even in pitch darkness. But there's one thing...

NASTASHA


Only a handful of pilots in the world could operate a Hind in a blizzard like this. The IR and night-vision equipment would be useless. He must be flying on manual. That means your Chaff won't work.

•Master


Prior to Torture Escape

Medical room – after torture sequence

*If player hasn't submitted

*First time only

*Second time only

*Third time only

NASTASHA


My God, you actually shot down that Hind...

SNAKE


You're the one who said I could do it with a Stinger... You didn't really think I had a chance, did you?

NASTASHA


It is not that...

NASTASHA


Well, after all, that Hind shot down two F-16s. It is hard to believe that after doing that it got taken out by just one man.

NASTASHA


Stealth camouflage? Yes. That is the new material, recently developed, which hides a person's body by bending light. I think you should ask the person who invented it.

NASTASHA


Use the Thermal Goggles like Dr. Emmerich said.

NASTASHA


If you don't have Thermal Goggles, there is not much you can do. Try to watch for a faint disturbance in the air. That's where your stealth soldiers are.

NASTASHA


Sniper Wolf... It is pretty unusual for a sniper to announce their presence before they shoot. She must have a real thing for you.

NASTASHA


Anyway, I do not think it is going to be as easy as before.

MASTER


Normally, when a soldier is taken prisoner, he should only give up the Big 4. That's name, rank, serial number and date of birth. But you're not any old soldier, Snake.

MASTER


I don't want you to tell them anything. Fortunately, you're strong enough to resist.

MASTER


Don't say anything to tease or anger the person torturing you. If you make him mad, it'll be that much worse for you. You'll need to save your strength.

MASTER


If you get a chance to eat, don't pass it up. A prisoner can't be choosy. You need to get your strength back so you can escape when the opportunity presents itself.

MASTER


Snake, you'll get a chance to escape. Make sure you take it.

SNAKE


Master, I...

MASTER


Don't say it, Snake. You still have a mission to accomplish. That's all you should be concentrating on right now.

MASTER


Snake, now's your chance. Take it. Get out of there!

MASTER


Snake, what happened to your items? You're not going to try to finish this mission barehanded are you? Get your items.

MASTER


Now that you've got your stuff back, you should take a good look through it. If you're slow equipping an item in battle, it could mean death.

MASTER


That was too close, Snake.

SNAKE


Yeah. That was quite a surprise all right.

MASTER


*with restrainted anger and disbelief because Ocelot went rogue* Hiding a bomb in your items... that's a despicable act. He should never... Well, forget it. You'd better hurry to the underground base. You're almost out of time.

MASTER


You caught a cold, Snake? In battle you need to be in top physical condition. Do you have any cold medicine?

MASTER


The wolf dogs aren't attacking? Are you carrying something that might be causing them to act like that?

OTACON

OTACON


You should just use the walkway on the roof.

OTACON


And since the walkway on the roof is destroyed, to get to Tower B, you'll have to take the walkway on the other side of that door.

OTACON


If you had a rope, maybe you could lower yourself from the roof of Tower A to the other side...

OTACON

OTACON

SNAKE


I wanted to go slowly. But someone there forced me to move faster.
