OTACON


That walkway will take you to Tower B.

OTACON


Snake, the walkway is on the roof of Tower A.

OTACON


Snake, are you going to take on a Hind with your bare hands?

SNAKE


I'm not that big a fool. Isn't there a weapon I can use against him somewhere?

OTACON

OTACON


I saw a rope on the bottom floor of Tower A.

OTACON

SNAKE


Totally different.

OTACON

SNAKE


This is real. Not some prearranged stunt. If I screw up, there are no retakes.

OTACON


Yeah... I guess you're right.

Snake, there are some places on the wall where steam from the heating system is spurting out. So be careful, it'll give you a nasty burn.

No problem.

Prior to Entering Underground Base

Snowfield – Wolf battle (2nd)

After defeating Wolf, before Wolf's Final Moments cutscene

After Wolf's Final Moments cutscene

OTACON


Snake, are you okay!?

SNAKE


So far. How are you doing?

OTACON


Sorry. The elevator's not working yet. It's strange. There's no problem with the motor and the power is on. I need a little more time...

OTACON


I don't know why, but the elevator just started working again. If you take it all the way to the bottom of Tower B and go outside, you'll be in the Snowfield.

OTACON


The entrance to the underground maintenance base is in the north of the Snowfield.

SNAKE


Otacon, I can't see them! What should I do?

OTACON


Hmmm... Stealth camouflage works by bending the light around an object. That's how it makes them invisible.

OTACON


But it doesn't have the ability to mask heat.

OTACON


Use your Thermal Goggles, Snake. You'll be able to see their heat signatures!

OTACON


Huh? You don't have any Thermal Goggles? Well with your eyesight, you might be able to spot 'em if you look really hard.

SNAKE


Otacon, which direction is the underground base?

OTACON


It's in the snowfield to the north of Tower B. The door is security level 6.

OTACON


The weather is terrible. Make sure you don't get lost out there.

OTACON


Snake, I don't have to tell you, but it's bitter cold out there. It'd be dangerous to stay out in the Snowfield too long.

I... I can't tell you.

OTACON


The entrance to the underground maintenance base is in the north of the Snowfield.

OTACON


... I'll be watching, Snake...
To the Underground Base 1

Naomi is a Spy Codec Call (Cargo Elevator)

Having finished off Wolf, Snake continues to the underground base. Beyond the snowfield, he proceeds through a blast furnace and boards an incline cargo elevator.

The air gets colder and colder the deeper it goes. Even its pipes have frozen.

Snake is around 80 meters (262 feet) below ground when he gets another Codec call.

MASTER


Snake. I've got something to tell you about Naomi Hunter.

SNAKE


What about her?

MASTER


Is this conversation secure?

SNAKE


Don't worry. The monitor's off.

MASTER


Okay.

SNAKE


What's up?

MASTER


I was in the FBI too, y'know.

SNAKE


I didn't know that. What's your point?

MASTER


Dr. Hunter's story about her background... about her grandfather being an assistant secretary to Hoover in the FBI...

SNAKE


Yeah?

MASTER


And then going undercover to investigate the mafia in New York...

SNAKE


Yeah, what about it?

MASTER


It was all a big lie.

SNAKE


What did you say?

MASTER


It was really bothering me. Why would she lie about it?

SNAKE


She lied?

MASTER


She might be a spy!

SNAKE


Ridiculous.

MASTER


C'mon. Even a high school student could see past it. The head of the FBI at that time, Edgar Hoover... he was a well-known racist.

MASTER


Didn't Naomi say that her father was Japanese?

SNAKE


Yeah...

MASTER


Well back then there wasn't a single Asian investigator.
Raven Battle 1

Raven's Return Cutscene (Raven's Room)

The cargo elevator comes to a stop just outside the entrance to the underground base.

Snake heads through the door. He finds himself in a square-shaped room 40 meters (131 feet) long in each direction. The walls, floor, and ceiling... The whole space has been dug out of the permafrost and reinforced to prevent a cave-in. The "X" symbols used on the stabilizing materials have an almost geometric design to them. The place feels like a construction site where the work remains ongoing.

The iron pillars supporting the ceiling and walls have poor excuses for lights (lanterns) attached to them. There's no heating whatsoever—the place is like a giant walk-in freezer.

In the middle of the room are neat rows of containers with ammunition in them.

Atop one of the containers is a black mass about two meters (six feet) in height.

Upon closer examination, Snake can see the mass pulsing ever so slightly.

Snake cautiously approaches it. Suddenly, the mass scatters into the air. It's another conspiracy of ravens, and they come at Snake's face!

Snake covers his face with his hands. The ravens scatter, flying into the passageway (a ventilation shaft above the door) that takes them back to their nests.

With the ravens gone, this reveals what the mass was covering—Vulcan Raven, silently kneeling with his head down.

Raven slowly rises, then raises his Vulcan cannon.

At over two meters (over six feet) tall, Raven is already a big fellow, but standing on the containers makes him even more intimidating.

MASTER


Also, in the 1950's the undercover mafia sting operations hadn't even started yet. They first started in 1960... in Chicago, not New York.

SNAKE


But...

MASTER


You better check it out. The chief and the president dying, that ninja... too many strange things are happening.

SNAKE


Are you saying that Naomi might be behind it?

MASTER


I don't know. Either that or she's working with the terrorists.

SNAKE


... Could it be?

MASTER


If I find out anything, I'll call. In the meantime, be careful!

SNAKE


!!!

RAVEN


Welcome, kasack!! This is the end of the road for you! Right, my friends?
The ravens caw in response, watching from their nests.

*If player killed ravens on the elevator or in a nest

*End of branching dialogue

Raven responds to Snake's unabashed insult with enthusiastic laughter.

Raven leaps onto the ground from the container. He is deceptively nimble despite his massive frame.

The ravens clamor, seemingly understanding Raven's every word.

Suddenly, judging from his expression, Raven seems to endure some great pain. The tattoo of a raven on his forehead emerges from him as though it is a living creature.

The raven slowly takes flight.
It lands on Snake's shoulder, then folds its impressive wings.

Snake has no control over his body.

Raven peers deep into Snake's soul.

Raven raises the barrel of his Vulcan cannon, signaling the bird.

The raven disappears. Snake can move again.

RAVEN


Listen. They agree.

RAVEN


How dare you kill my friends...

RAVEN


Ravens aren't scavengers like most people think...

RAVEN


They're simply returning to the natural world that which is no longer needed. Sometimes they even attack wounded foxes.

SNAKE


You were the one in the M1 tank? Musta been a tight fit for a big boy like you.

RAVEN


Ha ha ha ha ha... But that was no true battle.

RAVEN


The ravens and I were testing to see what kind of man you were.

RAVEN


The judgment is decided. The ravens say you are a true warrior.

SNAKE


Am I hallucinating?

SNAKE


I... I can't move...

RAVEN


The Raven has put the mark of death upon you.

RAVEN


Blood from the East flows within your veins.

RAVEN


Ah... Your ancestors too were raised on the barren plains of Mongolia.

RAVEN


Inuit and Japanese are cousins to each other... We share many ancestors, you and I...

SNAKE


I don't have any crows in my family tree.

RAVEN


You jest, but indeed ravens and snakes are not the best of friends. Nevertheless you will make a worthy adversary.

RAVEN


You live in Alaska too. You know of the World Eskimo-Indian Olympics?

SNAKE


You must be a real threat in the "Muktuk Eating" contest.

RAVEN


Yes, you are right. But there is another event I excel at.

RAVEN


It is called the "Ear Pull."

RAVEN


It is an event where two opponents pull each other's ear while enduring the harsh cold. It tests spiritual as well as physical strength...

At some point, the raven returned to Raven's forehead.


Raven Battle 2


Raven Dies Cutscene 1 (Raven's Room)

Snake survives the fury of Raven's Vulcan cannon, defeating the shaman.

Raven leans against a wall, spent. Despite his exhaustion, however, he remains standing.

The Vulcan cannon is pointing to the ground, helping Raven remain upright. Snake approaches.

A raven lands on his shoulder.

Raven looks at the bird as he continues to speak.
The raven responds by stirring and cawing.

His strength fading, Raven reaches into his pocket and takes out a card.

Raven holds out the card. Snake accepts it.

SNAKE


You want to pull each other's ears?

RAVEN


The form is different, but the spirit is the same. Rejoice, Snake! Ours will be a glorious battle.

SNAKE


This isn't glorious. It's just plain killing. Violence isn't a sport!

RAVEN


Well, we will see if there is iron in your words!!

RAVEN


Just as the Boss said...

RAVEN


It is my existence which is no longer needed in this world.

RAVEN


But my body will not remain in this place.

RAVEN


My spirit and my flesh will become one with the ravens.

RAVEN


In that way, I will return to Mother Earth who bore me.

RAVEN


Snake! I will be watching you... Understand?

RAVEN


Snake, take this security card. It will open that door.

SNAKE


Why?

RAVEN


You are a Snake which was not created by Nature.

RAVEN


You and the Boss... you are from another world... a world that I do not wish to know...

RAVEN


Go and do battle with him... I will be watching from above.

RAVEN


First I'll give you a hint...

RAVEN


The man who you saw die before your eyes...
Raven Battle 3

DARPA Chief's Death Flashback Cutscene (Chief's Cell)

Raven talks over visuals of Snake listening to Anderson.

Suddenly, Anderson is gripped by some terrible pain.

He grabs at his chest, writhing in agony.

Anderson clings to Snake's shoulders.

The Chief's cell, several minutes later.

Snake has left. Raven appears. He walks up to the body in the cell and removes the mask (special makeup) this individual was wearing, revealing the reddish face of Decoy Octopus. His nose and ears are missing.

Raven continues over the flashback.

Apart from his face, Octopus's skin is a peculiar sort of white color from the neck up, due to him disguising himself as the DARPA Chief.

Raven looks down at Octopus.

Raven places Octopus's body on his shoulder and walks away.

Shot of Octopus's face bouncing up and down as Raven leaves.
Raven Battle 4

Raven Dies Cutscene 2 (Raven's Room)

Back in Raven's room. He and Snake face one another.

Raven chuckles.

The ravens take off from their nests and fly toward Raven.

Snake looks up at the ventilation shaft. The birds come pouring into the room and swarm the motionless Raven at the wall. They cover every inch of his body, looking just like the large black mass at the start of the encounter. The ravens peck at and tear off his flesh. The commotion they make—which could be interpreted either as one of joy or of sadness—reverberates through the cave.

From beneath the black mass, Raven speaks his final words.

Snake asks a question as he turns and walks away.

Snake heads for the door. The ravens' chatter gradually dies down.

RAVEN


That was not the DARPA Chief.

RAVEN


It was Decoy Octopus. A member of FOX-HOUND.

RAVEN


He was a master of disguise...

RAVEN


He copied his subjects down to the blood. So he drained the Chief's blood and took it into himself.

RAVEN


But he wasn't able to deceive the Angel of Death. (Referring to FoxDie.)

SNAKE


The Angel of Death?

SNAKE


But why go to so much trouble? Why impersonate the Chief?

RAVEN


That is the end of my hint. You must solve the rest of the riddle yourself.

RAVEN


Snake! In the natural world, there is no such thing as boundless slaughter.

RAVEN


There is always an end to it. But you are different.

SNAKE


What are you trying to say?

RAVEN


The path you walk on has no end.

RAVEN


Each step you take is paved with the corpses of your enemies...

RAVEN


Their souls will haunt you forever... You shall have no peace...

RAVEN


Hear me, Snake! My spirit will be watching you!!
Snake turns back around.

The birds all scatter at once. There isn't a trace of Raven left.

Snake's Codec rings. He answers it.


Raven Battle 5


Post-Raven's Death Codec Call

Master is hinting at the DIA.

Campbell is indecisive. Master makes a stony declaration.

MASTER


Snake, it's me...

SNAKE


Master?

MASTER


It's about Naomi. Turn your monitor off...

CAMPBELL


What about Naomi?

MASTER


Damn!

SNAKE


Colonel, is Naomi there?

CAMPBELL


No, she's away. She's taking a short nap.

SNAKE


Hmmm...

CAMPBELL


So what is this about Naomi?

MASTER


Okay. Maybe we'd better let the Colonel hear this too.

SNAKE


Yeah... go on Master.

MASTER


Well basically, Dr. Naomi Hunter is not Dr. Naomi Hunter at all.

CAMPBELL


What!?

MASTER


I thought her story of her background sounded kind of fishy, so I checked it out.

SNAKE


And...?

MASTER


There is an actual Dr. Naomi Hunter, or I should say there was one...

MASTER


But she's not the woman we know. The real Naomi Hunter disappeared somewhere in the Middle East. Our Naomi must have somehow obtained her identification papers.

CAMPBELL


So then who is she really?

MASTER


She must be some kind of... spy.

CAMPBELL


A spy!?

MASTER


Yes... Maybe she's been sent to sabotage this operation.

CAMPBELL


Are you saying she's with the terrorists?

SNAKE


... I don't want to believe it either. But she is working for FOX-HOUND...

CAMPBELL


So you think she had a part in the uprising?

MASTER


Or she could be working with some different group altogether.

CAMPBELL


Different group...? It couldn't be...

MASTER


Place her under arrest.

CAMPBELL


What!?

MASTER


She's betrayed us. She needs to be arrested and interrogated to find out who she's with.

(The Colonel is referring to FoxDie.)

Master is fishing for information about FoxDie.
Metal Gear's Hangar 1

Otacon Codec Call 1 (Metal Gear Hangar 1F)

After defeating Raven, Snake infiltrates the hangar where Metal Gear is stored.

The hangar is like a massive vault, with the ceiling at least 20 meters (66 feet) or higher—a four-story office building could fit inside. The Metal Gear stands over 10 meters (33 feet) tall and sits secured to a platform in the middle. Running all across it is a network of maintenance pipes, cables, and the catwalks workers use to access its various sections. The space is divided into three floors, which includes the catwalks, and they're connected by ladders rather than stairways. The ladders' widths are such that only one person can go up or down at a time.

There's an additional, lower floor beneath the platform Metal Gear rests on. Drainage flows into the sides of this area—it consists of stagnant liquid with a pallid glow to it, including wastewater created during the nuclear disposal process. The reason for its presence here is contaminants from the decommissioned nuclear weapons stored on the base, as well as other radioactive materials, have gotten into the base's drainage system.

Snake is about to climb the ladder to the second floor when his Codec rings.

It's Otacon.

CAMPBELL


*gravely* If she's one of their spies, then we're in big trouble...

SNAKE


What do you mean!?

CAMPBELL


Oh nothing...

MASTER


Have you let her in on some kind of vital secret or something?

CAMPBELL


...

MASTER


Does this have anything to do with the mysterious deaths of the DARPA Chief and the ArmsTech president?

CAMPBELL


I... I have no idea.

MASTER


Anyway, we cannot allow her to participate any further in this mission.

CAMPBELL


Wait, wait a minute. Without her, we can't complete this mission.

SNAKE


I knew it. You're hiding something.

CAMPBELL


Give me some time. I'll try to get it out of her...

MASTER


Hurry then. We've got to figure out who she is and what she's doing here.

CAMPBELL


I understand.

CAMPBELL


Snake, give me some time.

SNAKE


I don't have any time left for you.

OTACON


Snake... it's me.

SNAKE


What's wrong? Did you find a good place to hide?

OTACON


Yeah, thanks to the stealth gear.

OTACON


It looks like they've finished getting Metal Gear ready.

SNAKE


How do you know that?

OTACON


I overheard them talking. Where are you now?

SNAKE


Right in front of Metal Gear... but it's strange.

OTACON


What is?
Metal Gear's Hangar 2

Otacon Codec Call 2 (Metal Gear Hangar 2F)

Snake is about to climb the ladder to the third floor when his Codec rings.

It's Otacon again.


Metal Gear's Hangar 3


Otacon Codec Call 3 (Metal Gear Hangar 3F)

The third floor is positioned at the same height as the top of Metal Gear. Catwalks extend to its
randoseru (nuclear module), radome, railgun unit, and cockpit.
The ladder to the third floor puts Snake on the nuclear module (
randoseru ) on Metal Gear's back. When he reaches the middle of its back, Snake gets another call.
Once again, it's Otacon.

SNAKE


There's nobody here... no guards, nobody patrolling... it's too quiet.

OTACON


Maybe because they're all ready. They said they even input the PAL codes.

SNAKE


What should I do?

OTACON


All we can do is use the override system that President Baker told you about.

SNAKE


But I've only got one of the three keys. And besides that, like Ocelot said, there's some trick to using the keys...

OTACON


Leave it to me...

SNAKE


You got some kind of plan?

OTACON


Well, I'm in the computer room right now. I'm trying to access Baker's private files.

SNAKE


Baker's files? Don't you need a password?

OTACON


Of course. But there are ways...

SNAKE


*slightly surprised* Are you a hacker?

OTACON


Yup. That describes me pretty well.

SNAKE


Does it look like you can get in?

OTACON


I don't know yet. I'll give it a try.

SNAKE


I'm counting on you...

OTACON


Snake... it's me again.

SNAKE


How's it going?

OTACON


Hmmm... not bad. I just got past his third security level. He was a pretty careful guy.

SNAKE


Do you think you'll break in soon?

OTACON


I've never met a system I couldn't bust into.

SNAKE


Okay, keep trying...

OTACON


Snake, I did it!

SNAKE


You got past security?

OTACON


Bingo!!!

SNAKE


Great! So whaddya got?

OTACON


I accessed the confidential Metal Gear file.

SNAKE


So what about the PAL override system that Baker talked about?

OTACON


I haven't found it yet...

SNAKE


That's what I need to know!

OTACON


But Snake, I found something else!

SNAKE


What?

OTACON


The secret behind the new nuclear weapon!

OTACON


Just as I thought, the nuclear warhead is designed to be fired from the rail gun like a projectile...

OTACON


It doesn't use fuel, so it isn't considered a missile. That way it can get around all sorts of international treaties.

SNAKE


Pretty sneaky.

OTACON


Yes, but effective. And that's not even the scariest thing about this weapon.

SNAKE


I can't wait to hear this.

OTACON


*spitting out* It's a stealth weapon!

SNAKE


You mean it won't show up on radar?

OTACON


Yeah. The truth is... they've been working on a stealth missile since the late 70's.

SNAKE


Why weren't they able to develop one until now?

OTACON


Because of the missile's rocket propulsion system... It will be picked up by enemy satellites.

SNAKE


Oh yeah, that makes sense.

OTACON


But unlike a missile, the rail gun doesn't burn any propellent. So it can't be detected by any current ballistic missile detection systems.

SNAKE


An invisible nuclear warhead...

OTACON


*angry* Totally impossible to intercept.

OTACON


And on top of that it's got a surface piercing warhead designed to penetrate hardened underground bases.

SNAKE


We learned that lesson in the Gulf War.

OTACON


This thing could mean the end of the world!

SNAKE


It's the ultimate weapon. And from a political point of view, it avoids the problem of nuclear reduction and nuclear inspections.

SNAKE


Colonel, is this true? Are you listening?

CAMPBELL


I'm listening...

SNAKE


If word of this got out, it could delay the signing of the Start 3 Treaty and cause a huge international incident.

OTACON


Yeah, it would be nasty. The United States would be denounced by the U.N... It could even bring the President down...

SNAKE


Did you know this, Colonel!?


Metal Gear's Hangar 4


Otacon Codec Call 4 (Control Room)

The control room for Metal Gear is located on the west side of the third floor. This is also where the detonation codes can be overridden.

Just as Snake reaches the door to the control room, he gets another call from Otacon.

Snake answers.

CAMPBELL


I'm sorry...

SNAKE


You've changed, Colonel...

CAMPBELL


I won't make any excuses...

OTACON


Snake, listen to me. This new nuclear weapon... it's never actually been tested, only simulated.

SNAKE


You mean they ran a computer model?

OTACON


Yeah, that's why they were conducting this exercise. They needed to get actual experimental data to back up the simulation.

SNAKE


What were the results of the exercise?

OTACON


It looks like it went better than they hoped for. But... I can't find the data anywhere on this network. You'd think that data as important as that would be carefully recorded...

SNAKE


It was. President Baker gave me an optical disk with all of the test data.

CAMPBELL


What!? Do you still have it?

SNAKE


No. Ocelot took it from me.

CAMPBELL


Damn...

OTACON


The terrorists have replaced the dummy warhead with a real warhead. Once they input the detonation codes, they should be ready to launch.

SNAKE


So you think they can do it?

OTACON


Well, the dummy warhead was designed to be identical to the real thing, so I think so.

SNAKE


Did you find out how to override it yet?

OTACON


Not yet. It must be in a separate file. Right now I'm looking through all of Baker's personal files.

SNAKE


We're counting on you...

OTACON


Snake?

SNAKE


Did you find it?

OTACON


No, I haven't found out about the override system yet, but I found Baker's ulterior motive.

SNAKE


He's just looking to get rich, isn't he?

OTACON


ArmsTech is in much worse financial trouble than I thought.
Metal Gear's Hangar 5

Detonation Codes Input Cutscene (Metal Gear Hangar 3F – Outside Control Room)

Snake goes up the stairs in front of the door to the control room. The door is open. He hears a tense conversation taking place inside. Snake sneaks up to the door and presses himself against the wall next to it.

Snake peeks into the hangar's control room.

There are two men inside. One is Revolver Ocelot. The other has his back to Snake, but he's got long hair, is shirtless, and is well built.

The man addressed as "Boss" turns this way, his back to Ocelot now.

Snake recognizes him immediately—it's Liquid.

Snake lowers his head a little to try to avoid being seen.

SNAKE


I know they lost their bid to make the next generation fighter jet. That plus the reduction in SDI spending...

OTACON


It looks like there was even some talk of a hostile takeover.

SNAKE


Everything was riding on this project, I guess.

OTACON


And it looks like we were paying a lot of bribe money to the DARPA Chief.

SNAKE


Bribe money, huh?

OTACON


Yeah, and Baker was a big proponent of the nuclear deterrent theory.

SNAKE


I see... So anyway, what about the override?

OTACON


Just give me a little bit longer...

OCELOT


Okay. I've entered the PAL codes and disengaged the safety device.

OCELOT


We can launch anytime.

LIQUID


There's still no response from Washington. It looks like we'll have to show them that we mean business.

OCELOT


Should I set it for Chernoton, Russia?

LIQUID


No, there's been a change. The new target is... Lopnor, China.

OCELOT


Why Boss?

LIQUID


I'm sure neither you nor Mr. Gurlukovich would really like to see a nuclear bomb dropped on your Motherland, right?

SNAKE


Liquid!

OCELOT


But why? There's nothing there.

LIQUID


Wrong. It's a nuclear test site.

OCELOT


A nuclear test site?

Ocelot gives Liquid's tough approach a nod of approval.

Liquid goes up to Ocelot.

Low-angle shot of Metal Gear.

LIQUID


If we nuke a major population center, the game's over...

LIQUID


But a nuclear explosion at a test site can still be concealed from the public. Meanwhile Washington will be worried about the retaliatory strike from China.

OCELOT


That'll probably mean top secret talks between both countries' leaders...

LIQUID


Of course. And in the process, the President will be forced to divulge the existence of a new and highly destabilizing nuclear weapon to the Chinese. What do you think that will do to the U.S.'s reputation? Or the President's?

OCELOT


And with the CTBT
1 , that means that China and India... I see...

LIQUID


Yes. When the other countries hear about this new weapon, they'll all want to contact us. Washington won't be very happy when we start selling their own system to the highest bidders.

LIQUID


Yes. The President will break. He will give in to our demands.

OCELOT


Big Boss's DNA and one billion dollars...

SNAKE


One billion dollars!

LIQUID


That money will be used to cure our Genome Soldiers as well.

LIQUID


I'm also including the FoxDie vaccine in our demands.

OCELOT


FoxDie... It killed Octopus and the ArmsTech president... So it's true that it affects older people first.

OCELOT


Mantis might not have been affected because he wore a mask.

LIQUID


Wolf wasn't infected either. Perhaps due to those tranquilizers she always took.

OCELOT


Something to do with the adrenalin level in the blood? Or maybe it's just because this FoxDie was still experimental and they haven't worked out all the bugs yet...

LIQUID


In any case, have you heard from your friend, Colonel Sergei Gurlukovich at the Spetznaz?

OCELOT


He still has doubts about the ability of Metal Gear. He said we can talk after Metal Gear's test launch is successful.

LIQUID


*somewhat sarcastically* He is a very prudent man.

OCELOT


There's nothing to worry about. The Colonel wants Metal Gear and the new nuclear weapon so bad he can taste it.

OCELOT


If Russia wants to regain its position as a military superpower, they need to reinforce their nuclear arsenal. They need a nuclear weapon that can't be intercepted. Metal Gear will allow them to gain first strike capability over the rest of the world.

LIQUID


*spits out* Their regular army is in shambles and they think they can restore their country's military power with nuclear weapons?

Snake sits down at the shock of this.

Ocelot goes to the surveillance camera feed behind him (east side) and pans the camera a little, looking at the spot next to the door where Snake is hiding. He zooms in, the monitor showing a big image of Snake as seen from the side.

Ocelot continues, seemingly aware that Snake is there.

The lights on the three PAL terminals are on. Beyond them, the gigantic head of Metal Gear is visible.

Snake shakes his head a little, like he's recalling his experience in the torture room.

Liquid leans forward at the window, taking in Metal Gear.

The surveillance monitor is still zoomed in on Snake.

Liquid and Ocelot get serious again. Ocelot looks around and speaks.

(Snake has already been seen on the surveillance camera feed.)

OCELOT


Gurlukovich... he's no warrior... He is a politician. But he's the one who gave us the Hind and most of our other heavy firepower.

LIQUID


He's got over a thousand soldiers under his command. If we joined forces we could put up quite a resistance here.

LIQUID


Since Mantis died, the Genome Soldiers' brainwashing has started to wear off. I'm worried about the men's morale.

LIQUID


An alliance with the Russians would boost that as well...

OCELOT


What are you saying?

LIQUID


We're not going anywhere. We're going to dig in here.

OCELOT


We could still escape...

LIQUID


We've got the most powerful weapon ever made and we're about to ally with Gurlukovich's forces.

OCELOT


Are you going to fight the whole world?

LIQUID


And what's wrong with that?

LIQUID


We can launch a nuclear warhead at any target on this planet... A nuclear warhead invisible to radar. And on top of that, this base is full of spare nuclear warheads.

LIQUID


Once we get the DNA and the money, the world will be ours!

OCELOT


What about your promise to Colonel Gurlukovich?

LIQUID


I have no interest in the revival of Mother Russia.

OCELOT


... You're not thinking of reviving Big Boss's dream?

LIQUID


From today... call this place "Outer Heaven."

SNAKE


Big Boss's dream...

OCELOT


But Boss... you're not worried about the PAL being overridden? If the code is entered again, it'll be deactivated.

LIQUID


No need to worry. The DARPA Chief and the ArmsTech president are both dead.

OCELOT


Does Snake know how the override system works?

LIQUID


You interrogated him. Don't you know?

OCELOT


He didn't have any keys on him.

LIQUID


Good. Then no one can stop Metal Gear now.

Snake's ears prick up at the mention of Meryl.

At that moment, the Codec rings! Only Snake can hear it.

He answers it.


Metal Gear's Hangar 6


How to Override Detonation Codes Codec Call

OCELOT


By the way, what should we do with that woman? Want me to kill her?

LIQUID


Let her live. She's Campbell's niece and Snake cares for her... We'll keep her as our ace in-the-hole.

SNAKE


Meryl... She's alive.

OTACON


Snake, I found Baker's top-secret files!

SNAKE


Great job.

OTACON


How's it going there?

SNAKE


They've finished inputting the PAL codes.

SNAKE


So how do we deactivate them?

OTACON


Okay... Y'see the override system that the president was talking about...

OTACON


It can also be used to input the detonation codes.

OTACON


Y'see, if you insert the keys when the warhead is active, you deactivate it. And if you insert them when it's inactive, it becomes activated. And you can only use the keys once.

SNAKE


Only once, huh.

OTACON


Yeah... You'd better get started. We don't have much time.

SNAKE


But it takes three keys, right!? I've only got one of them!

OTACON


Hold on a minute. Y'see that's the trick. You already have all three keys!

SNAKE


What are you talking about!?

OTACON


The card key is made of a shape memory alloy.

SNAKE


Shape memory alloy?

OTACON


Yes. It's a material that changes shape at different temperatures. The key is made out of it!

SNAKE


This card key?

OTACON


Yeah. The card key changes shape at different temperatures.

SNAKE


So this key is actually three keys in one... Clever.
Metal Gear's Hangar 7

Lost the Key Cutscene (Metal Gear Hangar 3F – Outside Control Room)

Snake hides next to the door to the control room. He takes out the shape memory alloy key Otacon has described.

Snake holds it up and studies it, turning it around.

Otacon continues to explain over the Codec.

Snake sticks his head out to peer into the control room. Liquid and Ocelot stand facing the monitors, making some kind of adjustments.

Snake sees the three terminals in the middle of the room.

Snake takes out his binoculars and zooms in on them.

Snake looks under the terminals. There are symbols on the desk.

Snake pans with the binoculars.
Close-up of the left terminal.

Close-up of the middle terminal.

Close-up of the right terminal.

Snake looks at the key again.

Camera POV. Snake appears in the surveillance feed. The camera zooms in close on him!

Ocelot immediately draws his revolver with his left hand and fires at Snake! The bullet ricochets right in front of Snake, causing him to drop the key.

OTACON


Can you see the input terminals in the center of the Control Room...?

SNAKE


I see them.

OTACON


Those three laptop terminals are for the emergency input.

OTACON


There should be a symbol on each screen...

OTACON


Each symbol corresponds to a different key.

OTACON


Input the keys in order from left to right.

OTACON


The left one's for the room temperature key. See the symbol?

OTACON


Next to that goes the low temperature key.

OTACON


The one on the right is the high temperature key.

SNAKE


Okay, I got it. First I change the shape of the card and then I input them in order, right?

OTACON


That's right. All you do is insert the card keys.

OTACON


After you insert the key into the module, a hard disk reads the information contained on it. Once you've finished with all three terminals, the code input process is complete.

OTACON


But here's the thing. You can only use the key three times. It's an emergency system and it's only meant to be used once.

CAMPBELL


The world is riding on that key, Snake.

OCELOT


Who's that!?

The key spins in slow motion as it slowly falls to the depths below. It plops into the drainage ditch beneath Metal Gear.

Snake reaches out, looking to the bottom of the hangar with frustration. Then, an alarm goes off!

Snake looks up at Liquid. The solid door to the control room slams shut.

Liquid stands there smiling, his shoulders up high. Ocelot holsters his revolver. The two don't seem that concerned about Snake's presence there (they need Snake to enter the detonation codes). Snake gets a call from Campbell!
Shape Memory Alloy Key 1

First Code Entered Cutscene (Metal Gear Hangar 3F – Control Room)

Snake must now override the detonation codes. He recovers the shape memory alloy key that fell into the drainage ditch, then returns to the control room.

Snake inserts the key into the terminal. A confirmation message appears on-screen, and the tower-shaped device slowly sinks into the desk.

Tens of thousands of lines of code run across the monitor at a blistering speed.

Snake studies the screen.

A computer voice blares out into the control room:

The terminal spits the key back out.

Snake retrieves the key.

SNAKE


Damn!!

SNAKE


The key fell in the drainage ditch!

LIQUID


Snake!!

LIQUID


This is bullet-proof glass! There's no way in! I'll enjoy watching you die!

CAMPBELL


Snake, you've got to get that key!

ANNOUNCEMENT


PAL code number one confirmed.

ANNOUNCEMENT


Awaiting PAL code number two...

SNAKE


Okay, that takes care of PAL code number one...

SNAKE


Now PAL number two... Freeze the key.
Shape Memory Alloy Key 2

Second Code Entered Cutscene (Metal Gear Hangar 3F – Control Room)

Snake returns to the room where he fought Raven, freezing the key and thus changing its shape. He then heads back to the control room to override the second detonation code.

Snake inserts the key into the terminal. A confirmation message appears on-screen, and the tower-shaped device slowly sinks into the desk.

Tens of thousands of lines of code run across the monitor at a blistering speed.

Snake studies the screen.

A computer voice blares out into the control room:

The terminal spits the key back out.

Snake retrieves the key.
Shape Memory Alloy Key 3

Codec Call (Cargo Elevator)

Snake gets back on the cargo elevator to return to the blast furnace so he can warm the key.

On the way up, he receives a call from Master Miller.

Snake shakes his head, but then he remembers Liquid and Ocelot's conversation in the control room and a light bulb goes off.

ANNOUNCEMENT


PAL code number two confirmed.

ANNOUNCEMENT


Awaiting PAL code number three...

SNAKE


Okay, there goes PAL code number two.

SNAKE


Next comes PAL number three... Warm the key.

MASTER


Snake. It's about Naomi Hunter...

SNAKE


Then you should talk to the Colonel. He's looking into it.

MASTER


Turn your monitor off.

SNAKE


Okay it's off. No one else can hear us. Go ahead.

MASTER


Sorry, but I didn't want the Colonel to hear.

SNAKE


Okay, so what's up?

MASTER


I've got a good friend in the Pentagon...

SNAKE


Yeah...

MASTER


He's the one who told me about it... It looks like the DIA recently developed a new type of assassination weapon.

SNAKE


An assassination weapon?

MASTER


Snake, have you ever heard of something called "FoxDie"?

SNAKE


No...

SNAKE


FoxDie?... Liquid and the others were talking about it.

Snake wishes Miller would get to the point already.

Snake thinks for a bit before continuing.

Snake is almost at a loss for words.

MASTER


Yeah. It's some kind of virus that targets specific people. I don't know all the details, but...

SNAKE


What are you trying to say?

MASTER


It's too similar.

SNAKE


What is!?

MASTER


The cause of death. Didn't the ArmsTech president and the DARPA Chief, I mean Decoy Octopus... die of something that looked like a heart attack?

SNAKE


Yeah...?

MASTER


Well, apparently FoxDie kills its victims by simulating a heart attack.

SNAKE


...

SNAKE


... No... You're telling me that Naomi was behind it?

MASTER


Snake, try to remember. Did Naomi give you some kind of injection?

SNAKE


... The nanomachines.

MASTER


She was in the best position to have done it, but I don't know what her motive was.

SNAKE


... Does the Colonel know?

MASTER


I'm not sure. But he still hasn't questioned her.

SNAKE


Okay. I'll ask him myself.

SNAKE


Colonel, what's new with the Naomi situation?

CAMPBELL


I just placed Naomi under arrest.

SNAKE


Arrest?

CAMPBELL


She was sending coded messages towards the Alaskan base. I didn't want to believe it, but she must be working with the terrorists.

SNAKE


Are you sure?

CAMPBELL


I'm afraid so. She's being interrogated now.

SNAKE


What kind of interrogation?

CAMPBELL


Well... I'd like to avoid the rough stuff, but we don't even have any sodium pentothol here.

SNAKE


Call me if you find out anything.

MASTER


So it's true, isn't it?

SNAKE


Naomi... I can't believe it.

MASTER


That means the FoxDie vaccine must be around somewhere.

SNAKE


Listen. I've got bigger things to worry about.

MASTER


But Snake... you might be infected too, you know.

SNAKE


All I can do is leave it up to the Colonel.
Shape Memory Alloy Key 4

Naomi's Confession Codec Call (Cargo Elevator)

Snake warms the key in the blast furnace, changing its shape. He then takes the cargo elevator back down to Metal Gear's control room.

Snake gets another call on his Codec.

NAOMI


Snake, can you hear me? It's Naomi...

SNAKE


Naomi...!? What the hell!?

NAOMI


*in an anxious, rushed whisper* Campbell and the others are busy right now... I'm on a different Codec.

SNAKE


Naomi, is what the Colonel says true?

NAOMI


... Yes. But not everything I said was a lie.

SNAKE


Who are you?

NAOMI


I don't know myself. I don't know my real name or even what my parents looked like. I bought all my identification. But my reason for getting into genetics was true.

SNAKE


Cause you want to know yourself, right?

NAOMI


That's right. I want to know where I came from... M-My age, my race... anything.

SNAKE


Naomi...

NAOMI


I was found in Rhodesia sometime in the 80's... a dirty little orphan...

SNAKE


Rhodesia? What's now known as Zimbabwe?

NAOMI


Yes. Rhodesia was owned by England until 1965 and there were lots of Indian laborers around. That's... probably where I got my skin color from, but I'm not even sure about that...

SNAKE


Naomi, you're too worried about the past. Isn't it enough to understand who you are now?

NAOMI


Understand who I am now!? Why should I? No one else tries to understand me.

NAOMI


I was alone for so long... until I met my big brother and "him."

SNAKE


Your big brother?

NAOMI


Yes. Frank Jaeger.

SNAKE


What!?

NAOMI


He was a young soldier, when he picked me up near the Zambezi River. I was half-dead from starvation and he shared his rations with me.

NAOMI


Yes. Frank Jaeger, the man who you destroyed, was my brother and my only family.

SNAKE


No... Gray Fox?

NAOMI


We survived that hell together, Frank and I. He protected me. He's my one connection... the only connection that I have to my past.

SNAKE


And he brought you back to America?

NAOMI


No. I was in Mozambique when "he" came.

SNAKE


Who is "he"...? You mean Big Boss?

NAOMI


Yes. He brought us to this "land of freedom," this America.

A brief, awkward silence.

Snake is silent, immersed in memories of Fox.

After another brief silence, Naomi starts to answer, though it sounds like it isn't easy for her to talk about.

NAOMI


But then he and my brother went back to Africa to continue the war. And that's when it happened...

NAOMI


You killed my benefactor and sent my brother home a cripple. I vowed revenge and joined FOX-HOUND. I knew it was my best chance to meet you and I prayed for the day that I would...

SNAKE


So were your prayers answered?

NAOMI


Yes. I waited two long years...

SNAKE


To kill me? Is that all you cared about?

NAOMI


Yes. That's right. Two years. You were all I thought about for two long years... like some kind of twisted obsession...

SNAKE


Do you still hate me?

NAOMI


... Not exactly. I was partly wrong about you...

SNAKE


What about Liquid and the others?

NAOMI


*intensely* No. I'll have my revenge on them too.

SNAKE


Naomi... you didn't kill that doctor too, did you? The one that used Gray Fox for his genome experiments...

NAOMI


Dr. Clark...? No... that was my brother. Afterwards I covered it up and helped him hide out...

SNAKE


So that Ninja... I mean Gray Fox... he's come here to kill me?

NAOMI


... I don't think so. I think he just came here to fight you... I wasn't sure before, but now I think I understand. A final battle with you... that's all he lives for. I'm sure of it...

SNAKE


*with pity* ... Fox... no...

SNAKE


Naomi, tell me something...

NAOMI


... about FoxDie?

NAOMI


FoxDie is a type of retrovirus that targets and kills only specific people.

NAOMI


First, it infects the macrophages
2 in the victim's body.

NAOMI


FoxDie contains "smart" enzymes, created through protein engineering. They're programmed to respond to specific genetic patterns in the cells.

SNAKE


Those enzymes recognize the target's DNA?

NAOMI


Right. They respond by becoming active, and using the macrophages, they begin creating TNF epsilon.

SNAKE


Huh?

NAOMI


It's a type of cytokine
3 , a peptide which causes cells to die. The TNF epsilon is carried along the bloodstream to the heart, where they attach to the TNF receptors in the heart cells.

SNAKE


And then... they cause a heart attack?

Another awkward silence.

A brief silence.

Naomi decides to make another confession.

Sounds of a struggle on the other end. A face being slapped. A punch being thrown. A scream.

The line cuts to static.

NAOMI


The heart cells suffer a shock and undergo an extreme apoptosis
4 . Then... the victim dies.

SNAKE


Apoptosis... You mean the heart cells commit suicide...

SNAKE


... Naomi...

NAOMI


... What?

SNAKE


... You must have programmed that thing to kill me too, right?

NAOMI


...

SNAKE


Do I still have time?

NAOMI


...

SNAKE


Naomi, I don't blame you for wanting me dead. But I can't go yet. I still have a job to do.

NAOMI


Listen, Snake... I'm not the one who made the decision to use FoxDie.

SNAKE


Huh? You weren't?

NAOMI


No. You were injected with FoxDie as a part of this operation. I just wanted to let you know that...

NAOMI


...No, that's not the whole truth...

SNAKE


Huh?

NAOMI


The real thing that I wanted to tell you was...

NAOMI


Snake, I... I...

MAN'S VOICE


Hey! What are you doing!?

NAOMI


Eeeek!!

NAOMI


Ooooh... Snake...

SNAKE


Naomi!?

CAMPBELL


... Snake, I can't allow Naomi to make any more unauthorized transmissions.

SNAKE


What!?

CAMPBELL


Naomi's been removed from this operation.

SNAKE


What happened to Naomi!? What did she mean when she said that FoxDie was a part of this operation!? Colonel, let me talk to her!

CAMPBELL


I won't. She's under arrest.

SNAKE


*angry* Colonel... You double crossed me!

CAMPBELL


*feeling guilty* Snake, there's no time for that! Right now your job is to stop Metal Gear!

CAMPBELL


... Okay, Snake!?
Master's True Identity 1


Third Code Entered Cutscene (Metal Gear Hangar 3F – Control Room)
After returning to the blast furnace to warm the key, Snake goes back to the control room and enters the third override key.

Snake inserts the key into the terminal on the right. A confirmation message appears on-screen, and the tower-shaped device slowly sinks into the desk. Tens of thousands of lines of code run across the monitor at a blistering speed.

Snake studies the screen.

A computer voice blares out into the control room.

This time, the terminal doesn't return the key.

All three terminals' monitors flash red.

A notification that the system is ready for launch rings out! This is not what Snake was expecting to hear.

Through the window, he can see the lights on Metal Gear turning on (power is being supplied to it).

It is like a creature coming to life.

Snake is rattled. He then gets a call from Master Miller.
Master's True Identity 2


Master was Liquid All Along Codec Call

ANNOUNCEMENT


PAL code number three confirmed.

ANNOUNCEMENT


PAL code entry complete...

ANNOUNCEMENT


Detonation code activated.

SNAKE


No! Why!?

ANNOUNCEMENT


Ready for launch...

SNAKE


I deactivated it!!

MASTER


Thank you, Snake. Now the detonation code is completed.

MASTER


Nothing can stop Metal Gear now.

SNAKE


Master, what's going on?

MASTER


You found the key and even activated the warhead for us too. I really must express my gratitude.

MASTER


Sorry to have involved you in that silly shape memory alloy business.

SNAKE


What are you talking about?

MASTER


We weren't able to learn the DARPA Chief's code. Even with Mantis' psychic powers, he couldn't read his mind. Then Ocelot accidentally killed him during the interrogation.

MASTER


In other words, we weren't able to launch the nuclear device and we were all getting a little worried. Without the threat of a nuclear strike, our demands would never be met.

SNAKE


What do you mean?

MASTER


*unconcerned* Without the detonation codes, we had to find some other way. That's when we decided... you might prove useful, Snake.

SNAKE


What?

MASTER


First I thought we might get the information from you, Snake. So I had Decoy Octopus disguise himself as the DARPA Chief. Unfortunately Octopus didn't survive the encounter... Thanks to FoxDie.

Campbell cuts in.

Master takes off his sunglasses.

He then lets his hair down. It is indeed Liquid.


Master's True Identity 3


Contacting Otacon Codec Call 1

With the door sealed shut and the control room flooded with toxic gas, Snake calls Otacon for help.

SNAKE


*angry* You mean you had this planned from the beginning? Just to get me to input the detonation code!?

MASTER


Huh? You didn't think you made it this far by yourself, did you?

SNAKE


*angry* Who the hell are you!?

MASTER


*ignores* In any case, the launch preparations are complete. Once the world glimpses the power of this weapon, the White House will have no choice but to surrender the FoxDie vaccine to me. Their ace-in-the-hole is useless now...

SNAKE


Ace-in-the-hole? What the...!?

MASTER


*laughs mockingly* The Pentagon's plan to use you was already successful... in the torture room. Snake, you're the only one who doesn't know. Poor fool.

SNAKE


Who are you anyway!?

MASTER


I'll tell you everything you want to know. If you come to where I am, that is.

SNAKE


Where are you?

MASTER


Very close by.

CAMPBELL


Snake, that's not Master Miller!

MASTER


Campbell, you're too late.

CAMPBELL


Master Miller's body was just discovered at his home. He's been dead for at least three days.

CAMPBELL


I didn't know because my Codec link with Master was cut off. But Mei Ling said his transmission signal was coming from inside the base!

SNAKE


So who is it?

CAMPBELL


Snake, you've been talking to...

MASTER


... Me... dear brother.

SNAKE


Liquid!? How the...!?

MASTER


You've served your purpose. You may die now!

OTACON


Snake, that's bullet-proof glass. You can't break it with an ordinary weapon.

SNAKE


Can't you open the security lock here?

OTACON


I'll try. Just hold on for a minute.
Master's True Identity 4

Contacting Otacon Codec Call 2

*After the above call, if the player calls Otacon again within a certain amount of time

*First time

*Second time

*Third time


Master's True Identity 5


Contacting Otacon Codec Call 3

Cutscene of the door opening (in-game overhead view).
Master's True Identity 6

Metal Gear Activated Cutscene (Metal Gear Hangar 3F)

Snake makes it out of the control room and back to the third floor catwalk. He sees Liquid racing toward the nose (cockpit) of Metal Gear. As before, Liquid is shirtless. He's just about to round the corner to the cockpit.

Liquid stops and turns around.

Liquid continues to run along the catwalk.

Snake stays hot on his heels.

Liquid stops in front of Metal Gear's cockpit.

The cockpit door is open. Liquid slowly turns around with a lightness of being—almost like a dancer. Snake stops in the middle of the catwalk and readies his SOCOM or FAMAS.

Snake points the barrel at Liquid. Liquid answers, entirely unconcerned about the weapon pointed at him.

SNAKE


C'mon hurry up already!

OTACON


Hang on!

SNAKE


I'm outta time!

OTACON


Just hold on a little longer!

SNAKE


Otacon!

OTACON


Almost there. Hold on!

OTACON


I hacked into security.

OTACON


Snake! I'm opening the door!

SNAKE


*sighs*

SNAKE


Liquid!!

LIQUID


Snake. Did you like my sunglasses?

SNAKE


Damn!!

LIQUID


You'd point a weapon at your own brother?

SNAKE


Why did you disguise yourself as Master?

LIQUID


So I could manipulate you more easily. And you performed quite well, I must say.

SNAKE


*grinds his teeth in frustration* !

LIQUID


*scornfully laughs* Although the boys at the Pentagon are probably saying the same thing...

SNAKE


What the hell are you talking about!?

Snake lowers his weapon a little after Liquid gives him an answer he wasn't expecting.

Liquid shakes his head.

Snake trains his gun on Liquid again.

Liquid starts to move back and forth across the narrow catwalk.

LIQUID


Following orders blindly with no questions asked. You've lost your warrior's pride and become nothing more than a pawn, Snake.

SNAKE


What?

LIQUID


Stopping the nuclear launch, rescuing the hostages... It was all just a diversion.

SNAKE


A diversion?

LIQUID


The Pentagon only needed for you to come into contact with us. That's what killed the ArmsTech president and Decoy Octopus.

SNAKE


You don't mean...

LIQUID


*arrogantly* That's right. You were sent in here to kill us so they could retrieve Metal Gear undamaged along with the bodies of the Genome Soldiers. From the beginning, the Pentagon was just using you as a vector to spread FoxDie!

SNAKE


FoxDie...! It can't be! Are you telling me Naomi was working with the Pentagon?

LIQUID


They thought she was. But it seems that Dr. Naomi Hunter couldn't be controlled so easily.

SNAKE


What?

LIQUID


We've got a spy working in the Pentagon. He reported that Dr. Hunter altered FoxDie's program just before the operation. But... no one knows how or why.

SNAKE


I wonder... maybe they arrested her so they could find out the answer to that.

LIQUID


No doubt. But I had no idea she was motivated by such petty revenge... We still don't know what changes she made to FoxDie's program.

LIQUID


Oh well. It doesn't matter. I've already added the FoxDie vaccine to my list of White House demands.

SNAKE


There's a vaccine?

LIQUID


There must be. But that woman is the only one who really knows.

LIQUID


Anyway, it might prove to be unnecessary.

SNAKE


Why is that?

LIQUID


You were successful in coming into contact with all of us, so we must have all been exposed to the virus.

LIQUID


It's true that the ArmsTech president and Decoy Octopus were killed by FoxDie...

LIQUID


But Ocelot, myself, and you, the carrier, were apparently unaffected.

SNAKE


A bug in the virus' programming?

LIQUID


Hmm, could be. In any case, if it doesn't kill you then I'm not worried either. After all, our genetic code is identical.

SNAKE


So it's true... You and I are...

Liquid keeps an eye on Snake as he inches back.

He plants one foot in the cockpit.

Snake stands there speechless. He has no idea what Liquid is going on about.

Liquid hops into the cockpit.

Snake pulls the trigger!

*If player has ammo for the weapon; however, the bullets ricochet off of Metal Gear's mouth frame anyway.

*If player doesn't have ammo for the weapon; however, since Snake is out of ammo, the gun just dry fires.

Liquid checks the instrument panel, then punches a switch with his fist.

The mouth of the cockpit closes while Liquid is finishing his words.

Snake continues to shoot, but his small arms fire doesn't put a dent in Rex's armor.

Metal Gear stirs. It starts to emit a shrill noise, like that of a turbocharged engine. Like the prehistoric creature that gave it its name, Metal Gear Rex looks up and lets out a thunderous roar!

Then, the platform it stands on begins to slowly rise.

LIQUID


Yes, twins, but we're not ordinary twins... We're twins linked by cursed genes. Les enfants terribles.

LIQUID


You're fine. You got all the old man's dominant genes.

LIQUID


I got all the flawed, recessive genes. Everything was done so that you would be the greatest of his children. The only reason I exist is so they could create you.

SNAKE


I was the favorite, huh.

LIQUID


That's right! I'm just the leftovers of what they used to make you. Can you understand what it's like to know that you're garbage since the day you were born!?

SNAKE


...

LIQUID


But... I'm the one father chose.

SNAKE


... So that's why you're so obsessed with Big Boss. Some warped kind of love.

LIQUID


Love!? It's hate!! He always told me I was inferior and now I'll have my revenge!!

LIQUID


*scornfully laughs* You should understand me, brother. You killed our father with your own hands!

LIQUID


You stole my chance for revenge! Now I'll finish the work that father began. I will surpass him... I will destroy him!

SNAKE


You're just like Naomi. (You're obessed with genes.)

LIQUID


Well I'm not like you. Unlike you, I'm proud of the destiny that is encoded into my very genes.

LIQUID


You missed your last chance! You'll regret that forever!

LIQUID


That was your last chance to stop me!

LIQUID


Snake! Your blood will be the first to be spilt by this glorious new weapon.

LIQUID


Consider it an honor... a gift from your brother.

LIQUID


Now, I'll show you! The power of the weapon that will lead us in the 21st century!
Snake is thrown off-balance by the violent tremors.

He looks over the catwalk, down into the depths of the hangar. He can see the platform coming up toward him.

The cables, runners, and so on attached to Metal Gear fall from its body bit by bit. Sounds of grinding metal, and sparks and mini-explosions bright enough to burn retinas.

Snake watches the meaty frame of the war machine get closer and closer.

Debris and parts of all sorts drop from the ceiling. Snake hangs onto the handrail tight as he avoids getting crushed.

As seen from the cockpit, Snake shrinks to the size of a kidney bean.

The platform is now level with the 3F catwalk!

Snake jumps onto the rising platform, right before it tears the catwalk apart. The platform continues its climb.

Low-angle shot of Snake and Metal Gear on the platform.

Metal Gear's pylons, and even the claws on its feet are the size of oak trees!

Metal Gear ascends through the hole that's opened in the hangar ceiling.
Metal Gear Rex Battle 1

Gray Fox's Final Moments Cutscene (Metal Gear Hangar Door)

The radome is in flames. Visible beyond Snake's Stinger Missile launcher he still has readied, Rex has fallen to its knees and remains motionless. The radome looks burnt to a crisp.

Snake takes the Stinger off his shoulder and approaches Metal Gear, staring into the cockpit. But then, the radome comes back to life with a flurry of activity.

Rex gets back up, almost like it heard Snake. It stands tall and lets out another terrible roar! Snake, overwhelmed by the sheer size of the thing, takes a few steps back.

Rex leans forward, its head shaking at an odd angle as it brings its head toward Snake. He backs up some more, only to discover he's already at the wall. He's got nowhere to run, and Rex's mouth is closing in! Liquid's voice booms from the cockpit.

Metal Gear's mouth moves for Snake like a dinosaur hunting its prey. Out of options, Snake braces himself for what seems like the end.

But then, from out of nowhere a figure appears in front of Snake! It's the Ninja, and he stops Rex before it can crush Snake against the wall, putting all of his weight into his shoulder to hold it back.

Without thinking, Snake jumps to the right.

Rex tries to turns its head toward Snake, but the Ninja holds it firmly in place. As he continues to keep it back, the Ninja turns and looks at Snake. His helmet is open, revealing the face of Gray Fox from so long ago. His eyes still shine with the same sparks of intelligence and reason from when he and Snake worked together. In contrast with their earlier encounters, the Ninja now has a laser gun attached to his right arm.

SNAKE


It's moving...

SNAKE


How do I stop it?

SNAKE


Did that do it!?

SNAKE


Damn!!!

LIQUID


Nice try, Snake! Die!!

NINJA


Hurry!

Rex shakes its body, throwing the Ninja backward. It immediately then tries to crush it with its foot, but the Ninja jumps sideways, turns in the air, and lands, aiming his laser gun at Metal Gear as he does so.

The Ninja scores a direct hit on the radome, temporarily sending it haywire. Dodging Rex's Vulcan fire, the Ninja then tackles Snake, sending them both flying behind cover (a gutter).
The Ninja shakes his head, looking defeated.

Metal Gear discovers their hiding place.

A line of Vulcan fire booms as Rex mows down any last place the two of them could hide. Snake and the Ninja are lit up by sparks from all the ricochets.

NINJA


Get away!

SNAKE


Gray Fox!!

NINJA


A name from long ago. It sounds better than Deepthroat.

SNAKE


So it is you!?

NINJA


You look terrible, Snake. You haven't aged well.

LIQUID


I'll send you back to hell!

SNAKE


Fox, why!? What do you want from me!?

NINJA


I'm a prisoner of Death. Only you can free me...

SNAKE


Fox, stay out of this... What about Naomi? She's hell bent on taking revenge for you.

NINJA


Naomi...

SNAKE


You're the only one who can stop her.

NINJA


No... I can't.

SNAKE


Why?

NINJA


Because I'm the one who killed her parents.

SNAKE


...!!

NINJA


I was young then and couldn't bring myself to kill her too. I felt so bad that I decided to take her with me. I raised her like she was my own blood to soothe my guilty conscience. Even now she thinks of me as her brother...

SNAKE


Fox...

NINJA


From the outside, we might have seemed like a happy brother and sister. But every time I looked at her, I saw her parents' eyes staring back at me...

SNAKE


...

NINJA


Tell her for me. Tell her that I was the one who did it.

LIQUID


There you are!

The Ninja has brought some more Stinger Missiles for Snake. Not too far away from the gutter, an Item Box full of them spins in the air.

Before Snake can stop him, the Ninja rushes toward Metal Gear.

Rex, lying in wait, fires up its Vulcan cannons. The Ninja dodges the bullets using his doppelganger and other
ninpo techniques, closing in on it in the blink of an eye. However, he's unable to avoid the barrage completely and is hit by a few rounds. Sparks shoot out of his body but he presses on, managing to slide under Rex, into the blind spot of its Vulcans. The Ninja raises his gun, confident victory is at hand—until Rex's jaw pins the Ninja against the wall with the swiftness of an apex predator.
Rex's operating noise increases as its strength increases and presses the Ninja against the wall. Even more sparks shoot out of the Ninja.

The Ninja fires a barrage of laser gun blasts at the radome. They all find their target, obliterating the cluster of sensors beneath it.

Having fired all the rounds in his current energy pack, the Ninja ejects it. Metal Gear's radome is now completely out of commission. Rex has severed the Ninja's left arm, meaning he can't reload his laser gun.

Snake looks at the remains of the radome.

Metal Gear's mouth cockpit pops open, revealing Liquid at the controls. He and the Ninja trade glances as Rex's lower jaw presses him deeper into the wall. Fox coughs up blood!

Liquid can taste victory. Snake readies the Stinger. Fox turns as best he can to get a look at Snake and speaks.

Rex releases the Ninja from its jaw and takes a step back. Snake has the Stinger out, but he can't hit the cockpit from where he is. Freed from the wall, the Ninja flops to the ground with a thud.

Lying face-down, the Ninja lifts his head to look at Snake.

Wasting no time, Rex crushes the Ninja with its foot. For now, his exoskeleton protects him from the weight of the Metal Gear. He delivers his final words to Snake as the massive limb presses down on him.

NINJA


We're just about out of time. Here's a final present from Deepthroat.

NINJA


I'll stop it from moving!

SNAKE


Fox!

LIQUID


In the Middle East, we don't hunt foxes, we hunt jackals. Instead of foxhounds, we use royal harriers.

SNAKE


Fox!

LIQUID


*tauntingly* How strong is that exoskeleton of yours? Snake, are you just going to sit by and watch him die?

NINJA


A cornered fox is more dangerous than a jackal!

SNAKE


He destroyed the radome...

LIQUID


Impressive. You are indeed worthy of the codename "Fox"! But now you're finished!

NINJA


Uuunnggh...!! Now! Fire the Stinger!

SNAKE


Fox!

LIQUID


Can you really shoot? You'll kill him too!

NINJA


Now... in front of you... I can finally die...

NINJA


After Zanzibar... I was taken from the battle... Neither truly alive nor truly dead... An undying shadow in the world of lights... But soon... soon... It will... finally... end...

LIQUID


Die! Die!

NINJA


Snake, we're not tools of the government or anyone else!

NINJA


Fighting was the only thing... the only thing I was good at, but...

NINJA


At least I always fought for what I believed in...
A pool of blood spreads from Rex's foot.

Liquid applies additional power to the leg.

Fox is squashed like an insect.

Rex twists its foot to make doubly sure the Ninja is dead. From underneath it comes a small explosion and a spatter of blood.

After another booming roar, Rex shakes its head and looks squarely at Snake. Liquid can still be seen in the cockpit.

Rex opens fire with its Vulcan cannons.
Metal Gear Rex Battle 2

VS Metal Gear (Metal Gear Hangar Door)

Snake unleashes Stinger Missiles into Metal Gear's open cockpit, Liquid in full view.

Liquid groans every time he is hit.


Metal Gear Rex Battle 3


Metal Gear Explodes Cutscene (Metal Gear Hangar Door)

Snake's attacks send sparks shooting out of the cockpit.

Liquid has lost control of Metal Gear.

The machine stumbles like a drunken animal.

Snake watches it carefully as he moves closer to it.

Liquid desperately tries to control Rex, but the shower of sparks from the cockpit grows even more intense. Metal Gear staggers a few more steps, then stops and stretches up as far as it can go, almost like it's having a spasm, before falling—still outstretched— against the wall of the passageway. The impact sends more sparks everywhere, followed by an explosion. The blast wave hurls Snake back against the hangar door (wall)! He hits his head hard.

Snake's POV (with blur effect). Metal Gear has collapsed against the west wall. Black smoke rises from the cockpit, while steel beams and other fallen debris lies scattered about the ground.

A vague image of Liquid leaping from Metal Gear's cockpit onto the ground.

He walks toward Snake.

Snake loses consciousness.

Fade out.

NINJA


Snake... farewell.

SNAKE


Fooooooox!!!

LIQUID


Foolish man.

LIQUID


*spits out* He prayed for death... and it found him.

LIQUID


You see? You can't protect anyone!!

LIQUID


Not even yourself! Die!!

LIQUID


*screams*

LIQUID


Nice try!

LIQUID


Snake, I'll crush you into dust!

SNAKE


Gh...ugh!
All Questions Answered 1

Snake Wakes Up Cutscene (Atop Metal Gear – Snake's POV)

Mandatory POV mode, just like during the torture event.

Snake regains consciousness.

Fade in.

Liquid, still shirtless, is standing to Snake's right.

He walks back and forth across the top of Metal Gear as he speaks to Snake.

LIQUID


Sleeping late as usual... eh Snake?

SNAKE


Liquid... you're still alive...

LIQUID


I won't die... as long as you still live.

SNAKE


Too bad. It looks like your revolution was a failure.

LIQUID


*with fihgting spirit* Just because you've destroyed Metal Gear doesn't mean I'm done fighting.

SNAKE


Fighting? What are you really after?

LIQUID


A world where warriors like us are honored as we once were... as we should be.

SNAKE


That was Big Boss's fantasy.

LIQUID


It was his dying wish! When he was young, during the Cold War, the world needed men like us.

LIQUID


We were valued then. We were desired.

LIQUID


But things... are different now.

LIQUID


With all the liars and hypocrites running the world, war isn't what it used to be...

SNAKE


...

LIQUID


We're losing our place in a world that no longer needs us. A world that now spurns our very existence. You should know that as well as I do. After I launch this weapon and get our billion dollars, we'll be able to bring chaos and honor... back to this world gone soft.

LIQUID


Conflict will breed conflict, new hatreds will arise. Then... we'll steadily expand our sphere of influence.

SNAKE


But as long as there are people, there will always be war.

LIQUID


But the problem... is balance. Father knew what type of a balance was best...

SNAKE


Is that the only reason?

LIQUID


Isn't it reason enough? For warriors such as us.

SNAKE


I don't want that kind of world!

LIQUID


Ha! You lie! So why are you here then? Why do you continue to follow your orders while your superiors betray you? Why did you come here?

SNAKE


...

LIQUID


Well... I'll tell you then.

LIQUID


You enjoy all the killing, that's why.

SNAKE


What!?

LIQUID


*cuts off Snake* Are you denying it? Haven't you already killed most of my comrades?


All Questions Answered 2


Snake Wakes Up Cutscene (Atop Metal Gear – Third-Person)

Liquid continues his speech in front of a handcuffed Snake. A wide, overhead shot here gives the player their first idea of where Snake is in relation to his surroundings. Emphasis on the size and height of Metal Gear. Snake is shirtless.

Snake is shocked. Liquid continues, enjoying being the one to reveal all this to him.

Snake can't believe what he's hearing. Seeing the look on Snake's face, Liquid grins from ear to ear as he continues:

Shot of testing environment for DNA analysis and targeting.

SNAKE


That was...

LIQUID


*laughs* I watched your face when you did it. It was filled with the joy of battle.

SNAKE


*worked up* You're wrong!

LIQUID


There's a killer inside you... You don't have to deny it. We were created to be that way.

SNAKE


Created?

LIQUID


Les enfants terribles... the terrible children. That's what the project was called. It started in the 1970's. Their plan was to artificially create the most powerful soldier possible. The person that they chose as the model was the man known then as the greatest living soldier in the world...

SNAKE


Big Boss...

LIQUID


But father was wounded in combat and already in a coma when they brought him in. So they created us from his cells... with a combination of 20th century analog cloning and the Super Baby Method.

SNAKE


Super Baby Method?

LIQUID


They fertilized an egg with one of father's cells, and then let it divide into eight clone babies. Then they transferred the clones to someone's uterus and later intentionally aborted six of the fetuses to encourage strong fetal growth... You and I were originally octuplets.

SNAKE


Octuplets...

LIQUID


Yes. The other six of our brothers were sacrificed to make us. We were accomplices in murder before the day we were even born.

LIQUID


So it was you and I. Two fertilized eggs with exactly the same DNA. But... they weren't finished yet.

LIQUID


They used me as a guinea pig! To create a phenotype in which all of the dominant genes were expressed... to create you. I got all of the recessive genes!

LIQUID


You took everything from me before I was even born!

LIQUID


But... you and I aren't his only children.

SNAKE


What?

LIQUID


The Genome Soldiers. They too are his progeny, carrying on his genetic legacy. But they're different. They're digital.

LIQUID


With the completion of the Human Genome project the mysteries of humanity were laid bare...

LIQUID


Thanks to father's DNA, they were able to identify more than sixty "soldier genes" responsible for everything from strategic thinking... to the proverbial "killer instinct."

Third-person view atop Metal Gear.

This comes as yet another shock to Snake.

News footage of the Gulf War.

Insert visuals related to Gulf War Syndrome, etc.

Liquid continues to walk around Snake. Snake follows him with his eyes.

LIQUID


Those "soldier genes" were transplanted... into the members of the Next Generation Special Forces. That's how they became... the Genome Soldiers.

LIQUID


That's right. The Genome Soldiers that you've been killing are our brothers... with the same genes as ours.

SNAKE


The Genome Soldiers!?

LIQUID


That's right. They are our brothers, created artificially through the alignment of nucleotides to mimic our father's genes. They too are the product of numerous sacrifices.

SNAKE


Sacrifices?

LIQUID


Human experiments.

LIQUID


1991... the Gulf War. The military secretly injected soldiers with the soldier genes. The Gulf War Syndrome
5 that hundreds of thousands of returning soldiers complained about... was a side effect of it.

SNAKE


Hah. Everyone knows the Gulf War Syndrome was caused by exposure to... depleted uranium used in anti-tank rounds.

LIQUID


*scornfully laughs* That was just a cover story issued by the Pentagon. First they tried to say it was post-traumatic stress disorder, then chemical or biological weapons... The poison gas detection units and the anti-sarin injections, They were all just a cover up of this... secret genetic experiment.

SNAKE


So then... the so-called "Gulf War Babies" that have been reported by Gulf War veterans are...

LIQUID


Yes. They too are our brothers and sisters.

SNAKE


So the Genome Soldiers mean that the experiments were a success?

LIQUID


*scornfully laughs* Success? Don't be a fool! They're a complete failure!

SNAKE


?

LIQUID


We're on the verge of extinction.

SNAKE


What?

LIQUID


Have you ever heard of the Asymmetry Theory?

SNAKE


?

LIQUID


Nature tends to favor asymmetry. Those species which have gone extinct all show signs of symmetry. The Genome Soldiers suffer from the same problem... signs of symmetry. So do I, as do you.

SNAKE


!!!

LIQUID


That's right. We are all on the verge of death at the genetic level.

LIQUID


We don't know when or what type of disease will occur. That's why we need the old man's genetic information.

SNAKE


You want Big Boss's DNA so you can save your family? It's very touching.

Liquid bends down in front of Snake. The brothers glare at one another.


All Questions Answered 3


Meryl Revealed Cutscene

Liquid takes two or three steps back, then indicates behind Snake.

Snake turns his head toward the nuclear module.

Meryl is slumped over at the edge of the tilted nuclear module. She's been bound, and isn't moving. From the look of her, she could be dead, she could be alive.

(If the player submitted during the torture event, Meryl is already dead.)

LIQUID


*scornfully laughs* In Nature, family members don't mate with each other. And yet they help each other to survive. Do you know why?

LIQUID


It increases the chance that their genes will be passed on to a new generation. Altruism among blood relatives is a response to natural selection. It's called the Selfish Gene Theory.

SNAKE


You're telling me that your genes are ordering you to save the Genome Soldiers?

LIQUID


You can't fight your genes. It's fate. All living things are born for the sole purpose of passing on their parents' genes. That's why I'll follow what my genes tell me.

LIQUID


And then I'm going to go beyond. In order to break the curse of my heritage.

SNAKE


...

LIQUID


*with a calm intent to kill* And to do that... first I will kill you.

LIQUID


Look behind you!

SNAKE


Meryl!?

SNAKE


Is she alive?

LIQUID


I'm not sure. She was alive a few hours ago.

LIQUID


Poor girl kept calling your name.

SNAKE


Meryl...

LIQUID


Stupid woman. Falling in love with a man who doesn't even have a name...

SNAKE


I have a name!

LIQUID


No! We have no past, no future.

LIQUID


And even if we did, it wouldn't be truly ours. You and I are just copies of our father, Big Boss.

SNAKE


Let Meryl go!

LIQUID


As soon as we finished our business. We're almost out of time.

SNAKE


... You're talking about FoxDie?

LIQUID


No. It seems now that the Pentagon knows that Metal Gear is destroyed, they've arrived at a decision. They won't even need a BDA (battle damage assessment).

LIQUID


If you want the details why don't you ask your precious Colonel Campbell?
All Questions Answered 4

Campbell Dismissed Codec Call

Sounds of gunfire and a commotion on the other end.

SNAKE


Colonel! Can you hear me?

CAMPBELL


Yes... I'm listening.

SNAKE


What is the Pentagon trying to do!? Colonel! Answer me!

CAMPBELL


The Secretary of Defense has taken over active control of this operation. He's on his way there by AWACS.

SNAKE


What for?

CAMPBELL


To bomb the place.

SNAKE


What!?

CAMPBELL


Not only that. B-2 Bombers just lifted off from Galena Airforce Base. They're carrying B61-13 surface- piercing tactical nuclear bombs.

SNAKE


What!? Metal Gear is destroyed. Tell the Secretary of Defense!

CAMPBELL


The Secretary of Defense heard that Naomi double-crossed us and he's worried about FoxDie. Now that there's no more danger of a nuclear strike from Metal Gear, he's going to do whatever's necessary to cover up the truth of what really happened here.

SNAKE


He's going to drop a nuclear bomb to vaporize all the evidence along with anyone who knows anything...

CAMPBELL


Don't worry, Snake. I'll stop the nuclear strike.

SNAKE


How?

CAMPBELL


I may only be a figurehead here, but I'm still officially in command of this mission. If I issue an order to delay the strike, it'll confuse the chain of command and at least buy you some time. It'll give you a chance to escape!

SNAKE


But Colonel, if you do that...

CAMPBELL


It's okay, Snake... The truth is FOX-HOUND was already the subject of an undercover investigation. Meryl was transferred to this base just before the terrorist attack... as a way of manipulating me.

SNAKE


Those bastards...

CAMPBELL


I'm sorry. They forced me to cooperate in exchange for her life.

CAMPBELL


You'd better get out of there, Snake.

SNAKE


Are you sure...? It'll be bad for you.

CAMPBELL


Don't worry. It's the least I can do for you after all the lies.

SNAKE


Colonel...

CAMPBELL


I'm ordering them to cancel the bombing run. After that there's no turning back... Aaaah! What are you doing!?

MEI LING


Snake!

SNAKE


Mei Ling, what happened to the Colonel!?

MEI LING


... I don't believe it!!

SNAKE


What happened!?

There's a burst of static. The Secretary of Defense then comes on the line!

The call ends.

MEI LING


Snake, the Colonel...!!

SECRETARY OF DEFENSE


Roy Campbell has been relieved of duty.

SECRETARY OF DEFENSE


This is the Secretary of Defense, Jim Houseman.

SNAKE


Put the Colonel back on!

SECRETARY OF DEFENSE


He's been placed under arrest for leaking top-secret information and for the crime of high treason.

SNAKE


Ridiculous!

SECRETARY OF DEFENSE


Yes, he's a ridiculous man. He truly believed that he was in command of this operation.

SNAKE


You bastard...!

SECRETARY OF DEFENSE


There won't be a speck of evidence left. I'm sure the President would want the same thing.

SNAKE


The President ordered this?

SECRETARY OF DEFENSE


The President is a busy man. I have complete authority here.

SNAKE


How do you plan on explaining a nuclear attack on Alaska to the media?

SECRETARY OF DEFENSE


Don't worry. We've prepared a convincing cover story. We'll simply say that the terrorists exploded a nuclear device.

SNAKE


... Smart.

SNAKE


You'll be murdering everyone here. The scientists, the Genome Army, everyone...

SECRETARY OF DEFENSE


Donald... the DARPA Chief is already dead...

SNAKE


So you didn't mean to kill the DARPA Chief after all?

SECRETARY OF DEFENSE


He was my friend.

SNAKE


And you could care less about what happens to everybody else, huh?

SECRETARY OF DEFENSE


Well, if you give me the optic disc, I might consider saving them.

SNAKE


What are you talking about?

SECRETARY OF DEFENSE


Metal Gear's test data! Donald was supposed to bring it back.

SNAKE


I don't have it.

SECRETARY OF DEFENSE


I see. Oh well that's okay...

SECRETARY OF DEFENSE


You two are an embarrassment from the 1970's... our country's dirty little secret. You can't be allowed to live.

SECRETARY OF DEFENSE


Well, the bombs will be dropping soon, and you two have a lot of catching up to do.
All Questions Answered 5

Pre-VS Liquid Cutscene (Atop Metal Gear)

Liquid laughs as he approaches Snake.

He unlocks Snake's handcuffs.

Snake moves his wrists, warming up his muscles and joints. Liquid walks toward the nuclear module, his back to Snake.

Snake rises slowly, like he's clearing away the cobwebs.

Liquid moves briskly toward the tied-up Meryl.

With his right hand, he lifts Meryl's chin ever so slightly.

Snake doesn't know where Liquid is going with this.

Liquid lowers Meryl's chin and looks back at Snake.

Meryl is out cold, though from the way she looks, she could easily be dead.

Snake looks over the edge. It's at least a dozen meters (39 feet) to the metal floor below.

With almost superhuman agility, Liquid leaps from the nuclear module to the head of Metal Gear.

Liquid gets into a fighting stance. Snake follows suit.

LIQUID


There's no way out for us.

LIQUID


Let's finish this before the air strike.

LIQUID


You stole everything from me.

LIQUID


Only your death can satisfy me. Only your death can return to me what is rightly mine.

LIQUID


She'll make a beautiful sacrifice for our final battle.

LIQUID


Do you see this?

LIQUID


It will be the time limit for our final battle.

LIQUID


This nuclear module is set to detonate at the precise moment of her death.

LIQUID


If you win... you might still be able to save her.

LIQUID


You could enjoy one brief moment of love... before the end.

LIQUID


If you cross this line, you'll fall. At this height, it will kill even you.

LIQUID


Have at you, Snake!
The Final Battle 1

Meryl (Dead) Reunion Cutscene (Atop Metal Gear)

*If the player submitted during the torture event, Meryl was already dead

Snake runs over to Meryl and undoes her restraints. He catches her as she falls to the ground... her body cold.

Snake places his hand on Meryl's cheek. He nervously runs his fingers down to her neck.

She has no pulse. Meryl is dead.

Snake tilts his head back and shouts, his voice reaching every corner of the empty area. He holds Meryl tight atop the nuclear warhead, his body shaking.

Snake lays Meryl down on the ground.
