Her body crumples like a broken doll. There will be no delayed awakening, no familiar voice that washes away the pain in an instant—Meryl is gone.

Snake pounds his fist into the ground.

Snake keeps on hitting the ground as he continues to shout:

Snake is already tearing up.

Snake holds Meryl tight once more, burying his face in her cold, silent chest.

Suddenly, Otacon's voice echoes throughout the void.

Otacon deactivates his stealth camouflage, quietly popping into view.

Neither angry nor consoling, Otacon merely speaks in a peaceful tone, no expression on his face.

SNAKE


Meryl?

SNAKE


... Meryl?

SNAKE


Meryyyyyyyyl!!

SNAKE


... Forgive me.

SNAKE


Damn!

SNAKE


I gave in to my fear! I gave in to my pain! I sold your life to save my own...

SNAKE


I'm a loser. I'm not the hero you thought I was!

SNAKE


... I'm nothing!!!

SNAKE


Meryl, I'm sorry! Forgive me!

OTACON


Meryl can't forgive anyone anymore.

SNAKE


Otacon?

OTACON


She's gone, Snake...

SNAKE


... Because of me...

OTACON


I guess blaming yourself makes it easier, huh. If you do that, you can keep the pain at a nice, safe distance.

SNAKE


What the hell do you know! Meryl's dead! I lost!

OTACON


So... are you gonna stay here and die? Along with her?

SNAKE


...

OTACON


Snake... people die. But death is not defeat. That's what Hemingway said.

SNAKE


...

OTACON


I lost Wolf too. But that wasn't defeat.

OTACON


She and I will be together forever. We didn't lose anything.

SNAKE


Together forever?
Snake lays Meryl back down.

Snake continues to look at Meryl in silence.

Otacon gently places a hand on Snake's shoulder.

Snake is taken aback by Otacon's change in demeanor.

Otacon raises his hands and speaks with optimism:

Suddenly, there is a resounding boom—the air strike has begun. Otacon looks up at the ceiling as it's violently jolted and mutters:
A second set of vibrations, this time even stronger. Then a third. The gap between explosions becomes smaller.

Snake looks at this new Otacon and agrees it's time to leave the past behind.

Snake stands up and takes one last look at Meryl.

In front of Rex's legs.

Snake and Otacon are back on the ground. They head for the door by Rex's feet.

Snake spots his Sneaking Suit lying on the ground in the shadow of one of Rex's humongous legs.

Snake steps behind cover to put it on.

The base is hit by another massive blast. Otacon looks up at the ceiling nervously. Metal Gear has really started to tilt now from all the shaking. Bit by bit it slides down the wall keeping it up.

Snake reappears. He's back in his Sneaking Suit.

They move through the small passageway door. A moment later, Metal Gear collapses in front of it!

OTACON


It's true that Wolf is dead, but our love didn't die with her...

OTACON


Life's more than just a game of win or lose. Don't you think?

SNAKE


...

OTACON


Let's live, Snake.

OTACON


There's a parking garage right next door. We can get to the surface from there. C'mon.

OTACON


I released all the security locks. It'll be okay. We can escape...

OTACON


You have my word on it.

SNAKE


Otacon... you've changed.

OTACON


I'm through regretting the past...

OTACON


Life isn't all about loss, y'know.

OTACON


It's started. Those guys... seems like they only hurry when they're destroying things.

OTACON


Good... Let 'em destroy it. But they can't destroy the human spirit.

SNAKE


Okay. Let's go!

SNAKE


Meryl... I hope you're still watching me...

SNAKE


Maybe I can prove myself to you after all...

SNAKE


Come on, hustle!

OTACON


Snake, it's cold outside. You'll freeze like that.

SNAKE


My Sneaking Suit!

OTACON


You better hurry...

OTACON


Hurry!

OTACON


Now you look like yourself again.
The Final Battle 2

Meryl (Alive) Reunion Cutscene (Atop Metal Gear)

*If the player did not submit during the torture event, Meryl is alive

Snake runs over to Meryl and undoes her restraints. He catches her as she falls to the ground.

Snake places his hand on Meryl's cheek.

A moment or two later, Meryl wakes up.

Her vision is still blurry.

Seeing it really is Snake, Meryl gives him a big hug.

She stays like this for a bit, her arms wrapped around Snake, overjoyed to be with him again.

Meryl wears her heart on her sleeve. She's like a completely different person. Snake is perplexed by this hug.
With Snake expressing confusion, Meryl lets go of him.

Meryl slowly shakes her head, wanting to show Snake that she's a survivor.

Realizing the full scale of what Meryl was subjected to, Snake is lost for words.

Snake is impressed. His tone is one of recognition.

Meryl's head droops. Her sizable frame looks strangely small.

SNAKE


Meryl?

SNAKE


Meryl!?

MERYL


Snake?

MERYL


Is that you?

MERYL


Snake! You're alive!

MERYL


Thank God!

SNAKE


Meryl?

SNAKE


Meryl, are you okay?

MERYL


Are you okay...? Is that all you can say?

SNAKE


Meryl, it must have been terrible...

MERYL


It wasn't that bad. I didn't give in to the torture.

SNAKE


Torture?

MERYL


... And things even worse than that...

MERYL


I was fighting too. Just like you.

SNAKE


You're a strong woman.

MERYL


Fighting them... made me feel closer to you. I felt like you were there with me. It gave me the strength to go on.

MERYL


But I was scared.
Snake realizes that Meryl isn't a warrior like himself—she's just a scared girl trying to look tough.

Meryl lifts her head and stares at Snake. In her teary eyes, all the emotions she's been holding in until now come bursting through.

Snake and Meryl look into each other's eyes.

They're interrupted by the sound of Snake's Codec ringing.

Snake answers it.
The Final Battle 3

Post-Meryl Alive Reunion Codec Call

SNAKE


... I'm sorry.

MERYL


Don't say that...

SNAKE


...

MERYL


But it made me realize something. During all the pain and shame there was one thing I was sure of... A single hope that I held onto... And that hope kept me alive...

MERYL


*crying a little* Snake, I wanted to see you again...

SNAKE


Meryl...

MERYL


!!!

SNAKE


... That's my Codec.

OTACON


Snake, it's me.

SNAKE


Otacon, good news. Meryl's okay.

OTACON


All right!!! You saved her, man. Good job!

SNAKE


I got some bad news too. We're about to be bombed.

OTACON


Oh boy. I guess we're considered expendable.

SNAKE


Is there a way out of here?

OTACON


A way out...? Uh, yeah. You can take the loading tunnel to the surface.

OTACON


There's a parking garage right next to you. The tunnel leads from there to the surface.

SNAKE


The door in front?

OTACON


No. It's a small entrance to the west of that door.

SNAKE


How about the security?

OTACON


I just unlocked it. Who do you think you're talking to? I'll take care of security along your escape route too...

SNAKE


What are you going to do?

OTACON


Me? I... I'll stay here.

OTACON


Are you crazy!? I need a little more time to take care of your escape route.

SNAKE


But...

Snake ends the call.
The Final Battle 4

Escape with Meryl Cutscene (Atop Metal Gear)

Meryl pretends she didn't listen to the conversation, but she's worried. After a bit of silence, Snake is the first to speak.

Snake quietly shakes his head.

Snake takes Meryl by the hand, and they come down from the nuclear module.

In front of Rex's legs.

Meryl jumps down from Rex's leg. Snake catches her and keeps holding her in his arms. Meryl places her hands around Snake's neck. They look at each other. Snake's arms come under strain.

OTACON


Unlocking the security doors is difficult work. Only I can do it.

SNAKE


Otacon?

OTACON


Don't worry. I'm staying here. It's my own decision.

SNAKE


Otacon, this is a hardened shelter, but they're going to use a surface piercing nuclear bomb. It won't hold.

OTACON


I'm through regretting the past...

OTACON


Life isn't all about loss, y'know...

SNAKE


...

OTACON


Snake, I'm a complete person now. I've found a reason to live.

SNAKE


Good. Don't die on me.

OTACON


Same to you. Take care of Meryl, okay.

SNAKE


I will...

OTACON


Okay I gotta go. I promise I'll do something about your escape route.

SNAKE


Thanks.

OTACON


"Thanks"... Oh, that sounds nice.

SNAKE


... I believe in you.

OTACON


Thanks, Snake.

SNAKE


Let's get the hell out of here.

MERYL


... What about him...?

MERYL


Where is Otacon!?

SNAKE


He's... He's... fighting right now...

SNAKE


With his old self... to be the man he wants to be.

MERYL


He's fighting for us too?

SNAKE


Yeah, and I don't want it to be in vain.

MERYL


... Me too.

This is the first time things have gotten romantic between them. Their faces close in on each other's.

Suddenly, there is a resounding boom—the air strike has begun. Snake looks up at the ceiling as it's violently jolted and mutters.

The shaking spreads to the underground base. Snake almost loses his balance.

Snake puts Meryl down.

Meryl pokes Snake in the chest and smiles.

A second set of vibrations.

This one is even stronger

Then a third. The gap between explosions becomes smaller.
Snake spots his Sneaking Suit lying on the ground in the shadow of one of Rex's humongous legs.

Snake steps behind cover to put it on.

The base is hit by another, massive blast. Meryl looks up at the ceiling nervously.

Metal Gear has really started to tilt now from all the shaking.

Bit by bit it slides down the wall keeping it up.

Snake reappears.

He's back in his Sneaking Suit.

They move through the small passageway door.

A moment later, Metal Gear collapses in front of it!

SNAKE


Meryl.

MERYL


... Snake.

SNAKE


Meryl. It's started...

MERYL


I must be heavy...

SNAKE


It looks like we're not gonna have a love scene after all.

MERYL


Looks that way. Too bad...

SNAKE


Let's get out of here!

MERYL


Snake, it's freezing outside. You need some clothes.

SNAKE


There's my Sneaking Suit!

MERYL


Hurry up.

MERYL


Hurry!

MERYL


Hmm... Looking good, Snake.

MERYL


Hurry!
Escape 1

Taking Off in the Jeep (Jeep Parking Lot)

On the other side of the door next to Metal Gear's wreckage is a parking lot with two jeeps. It's a small, square space about 10 meters (33 feet) long in each direction. The escape route extends to the north of the parking lot. It's just wide enough for two vehicles to drive side by side.

There's no sign of anyone in the parking lot. A simple barricade is positioned between the parking spaces and the escape route.

*If Meryl is dead, Otacon drives and Snake shoots

*If Meryl is alive, Meryl drives and Snake shoots

Otacon/Meryl jumps in the jeep.

Snake and his companion take the jeep on the left, but first, Otacon/Meryl checks the driver's side of the jeep on the right.

Next, Otacon/Meryl runs over to check the jeep on the left.

Otacon/Meryl tries to start it up, but the engine won't turn over. Hearing the noise, several soldiers pour into the parking lot and open fire.

Snake battles the enemies until his companion can get the jeep started.

When Snake approaches the jeep, he automatically jumps into the back, where there's a mounted gun.
The player can use this gun to mow down enemies. If the player doesn't get into the jeep after the engine has been started, either of the following lines is spoken:

After the engine starts and Snake jumps into the back, the jeep takes off, complete with a cinematic touch—its tires spinning as fast as they can and giving off smoke. Snake's companion floors it toward the barricade.

They bust through the barricade and begin their escape.

For a while, it looks like no one's following them. The road continues in a straight line, and there are no enemies, traps, or anything else, in fact.

However, the explosions and shaking from the air strike grow ever stronger.


Escape 2


Liquid in Pursuit (Escape Route)

Suddenly, Liquid comes racing up behind them in the other jeep.

He holds a FAMAS in one hand and the steering wheel with the other.

Snake swings the machine gun around at Liquid.

OTACON


I'll drive!

MERYL


I'll drive!

OTACON


Darn! No keys!

MERYL


Damn! No keys!

OTACON


I got 'em! Let's go!

MERYL


All right! Keys!!

OTACON


I got it! Snake, jump in!

MERYL


I got it, Snake! Jump in!!

OTACON


Snake, hurry! Get in!

MERYL


Snake, hurry! Get in!

OTACON


Snake, hold on!!

MERYL


Snake, hold on!

LIQUID


Not yet, Snake!

LIQUID


It's not over yet!

SNAKE


Liquid!!
Escape 3

Crash Cutscene (Escape Route – Home Stretch)

It's the home stretch. Liquid is persistent, continuing to fire at the other jeep. Incredibly, the air strike, which was becoming more and more intense, appears to have stopped.

Up ahead, the exit can be seen.

Liquid floors it, overtaking Snake's jeep.

Liquid is now in front of Snake's jeep. They're right at the exit.

Liquid turns the wheel hard, trying to flip the jeep.

But Liquid's jeep slows down, and Snake and his companion's jeep slams into the side of it!

Jeep POV of Snake's jeep crashing into Liquid's!

Fade to white.
Footnotes

1
See the related Nastasha Codec calls for details (p. 520).
2
A type of cell that surrounds and removes viruses and other foreign material that has invaded the body.
3
A category of proteins that act as intercellular transmitters, responsible for controlling cell multiplication, division, death, and other functions.
4
When a cell's DNA becomes damaged or the cell is no longer needed by the body, it disintegrates in a process that resembles suicide. This is referred to as apoptosis.
5
A group of symptoms reported by some soldiers who served in the 1990-1991 Gulf War. They can include headache, fatigue, and insomnia, though their cause has yet to be determined.

OTACON


Snake, look! Daylight!

MERYL


Look, Snake! Daylight!

OTACON


Hold on!!

MERYL


We're gonna crash!!

SNAKE


*screams*

OTACON


*screams*

MERYL


*screams*

LIQUID


*screams*

Prior to Raven Battle

Blast furnace – basics

*First time only

*Before finding elevator

*After finding elevator

Blast furnace – can't use elevator

Blast furnace – boiler room

*First time only

In front of cargo elevator (top)

Cargo elevator (top) – in front of control panel

*First time only

CAMPBELL


Snake, that's a blast furnace.

SNAKE


A blast furnace? What do they use that for?

CAMPBELL


There's no airport on the base, so it's hard to bring in supplies.They must have built a blast furnace so they could make building materials and such.

SNAKE


That makes sense. Whew, I'm starting to sweat. It's getting kind of warm.

NAOMI


Be careful, you're just recovering from a cold...

CAMPBELL


The entrance to the underground base is further below. There should be a cargo elevator that you can take down somewhere around there. Try to find it.

CAMPBELL


The elevator to the underground base was in the northeast of the bottom floor. Right, Snake?

SNAKE


Colonel, there's an elevator, but it's stuck on a floor below.

CAMPBELL


That elevator can probably only be moved from below.

CAMPBELL


There must be some other way down. Look around.

NAOMI


Dr. Emmerich knows the base well. Why don't you ask him?

CAMPBELL


Watch out for the steam. It's dangerous. Use your First Person View Mode to see where the steam is coming out and then avoid it.

SNAKE


Yeah. I like a sauna now and then, but this is too much.

CAMPBELL


Snake, isn't that the elevator that goes down to Metal Gear's underground base?

SNAKE


Yeah, but there's no button for calling the elevator.

CAMPBELL


Maybe it'll come if you wait.

NAOMI


Why don't you ask Dr. Emmerich?

CAMPBELL


Metal Gear is straight down. Better move it!

CAMPBELL


There's no time. The terrorists are ready to launch.

SNAKE


Negotiations are all finished?

CAMPBELL


The government can't cave in to terrorist's demands.

SNAKE


But they're threatening to launch a nuclear weapon!

Prior to Entering Metal Gear Hangar

Underground warehouse – Raven battle

*First time only
*Second and subsequent times – A, B, or C, at random

(A)

(B)

•Campbell


Prior to Metal Gear Battle

Underground base – before Naomi's confession

*First time only

NAOMI


Vulcan Raven is half Native Alaskan American and half Inuit. He was raised as a shaman and they say he has supernatural powers.

NAOMI


During the Cold War, he trained in Russia with the Bimpel, the Soviet special forces.

NAOMI


In 1993, he was demoted by President Yeltsin following his coup d'etat. So he fled the country and became a mercenary.

NAOMI


After that, he joined those rent-a-war bastards at "Outer Heaven Inc." He stayed there until he joined us in FOX-HOUND, thanks to a strong recommendation from Revolver Ocelot.

CAMPBELL


That cannon he's holding is a 20 millimeter Vulcan gun. You usually see them mounted on fighter planes. You can't take him on in a fire fight. He'll make mincemeat of you.

NAOMI


He's not just strong, Snake. He's a graduate emeritus from Alaska University, so he's a quick thinker, too.

CAMPBELL


In any case, you'd better not try to attack him from the front. Normal weapons are no match for his 20 millimeter Vulcan. Try to attack him from the sides or behind.

CAMPBELL


You're at a disadvantage in a frontal assault. Try attacking him with a Remote-Controlled Missile. Maneuver it between the containers to get it to come up behind him.

CAMPBELL


But if you fly the missiles too slow, they'll get shot down even if they approach him from behind. Try to get them close by flying them at top speed, or by maneuvering them around corners.

CAMPBELL


When the containers get destroyed, they'll block your way. Try to take him out before that happens.

CAMPBELL


You could also try to predict where he's gonna move and set up some C-4. If your timing is good, it might work.

CAMPBELL


Snake, if it's about Naomi, I'm looking into the matter right now. Give me a little more time.

SNAKE


Where is she?

CAMPBELL


She's still sleeping.

SNAKE


I can't believe it... First, the DARPA Chief turns out to be an imposter and now Naomi... What the hell is going on here?

Underground base – basics

*If player has heard location of control room from Otacon

*If player hasn't heard location of control room from Otacon

Somewhere other than underground base

Underground base – drainage ditch
Underground base – if player has killed a certain number of rats or more
*If player goes on to kill more rats

Underground base – retrieve PAL Key

*If player calls near drainage ditch

*If a rat has eaten the key

After player hears about rats from Miller:

SNAKE


I suppose you're going to tell me you don't know anything, right?

CAMPBELL


I'm sorry, Snake.

SNAKE


A madman is threatening the world with a nuclear weapon. I guess that's what I should worry about now...

CAMPBELL


Snake, stop that launch. Head for the Control Room in the underground base.

CAMPBELL


The Control Room is on the third floor of the underground base, isn't it?

CAMPBELL


Give Dr. Emmerich a call.

CAMPBELL


There's no time!

CAMPBELL


Snake, hurry up and get to Metal Gear's underground base. It's north of the warehouse where you fought Raven.

CAMPBELL


Snake, that water is contaminated with nuclear waste material. If you go in there, you'll take damage.

SNAKE


Nuclear waste?

CAMPBELL


They were extremely careless with their handling of nuclear materials. Nastasha knows all about that if you want more info.

CAMPBELL


Snake, we don't need a rat trap. We need someone to stop that God damned nuke from getting launched!

NAOMI


Snake, is killing rats really that fun? Torturing small animals is a sign of a warped mind, you know.

CAMPBELL


Snake, they've input both detonation codes. The only way to stop the launch now is to use the card key to re-input the codes.

CAMPBELL


Find that key! It fell somewhere in that drainage ditch!

CAMPBELL


Use your Mine Detector.

SNAKE


Mine Detector?

CAMPBELL


Yes. The Mine Detector works just like a metal detector. The position of the card key should show up on your radar screen.

CAMPBELL


Snake, get that card key back from the rat. Why don't you watch its route and set up a trap for it with the C4 or something.
Underground base – after retrieving PAL Key
If PAL Key is something other than room temperature

Control room – watch out for the surveillance cameras

*If player has chaff grenades

*If player has a cardboard box

After inputting room temperature key, before freezing key

After freezing key, before inputting it
If frozen key returns to room temperature
If key gets warmed instead

*After Codec call where it's revealed Naomi is a spy

After warming key, before inputting it

If key gets frozen instead

CAMPBELL


You got the card key... Good. Now get back to the Control Room and use that key to re-input the PAL codes. Stop that launch!

CAMPBELL


Snake, the card key changed shape. That's no good. Change it back.

CAMPBELL


Snake, the surveillance camera... When you insert the card key, don't let it see you.

CAMPBELL


Try using your Chaff.

CAMPBELL


You could probably use a Box too.

CAMPBELL


You've got to lower that card key's temperature. Find someplace cold!

CAMPBELL


Good. The card key changed shape. Hurry up to the control room, Snake!

CAMPBELL


Snake, look at the card key. It changed to its original shape. You'll have to change it again.

CAMPBELL


Snake, don't warm that card key. Cool it down. Find someplace cool.

CAMPBELL


Now you've got to warm the key up. Find someplace hot!

SNAKE


What about Naomi?

CAMPBELL


Sorry, Snake...I'm still investigating.

CAMPBELL


The key changed shape. Hurry to the Control Room and input it.

CAMPBELL


Snake, what are you doing? You're supposed to warm it, not cool it. Look for a warm place.

CAMPBELL


Please, Snake.

CAMPBELL


I consider you my friend. Please believe that.

SNAKE

CAMPBELL

CAMPBELL


Snake, gas! Do something!

CAMPBELL

CAMPBELL


Snake, Emmerich will be able to open the door. Just trust him and hang on!

CAMPBELL


Snake, what are you doing? Go after Liquid!

CAMPBELL


What the hell are you doing, Snake!? You've got to stop Metal Gear!

CAMPBELL


God help us! Metal Gear is moving...

CAMPBELL

CAMPBELL

CAMPBELL

•Mei Ling


Prior to Entering Metal Gear Hangar

After Post-Raven's Death Codec call

SNAKE


Colonel, Fox is dead...

CAMPBELL


*sorrowfully* I know... God rest his soul. Even a soldier needs more to live for than just fighting. Maybe if he had found something else, he wouldn't have been so haunted...

SNAKE


He was too simple... too pure. There was nothing in this world for him to believe in... so he chose to believe only in himself.

CAMPBELL


I guess you're right. A man like Fox is really only looking for his death...

SNAKE


Yeah. But if you ask me, there's no happiness to be gained in death... No peace either.

SNAKE


*determined* I'm gonna leave here alive.

CAMPBELL


*with hope* Good. I want that too.

CAMPBELL


If you can shoot a Stinger Missile directly into the cockpit, maybe you can destroy it. C'mon, Snake! Win!

SNAKE


Mei Ling, how's Naomi?

MEI LING


*confused* Huh? She's fine, I guess. What's up?

SNAKE


Oh...

MEI LING


*a bit jealous* What do you want, Snake? If you want to talk to Naomi, why don't you call her?

SNAKE


Oh it's nothing... Forget about it.

MEI LING


Strange guy...

SNAKE


... Naomi wasn't acting strangely or anything?

MEI LING


No... I just can't believe that Naomi's an enemy spy. I refuse to accept that.

SNAKE


I don't want to believe it either, but...

MEI LING


*with refusal* Don't say it, Snake.

Metal Gear battle – before calling Otacon

*On odd-numbered calls

*On even-numbered calls

NASTASHA


It looks like, Raven's holding an M61A1 20 mm multi-turreted machine gun. They're usually mounted on F16s.

NASTASHA


With its 6 rotating turrets, it can fire 4000 20 mm rounds per minute. And it's accurate, too. If you come at him from the front he will turn you into borscht.

NASTASHA


Stay out of his way. You have to hide and attack. Try a Remote Controlled Missile or your C4 explosives.

SNAKE


Nastasha, I'm going to ask you one more time. Do you know anything about FoxDie and the real nature of this operation?

NASTASHA


Sorry. I have not been told anything about that.

SNAKE


That's funny. The Colonel said almost exactly the same thing.

NASTASHA


...

SNAKE


Sorry. I didn't mean to sound sarcastic. I believe you...

NASTASHA


Snake, you are in danger! Get out of there!

SNAKE


Yeah but how?

NASTASHA


Isn't there someone who knows this base...? Dr. Emmerich! Maybe he can do something.

NASTASHA


All you can do is wait for Dr. Emmerich to open the door. Stay alive, Snake.

NASTASHA


Snake, what are you doing? Go after Liquid!

NASTASHA


I am a military analyst and an expert on high-tech weapons, but I do not know anything about Metal Gear.

NASTASHA


Why don't you ask Dr. Emmerich?

NASTASHA


It probably uses some kind of electronic targeting equipment similar to a tank. If you use Chaff, you should be able to confuse it for a little while.

Prior to Raven Battle

Cargo elevator (bottom) – while moving

*First time only

*Shared

NASTASHA


Radome stands for radar dome. It is a cover protecting a super-sensitive electronic scanning array. Almost all modern combat aircraft have them.

NASTASHA


It is not just a radar system in there. That radome probably contains infrared sensors, motion detectors, and other equipment, too.

NASTASHA


It is like a combination of eyes, ears, and nose all rolled into one. If you could destroy that you might have a chance...

NASTASHA


Use your Stinger Missiles carefully. If you run out, you'll have no chance to win.

NASTASHA


Snake, it is just you and Liquid now. There's no advice I can give you.

NASTASHA


Trust yourself! You have got to win!!

MASTER


Naturally, in an enclosed room, your motion is limited. But that doesn't mean that you should stand still and become a human target. You can win if you watch how your enemy moves and then cleverly counter it.

SNAKE


There are a lot of crows around here...

MASTER


Those aren't crows, those are Northern Ravens. The Inuit and other native Americans worshipped Northern Ravens as creator deities.

MASTER


Some say that ravens have the power to predict death. The great poet Marlowe wrote about them in the 16th century. "Thus like the sad presaging raven that tolls the sick man's passport in her hollow beak, And in the shadow of the silent night doth shake contagion from her sable wings."

SNAKE


That's pretty gloomy, Master.

MASTER


By the way...

SNAKE


What?
*Second time only

*Third time only

Naomi the spy – after Codec call

Cargo elevator (bottom) – ravens' nest

*Shared
•Master

Prior to Entering Metal Gear Hangar

Underground warehouse – Raven battle

*First time only

*Second and subsequent times – A, B, or C, at random

(A)

*If they've already frozen

(B)

(C)

MASTER


Legends say that crows have three times the life span of a man, and that ravens have three times the life span of a crow.

MASTER


That's just an old wives' tale, but it's true that crows live longer than many types of birds. Northern Ravens can live pretty close to 70 years.

MASTER


Ravens will eat vegetables, meat, garbage... pretty much anything. It seems dirty to us, but that's what allows them to live even in a climate like this.

SNAKE


I want to ask you about Naomi.

MASTER


I'm looking into the details now, but it doesn't look good. Weren't you ever suspicious about her, Snake?

SNAKE


...

MASTER


... Snake, keep your guard up.

MASTER


That place is right in the middle of the permafrost. Just like the name says, it never melts. I've heard over 85% of Alaska is permafrost.

MASTER


It's extremely cold there, Snake. If you don't hurry, your C-rations will freeze.

MASTER


One way to prevent your C-rations from freezing is to hold them close to your body by equipping them.

MASTER


It's extremely cold there, Snake. If you don't hurry, your C-rations will freeze.

MASTER


One way to prevent your C-rations from freezing is to hold them close to your body by equipping them.

SNAKE


They're already frozen.

MASTER


You can warn them up by equipping them. After a while, they should be okay to eat.

MASTER


An Native Alaskan American, huh? Probably Athapaskan. They're originally from the same tribe as the Apaches and Navajos of New Mexico.

MASTER


Anthropologically, they're related to the Japanese. There are even linguistic similarities between Athapaskan languages and ancient Japanese. You and he probably share many of the same ancestors.

SNAKE


... Master, I don't remember telling you that I was part Japanese...

MASTER


...

MASTER


The Four Man carry is a race where you have to run with four grown men hanging from a long stick that you carry on your back. Apparently Raven does it with six men.

Underground base – after retrieving PAL Key

MASTER


Snake, I'm sure that woman calling herself Naomi is some type of spy. And now I'm starting to think that Campbell might be hiding something too. Don't trust him.

MASTER


Snake, isn't the detonation code input system in the Control Room? Hurry up and get in there!

MASTER


You lost the key? Hurry up and find it! They've already entered the detonation code!

MASTER


The only way to stop that launch is to lock the system by re-inputting the detonation codes.

MASTER


If you use the Mine Detector, you should be able to find the key even if it fell into the drainage ditch. Whatever you do, find that key!

MASTER


Snake, did you find the key?

SNAKE


No, it's not here.

MASTER


Don't be ridiculous. You saw it fall into the drainage ditch, didn't you?

MASTER


The drainage ditch... Isn't there something odd about it?

SNAKE


No. There are a lot of big rats though...

MASTER


That's it, Snake! A rat must have eaten it!

SNAKE


Now, who's being ridiculous!

MASTER


No, I'm right. There's no other possibility. Rats eat all sorts of things. There's nothing unusual about that.

MASTER


Snake, a rat ate that key. You'll have to get it back. Follow the rat's route!

MASTER


You got the card key back? Good job. Now hurry to the Control Room.

Cargo elevator (top) – before it's moving

Cargo elevator (top) – enemy ambush

Before cargo elevator (top) battle

*First time only

OTACON


There's a cargo elevator in the northeast part of the bottom floor. You can take that to Metal Gear's underground base. You'll spot it right away. It's got a big patrol light attached to it.

SNAKE


The elevator is stopped at a lower floor and it won't come up. Is there some way to get to an elevator that will take me down further?

OTACON


Well... there is one, but...

SNAKE


Where?

OTACON


Can you see to the west of the blast furnace?

OTACON


You see that crane? I think if you go down those steps, you'll get to the other side.

SNAKE


Did you ever see anyone actually go down there?

OTACON


No, but I've seen mice go there.

SNAKE


Do I look like a mouse to you?

OTACON


Be careful of that crane, too.

OTACON


If you stick close to those steps, I think you can make it to the other side... probably.

OTACON


Are you in the boiler room? Those pipes are really old. Once in a while they blow out steam, so be careful.

SNAKE


You call this once in a while?

OTACON


If you take that cargo elevator down, you'll wind up in Metal Gear's underground maintenance base.

OTACON


It's automatically set to go back and forth between the blast furnace and the underground maintenance base. It's not there yet, so you'll just have to wait.

OTACON


Snake, the elevator won't move unless you push the switch. There's a control panel, right? Get closer and press the Action Button.

OTACON


Snake, there's nowhere to hide in that elevator. You'll have to fight!

OTACON


That elevator is for transporting vehicles and building materials to the underground maintenance base.

SNAKE


So that's why it's so big.

OTACON


The elevator you're on right now is the No.1 elevator. That elevator won't take you down all the way, so you'll have to switch to the No.2 elevator at the relay point.
Cargo elevator transfer point

*Second and subsequent times
